LcmE1-kg-1d_aFfmZC7neg.text: Awesome food and service as usual at the THC! We eat here all the time and even in Asheville but William is by far our favorite server ever here!!! Although he had less hair then our infant who kept mean mugging him the entire time. ;)

WT1iy_kX-ns_jKkHWDpiVw.text: Just had a fabulous lunch! Everything was delicious--only surpassed by our server--Bailey! Great service and great food. A must restaurant visit

cQoMdoaQt4UrajYqk_1wHQ.text: The  Mac & Cheese alone is one of their better dishes, adding shrimp is icing on the cake. Had this dish with steamed chopped greens ooooh lala!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States

at0HPp5vGGN-fo-FygzfnA.text: It was ok, but my southern grandma makes far better fired chicken which kinda killed the place for me! the southern biscuits were on point but other then that I would really try and find a local more down home restaurant !

lO2Og7IJOhR9wgtPTc5XXw.text: Shrimp and grits was amazing. I ordered the frose which was so good! A little on the expensive side

CK_NR0PC3PrPLk7NA41Omg.text: We had a large party and had a great time! Love the food and atmosphere.  We had an amazing server Jonathan. Would definitely recommend.

nx3_mEm-pCK_3X1gfxzgVA.text: Late Sunday dinner/snack and drinks. I heard good things about this place, so was looking forward to the experience. Biscuits with honey before our meal were awesome... really flakey and fresh! The Mac and Cheese was A-OK... the drinks were nothing to write home about...overall it was a good experience once I was able to find the entrance (completely blocked due to construction). I might come back if I am in the area again.

-HJQHJjI8C50YbzmKQ7Jpg.text: We love it here. Great food, good environment. Love the fried green tomatoes. Expect a wait b/c it's good.

PodQyXe4RrJydDP2wMtrMA.text: I was ecstatic to hear my favorite Asheville place was opening in Charlotte but found that it's just nowhere near the quality of the Asheville location. On my first visit, none of the food was warm and the service was very slow. The biscuits were dry and the food was near flavorless. On my second visit, I ordered the fried chicken and received a fried patty of mush or fat - I'm not entirely sure (even the waiter was repulsed by it). The manager not only replaced my chicken, but brought me an entire meal to go - one that was much better.

ygo1CmSX7prd8Os6ru84Tw.text: Biscuits and jam. 'Enough said. You get these served complimentary after you order. Delightfully fluffy yet filling in every bit. The jam will coat your teeth, it is so sugary sweet but tart! If ordering brunch I recommend switching out the home fries (which are delicious) for the sliced tomatoes (even more delicious) but a healthier choice. Perfect amount of food if you make this swap, otherwise you won't need to eat the rest of the day. Parking can be a pain if you go during Sunday or Saturday brunch, just go slow and be patient, you'll find a spot. Line always moves quicker then they say it will.

7TRYe_QzFpgOlTV45S4xLg.text: Can't go wrong with this place! Delicious southern food in a relaxed atmosphere. Our waiter Jonathan was very helpful and attentive. A must eat restaurant while in Charlotte.

W0fozKJXhrtB-DNeXNSKiQ.text: We love Tupelo Cafe for its unique menu and outstanding food. Our server William was wonderful.

GYNbkQnMu9mphI8fG0vPBQ.text: Best shrimp and grits I've ever eaten. Amazing food all the way around. CARLEY seriously was the best waitress ever. She was honest, told me what she didn't like and helped make my first ever experience here perfect!

e2regfPf-EO2_nc99kJ47w.text: Not bad, especially for a quick Saturday brunch.  Parking is difficult.  I recommend taking the train. Don't go at night.

eRfeMK7g9VUNy7VISHEs_g.text: Delicious brunch. And just went there for lunch and hit the southern belle grilled cheese. I don't know how a grilled cheese could be that delicious but it was the best. And the service was fantastic!

MomX-7PnXe7gJf4xDzsf3w.text: I couldn't find a good vegetarian and gluten free friendly place in Charlotte until a friend mentioned yelp and I found the Tupelo Honey Cafe. I ordered the shrimp and grits made with goats milk and the goats milk was kinda sour. It had red peppers on it and I think it over powered the beauty of the grits. I recommend the fried chicken and biscuits, there amazing. It has an egg on top and gravy. It was well seasoned and flavorful. I also recommend the grilled cheese it has homemade tomato sauce. They make there own line of honeys, sauces, and jellies. They are also homemade and delicious! They gave us some biscuits on the house to eat while we wait and they were very salty on their own but with the sweet blueberry jelly it's a perfect biscuit.

y6Low5ILCL4_wXVlAmTUZg.text: Went here for brunch the other weekend. I had the Lavender Honey Flip and Bloody Mary for drinks. The Lavender Honey Flip is refreshing and not sweet at all. The Bloody Mary is on point and has just the right amount of spice. I ordered the fried chicken meal for my entree and got the shaved brussel sprout salad as my side. Can I just say the biscuits are AMAZING with the blueberry jam that they served?! The fried chicken was great, a good ratio between breading and chicken. The kale and carrot side (that comes standard with entrees) and the brussel sprout side were both refreshing and tasty. One of my friends ordered the hash browns which came out a little too salty. Our server was kind enough to take it off the menu. Great atmosphere and love the food and staff!

Q0_S8l8pTvWhzBp88lYcUg.text: By far my best dining experience in recent memory, and that's ever - not just in Charlotte. Having known about the original in Asheville, I admittedly had high expectations. And WOW were they fulfilled! Above and beyond. Some of the staff is still new (they have experienced training staff on board for their opening weeks to smoothen the transition), but what a couple of them may lack in savvy waiter quickness and intuition, they make up for it with passion for the food and a genuine eagerness to please their customers. Truly a great experience every time I go - THC opened in early December and I've been 4 times!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. The &#34;Bee Line&#34; elevator that takes you to the restaurant&#39;s 2nd floor entrance.

gVtX2bmwwTtXFWYRSblIrA.text: William was awesome! Very helpful and had a great personality. The raspberry ginger martini was great.

d3_aqwyzYfv4f6cYNRHp4Q.text: Everyone rants and raves about this place but I find it to be ok. The service was fine but for it to be a place for "southern comfort food," it somewhat lacked. My bf that is from South Carolina was really excited about trying this place but we both felt like it feel short. The Fried Green Tomatoes lacked seasoning and soul. My french toast was really not that great. I feel like this place is also a little overpriced for the quality of food that they serve.

BmMWlxMoJ8Z3CGFUCoydpQ.text: We have finally found a honey of a restaurant in the Tupelo Honey Cafe on South Boulevard in Charlotte. You couldn't find a better general manager in Cedric Castro if you searched for years. He attends to every detail. And the highlight of our evening is when we request, no matter how long we have to wait, Iris our server. She is the epitome of professionalism, personality, and care. You have to love her. Once you meet her you'll see. And oh the menu... to die for. I had the buttermilk fried chicken with white gravy, moist and tender, and the smashed cauliflower. The homemade biscuits, jam and Tupelo Honey - it melts in your mouth. My son had the delicious hamburger, mac and cheese and fried okra. We also had the lamb meatballs with the special sauce as our appetizer and for dessert homemade banana pudding. Not just vanilla wafers stuck into instant pudding but the real bona fide thing. We have also met Cedric's assistant Mike, Chef Jason and his team of Turk, James, Kenny and the many more we will continue to meet as we are now happy regulars. Of course there's beer, wine and liquor and the restaurant's architecture is simply beautiful. John Schoeni and John Jr.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. John Schoeni, a Tupelo Honey regular

0knn6Cj9zZ8exz6FBJezBQ.text: The food is always phenomenal if you like fried chicken and good fixins! Ask for Matt when you go and he'll be sure to treat you right.

vjwpeQ8a_v3b4h3pi9EhoQ.text: wah wah. It was ok, not incredible. Next time we'll walk a little further to Nan and Bryon's.

jU4gee3foPISBnbyl0gdCg.text: Disappointed.     Out of corn souffle.   Green beans were not cooked consistently and hash puppies were over cooked

ANUetoW4ezAGFMw3sBL8pg.text: I have never eaten at Tupelo Honey before but have been told by many people that I absolutely had to. First of all it is really cute inside, I definitely felt like the decor went along with the Southern style they were going for. Our server was incredible.  He walked us through all of the different options we had and gave us great suggestions.  He actually ordered my friend's entire meal! I had the Shoo Cheese grilled cheese sandwich and the flavor was wonderful but I wouldn't have really been able to eat it because the bread was super toasted and hard, but dipping it in my soup, the way I eat it anyway, made it much better,  My friend got the black bean burger and it was AWESOME!!  She also got the creamy onion soup with croutons, which are made from the AMAZING biscuits, and that was delicious too,  'We had a wonderful experience and will definitely go back!

gYEp7--kuNGl6HzykyJ-8w.text: I'm always searching for new breakfast spots on the weekend, and went there per a friend's suggestion.  When arriving, I was excited to see complimentary valet - but upon pulling up to the station, the attendant just stared at us.  Didn't move.  After enduring a strange staring contest, and no service, we proceeded to park ourselves.    Upon walking in, I knew immediately this was a 5-star place.  The interior was awesome and I love the little bee paintings and artwork.  We were seated pretty straightaway, and that's when my mental star-rating went down.    - They don't have espresso; it's my belief that if you're going to be a breakfast spot, you should have this all-important a.m. beverage. - We told the server that one of us had an egg allergy.  He takes our order, puts it in, and as the order is being delivered informed us that it had eggs.  Uhm... shouldn't you have told us that when we ordered?  He takes the plate back to the kitchen, then brings it back saying that it didn't have eggs.  Seriously?!  Get it together.   - The wait time for the food was ridiculous.  The place was only half filled, and we had a screaming toddler.  The appetizer biscuits didn't come to our table for 40 minutes, and the actual food (only two plates) arrived in 85 minutes. - The menu options are nice, but really limited.  If you do have an egg allergy, there are no real alternatives.  And if you're not into omelets, fried chicken or shrimp and grits, there are no other viable options - so if you're plain like me, you're SOL.  I left leaving a bit disappointed because I arrived so excited and full of hope.  From the lazy valet, the incompetent server, the long food waiting period, and lack of menu options, I'm sad to say that we will not be returning.

4CXNUKHrkan5gsxj1zn2gg.text: I love this place. My fiance and I took a weekend getaway to Charlotte for a little R&R. We searched on google for a good place to get brunch on a Saturday and Tupelo had the best reviews. We stayed at the Westin, it was about a 10 minutes Uber drive. Since it was around 1 pm on a Saturday it was packed. We had to wait about 40 minutes to get a seat, so we took a walk around the block since it was a beautiful day. We finally were seated the tables was a little small, but we're from Pittsburgh and have a breakfast spot here Pamela's with the same setup, so it was okay for us. We took a look at the menu and my fiance and I both decided to order the sweet potatoes pancakes with a fried chicken breast, apple cider vinegar bacon, walnuts, butter, syrup and powder sugar on top. The waiter came out with two biscuits with some jam, the best biscuits I ever had, very moist and buttery. He came out with our plates.  I was in love from the first bite. The sweet potatoes pancake was very sweet and moist, the chicken was fried to perfection, and the bacon was very crispy, it all came together well. We left with a smile on our face, we walked back to the hotel we talked about our meal all the way there. The next time I'm in Charlotte we will make a return.

VbP5OKiIOenW6_RdSI-HMQ.text: I had heard such good things about this native Asheville restaurant.  And moving into the great space formerly occupied by Pewter Rose gave me even more hope.  Sorry Van Morrison Tupelo Honey is not "an angel of the first degree"! .  The food was bland and the service was slower than grass growing on a Southern summer day!  There are too many other really good Southern restaurants in and around Charlotte to find your way here.

w3CG6iiaHWCQ8bscVjcdng.text: So disappointed in our last visit here. My BF and I arrived and were seated at a great table this past Sunday morning about 9:00 am. He ordered the Mexican type omelet with chorizo and I ordered my standard sweet potato pancake with fried chicken. We were not impressed with the new menu at all, as an aside. When our food came out, my BF's omelet was barely warm on the outside and the inside was chilled salsa and chorizo. He told our server who took it away. They were going to just serve him another but we decided to split my entree instead. The petite blonde manager came over and apologized and we got lots of apologies but I was surprised and disappointed that the bill wasn't entirely comped due to a very poor and ruined dining experience. This is probably our 8th time dining here and we had a birthday celebration of 6 guests once. We will not return. The service is spotty, the food is inconsistent and management seems unconcerned with serious lapses without any effort to turn a bad experience into a positive one.  Mistakes and errors happen EVERYWHERE...these are OPPORTUNITIES to turn something bad into a positive experience. Tupelo Honey really needs some more training of managers on how to do this. When customers don't return and tell others of bad experiences, it is not a good thing for a business.

Uky0g-WO7e1dmkYgt0V_gA.text: My husband and I took my siblings on the first Saturday Tupelo Honey was open and we loved it! I also want to give the manager big kuddos for personal service. My little brother is a type 1 diabetic and started getting low while we were waiting on a table, I asked the manager if we could order a biscuit for him to nibble on while we waited. The manager was super friendly and quickly brought out a biscuit and refused to accept payment. Tupelo Honey was such a wonderful expereince. The staff was super friendly and the food amazing!

YsL15iO3svxNiI3y9XJ_Rw.text: We were thrilled to hear THC was openin in Charlotte!!  Great food!!!  No question at all!!!   Service? Not so much.  Having a late lunch. 5 tables seated. 7 wait staff. And still incredibly slow. They are out of soda products. And they just cleared the table next Tonys where the mom had simply taken her younger son to the restroom. Obviously check had not been paid, but they still cleared the table. We've been waiting 15 mins & still jo food.  Hope they work the kinks out soon.  We want them to survive!!!

z9l1bGaq_vZICHe1_qFTXA.text: My wife has been to the TH's in Asheville several times, but I had never been to any of their restaurants. We ended up going to this one in Charlotte for breakfast. My wife observed that the one in Asheville gave each table a basket of their biscuits, but this one gave each of us one measly biscuit and didn't offered us more. That was kind of disappointing. My wife also indicated that the one in Asheville served the food with a signature flower, but none was offered at this location. The food was very good all in all. But, the coffee was absolutely horrible! When I told the waitress that it was incredibly strong (I mean unbelievably so!) and bitter, she explained that it was a Peruvian blend and even she, who liked strong coffee, couldn't handle what they served. This is ridiculous. This restaurant needs to offer a more subtle blend. I doubt most people would like their coffee. Bottom line is that we'll be back there for breakfast, but TH's CLT does have some shortcomings.

gTjko1-CDq9mL4Xqq_UBXg.text: Yummy bloodies and big biscuits and perfectly crispy chicken, they even switched my bloodies when I didn't like the first one so great service! Def recommend

t1YacnKCtYD6AvpdBwdTsg.text: Just so-so.  This was probably our 10th visit and have enjoyed the food, staff, and atmosphere each time. Tonight it was unremarkable at best.  They had a 93 rating. The hostess was doing her job in "having" to seat us.  The wait staff was not too put off by "having" to serve us.  And the saddest part was the food was just so-so.  We sure hope they are not depending on their reputation to carry them.  It will be a while before we go back!

Uzw-V0U9isBojSQGOajo_w.text: The food was so good this is what is left over! Amazing lunch and such a great menu! The service and and the atmosphere are amazing. Southern seafood Fish tacos were amazing! The tupelo farm fresh burger was amazing! I had the fried chicken and I loved it with the mac & cheese with it omg! The desserts were so very good , cheesecake, brownie and banana pudding were to die for! Ask for Patrick b/c our server was so wonderful!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beautiful place!
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. My lunch!  Fried chicken and mac and cheese
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Biscuits

CLDSK_Mj0sByjuzJ3F7dEA.text: We ordered Charleston chicken sandwich and the debutant omelette. The taste was to the point but the food came out cold. The service was pretty slow and I don't blame the server because he had to serve a large number of tables.  Tupelo honey cafe should seriously consider to increase their staff count

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Charleston chicken sandwich with tomato soup
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Debutant omelette

W9gEQ3kXqOrKmeDO19Wu5A.text: Food was amazing drinks were great! We had the champagne blueberry pancakes, margaitas, chicken breast avocado Club, chicken and fries for the kids and the biscuits with blueberry jam. Holy batman!! We're from texas, we know about good southern biscuits and gravy, this place does not disappoint!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States

t2DFs41KDs5V-Uho4k9pfQ.text: Best biscuit I had in Charlotte, hands down. It's was fluffy and buttery with a hint of salt. Plus, that blueberry jam is to die for (and free!!).  I got the eggs betty with asparagus. My egg was a touch over cooked, the asparagus was well made and of course, it had a lovely biscuit to soak up and egg bits. The goat cheese grits were missing the tangy bite I pictured when I saw goat cheese. Besides that, the grits weren't thick and creamy enough for me.  We shared the crispy grit cakes which had a fantastic texture and was very tasty without being overly greasy. The salsa on the side was a week thought out accompaniment.  My coffee was very good, with a lower acidity than most places (so you don't get that nasty after taste).  While I'm used to waiting long lines for brunch, this place was really pretty packed to the gills. However, service was lovely ask around.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Eggs betty with asparagus and  goat cheese grits
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Biscuit with blueberry jam
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bite of grit cakes with sour cream and salsa

bYl67-iZFVlVhF77RrN1VQ.text: Great food, but I had several issues with my service a few weeks ago. Luckily, I was in contact with the owner, and all was made right. Very appreciated, and wonderful business

LiZhu52ALR8zPSle4e2nxQ.text: We came in during a busy brunch on a Sunday. (Beware that you might have a wait due to Charlotte foodies getting out of church or locals needing to bite the hair of the dog.) The bar is seat yourself and we were able to grab a table there while waiting.  Our server greeted us letting us know she wanted to go home. All through our meal she wasn't tentative to little things like drinks -our coffee wasn't hot.  The food was amazing, although it wasn't hot-hot when it was served. The parings of ingredients are great no matter what items you order. There are great spin off southern dishes that everyone should try.  Over all the food will bring us back.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Eggs Betty, roasted brussels sprouts with ranch, fried green tomatoes laid in grits, fried avocado &amp; the super souther breakfast bowl.

J_xYXpGJitQOA0j92Gkp8w.text: We were visiting Charlotte from Baltimore for a girls weekend. We decided to have Brunch at Tupelo Honey before heading back home. We were greeted with southern hospitality at the door.  We had a large party but we had a reservation so there was no wait for us. We were seated immediately. Our waitress was Kayla. She was excellent. She was knowledgeable about the menu and when we asked she gave recommendations. The complimentary biscuits and homemade sauce were delicious. I ordered the fried okra, the shrimp and grits and a mega mimosa. The shrimp and grits were so full of flavor that no additional salt, pepper or butter was needed. The fried okra was seasoned very well.  The mimosa could have used a little more orange juice to sweeten it but it was enjoyable. The manager came out and greeted us because we were celebrating 2 friends and she was very friendly with a bubbly welcoming personality. Without us even asking the checks were separated and we cashed out quick and easy. I even bought some honey to take home. I highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States

TY6P84WoX-wDDckGV0MxUg.text: The food is incredible, and the staff go out of their way to make you feel welcome.  Been there for breakfast, brunch, lunch and dinner and I will continue to be a regular.  Definitely order the shrimp and grits.  It's awesome.

RNS_-q-3gyjp5xEc5TcyNA.text: I visited Tupelo Honey for lunch, and it was delicious! To start, they bring out freshly baked biscuits with local honey and jam. I then ordered the Grateful 'Veg' Burger which was a great black bean burger with a lemon aioli sauce. The service was excellent and very fast, and if you download and sign up for their app, they will give you a free short-stack of blueberry pancakes!  The only downside is that it does get pretty busy, but it's certainly worth the wait.

xvisCSUACWo6U-HCgTgLzA.text: It was decent food but I think it's a little hyped.  I sat at the bar.  No chance would I have ever waited 1.5-2 hours for breakfast/Saturday brunch.  We asked for a couple of things off the menu that the bartender recommended only to find out they were out of a couple of the main ingredients and couldn't offer us the entree.   Somewhat pricey and way too much of a wait for me.

S7YQJoW8lbAlzWObMGvphw.text: Holliday was a wonderful server, was such a pleasure to eat here and the service is amazing!!

ziXbkriZd_TGs0BCD-XJqQ.text: Well I finally made it to Tupelo Honey Cafe today.....and it was a great experience! Our server....Jonathan....was so awesome that I told him I was gonna kiss him in the mouth and that he was my new BFF! Obviously I did NOT kiss him but I thoroughly enjoyed the level of customer service. He was knowledgable about all the food which was helpful to first timers like my friend and I. He answered all questions with a smile and even laughed when I said I was going to kiss him. He made it an enjoyable experience.   Now. To the food. We started with the biscuit and their blueberry jam. It was delicious. It was just the right amount of tart and the scratch made biscuit was heavenly. I ordered the fried chicken sandwich with BLT and I added avocado. They offered djionnaise but I'm not a fan of Dijon so I went with straight mayo. I wanted the fries but they're seasoned, which I dislike, so I ordered the Mac n cheese on the side. I thought it was good but I wasn't blown away by it. With all the layers of flavor that it supposedly had,  the jalapeno was the most pronounced. The chicken was crispy and the avocado added just the right amount of fat. The tomato added some nice freshness and the bacon added a bit of hickory taste. My friend ordered the sweet potato pancake with the fried chicken and said she enjoyed it but that the sweet potato flavor became real strong after awhile.    Overall a wonderful experience and we will be back soon.

A9OGdfV_MEevYashh_ZfGQ.text: The restaurant was okay lacking the excitement of flavorful dishes. I am not trying to be negative but the food was unpleasantly bland. I have cooked better at home. The service was better than the food. The ambiance of the restaurant was pleasant.

v2qy2h2MH-VghOtPhS-FEg.text: My coworker and I had the fried chicken and shrimp & grits. Both were great! I love the culture and love for sustainable resources to make their unique dishes. Try the breaded mac & cheese and the apple cider collards with your fried chicken supper plate. Oh, and ask for Dylan to be your server!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried chicken supper plate. Ask for Dylan!

j-CxDcAjrSH_nsh3NKJh0Q.text: Tupelo is always fantastic. The food is wonderful, the service is quick, and parking is typically available. Each time we've visited Tupelo, we've tried something different and loved it. The grits are amazing. Don't forget the bar specials!

8xTBqH7RkJHyF4HnyR7veg.text: One the best places Ive been too thus far in Charlotte... Service is amazing, food is fresh and made from scratch. I had the buttermilk fried chicken with mac and cheese. Top 3 mac and cheese Ive ever had. Chicken was juicy and not oily. Drinks are also good. The crowd is um regular southern folks.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Buttermilk Fried Chicken and Mac and cheese

7AmRYfm4usuirSgSLPXGcw.text: William was awesome! He made our morning and made great suggestions. The fried okra was out favorite appetizer.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nice notes to send us on our way.

C00iVrv7YmdnWKjeGz1KwA.text: The brunch at the Charlotte Tupelo Honey is great! However, it gets EXTREMELY crowded! I am not a huge fan of the menu change because they took up the Debutante Omelet, but it is still really good. The honey is delicious and definitely order a Mega Mosa!

WDHyvfDGq7S7oVd7hcN55Q.text: Went here and loved the food. It was great and something different but fell in love with the great fresh taste.

cO9OvJ48B6o0FoleXB07jA.text: Sat at the bar and had great service! Food was great! Tried almost all of their appetizers - the bbq egg roll things were very good

KLM3vLCWQi211eFnvFoHEA.text: Amazing service and very willing to work with allergies.Superb food, and the atmosphere was very inviting and urban.

mjaDxoEZtNdH8BtbY28uuA.text: Wow! Totally impressed. Super fresh and delicious. Made with love. The fried chicken and biscuits were the best I ever had. Their homemade soda is exceptional. They even give you all natural ketchup and real cream for your coffee. Love this place. Will definitely be back.

eO969uXUdjtX-JoOZHS2MA.text: I love this place! It's southern cuisine with a creative twist. Their servers and staff are very friendly and the atmosphere is great! My husband won't stop raving about the trout he ate tonight. Their fried okra and biscuits are also amazing. Don't skimp on the blueberry jam they serve it with! Yum!

M0D5pNgoZg2wicupWFTkHQ.text: Best customer service award goes to Calvin! I took a friend of mine here for her 1st time and I was super excited about ordering my all time favorite sandwich only to find out they took it off the menu. Well Mr. Calvin was nice enough to get the kitchen to fix it for me even on a busy Sunday brunch afternoon. I was very impressed with his customer service and his willingness to make me happy. Btw the sandwich has country ham, bacon, pimento cheese and fried green tomatoes on it. Please put it back on the menu it's delicious especially paired with the megamosa! Wait time was short bc we made reservations. Thanks for making my day Calvin!

80ULeRdpe41QAYNO6AuGDg.text: I have been here many times and have always enjoyed the food. However the last time I went with my husband and a friend, we received horrible service. The woman at the check in counter told us the wait would be 20 minutes. 45 minutes later and watching many people who arrived after us be seated, I finally asked when our table would be ready. She informed me that she only had 2-tops available. When I turned around I saw two women who had just walked in be seated at a 4 person table. When I told her of this, she said "I guess I'll clean off a table." I was disappointed in this poor treatment and we received no apology. I don't understand why this happened, but I was incredibly disappointed and will not be returning.

EzuM5PpUQfZmWIymXvTJmg.text: It was decent good. The cooks burned out pancakes but the managers/supervisors made it right. I appreciate that and for that I give 4 stars. Not much to complain about here, server was nice too.

CqOvIuaEUH37ItdCVpqW-A.text: Haven't even ordered and I'm disappointed.  Twenty five minute wait for outdoor seating at 230 in the afternoon.  So I sat at the bar, the only place with no wait.  After ten munutes, The bartender is interacting and I got my drink fast but the bar is dirty and there is a check still sitting next to me from the last patron.

gSMlGJk9LnJJJFE_SsP6cw.text: Love the Bloody Mary!! I also think their tomato soup with the grilled cheese is great!

4o_IWLsKj_Jn9gK5AoAfDA.text: This is my go to spot with friends for breaktfast! Their Chicken Biscuit and Gravy is so good! You have to make sure to either go at an off time or get their early because there is usually a wait.

6qhGvqrmj4bGpQZeWfFw9g.text: I love Tupelo Honey! There are so many great things about this place: the food (of course), the atmosphere, the wait staff. The food is top notch. There is something for everyone. They offer brunch in case you're not in a lunch or dinner mood. Plus, much of the food comes from local farms. The atmosphere is great. The interior decor is amazing in itself. There is a bar if that's your thing. Lastly, the wait staff is great. We have been to TH several times, but most recently, our waiter was Jonathan. It was particularly busy this day, but Jonathan didn't rush to get our orders as quickly as possible. He actually went out of his way to offer recommendations to those of us who were undecided on what to order. The recommendations were excellent, by the way. Overall, Tupelo Honey is great! It is well worth a visit!

Z51BovsK-y0Da4j-_Qu8Pw.text: Service has been awful the past few visits. After waiting forever for our food it came out cold. Will not be returning for a while.

cZsNUENZkA8gDmfXXoPOwQ.text: We had heard great things about the brunch but were far less than impressed.  We spent over $100 for a group of four and got egg beater omelettes, I've never disliked an omelette but these were bad.  The atmosphere is awesome, but they need to deliver with the ingredients.

WkbXBayT8ini-DPCUwmxzg.text: Seriously overhyped, the food seriously isn't what everyone is rating. Maybe it was just the dinner entrees, haven't tried breakfast yet. The only good thing worth going back for are those biscuits and the blueberry jam

BwjoPEnfX5kjMoEl-P5idQ.text: I love Tupelo honey cafe. The potato pancakes are worthy of awards! I also really enjoy the chicken and biscuits. Creamy gravy, delicious chicken (very juicy) and the fluffy biscuits. There is a variety of options if you prefer to eat healthy, vegan or southern! Each guest receives a complimentary biscuit with homemade jam and honey upon arrival. Delish!

aM4Ga-RMX8e27DeSGhWB_Q.text: LOVE this place! Fresh biscuits and honey are wonderful! The salmon, mashed sweet potatoes and kale salad is my fav dish. Never had anything here I didn't like!

2rkby3LIpmhjb5au9q0Bkg.text: DELICIOUS goat cheese grits, great experience, fabulous staff!

U9C4sTUPNTQKJ2tUtRW53A.text: holy cow! The shoo mercy shrimp and grits is sooooooo goooood but sooooo pricey. I believe it was around 26 dollars for just that plate but it makes sense why it's expensive since they use shrimps the size of baseballs!!! (Exaggeration but they're jumbo shrimps) lol. I haven't been here for dinner but brunch here is pretty good. But they recently change the way they make their biscuits and I'm not a fan. Bring back the old biscuit recipe!! !

yrWVeBXDJaNWl9wN8YS8TQ.text: such a good choice for Brunch !  our waitress Debbie was great..  the Sweet Potato Pancakes were perfect (a cranberry pecan compote would have crowned it) the deeply rich coffee was delicious and even the bacon tasted special.  Fun..

hOdPmfkwGA4XMkMnN4_tKg.text: Disappointing given the hype and 30 minute wait at 10am.  Free biscuits and jam - 4/5. The highlight of the meal. Biscuits have fluf, rich complex flavor. Totally interesting enough to eat on their own. Jam is solid and changes the flavor profile.   Fried green tomatoes - 3/5. Goat cheese grits and Roasted red pepper coulis are quite good as a combo. The tomatoes themselves have a pickled flavor but otherwise not much. I normally love fried green tomatoes so was sad to not finish my portion.  Shoo Mercy Sweet Potato Pancakes - 3/5. A lot of great things that don't really work as well together. The chicken has incredibly crispy bites but otherwise can get boring. Pancakes with maple syrup, butter and pecans are solid but unremarkable. Grilled apple with pickled Blueberries is a fun twist but both were more subtle than I'd like. The eggs are just there with salt and don't really make sense, maybe if there was something on top of the eggs like a sauce? Bacon was not crispy. On the whole, left much or the chicken and pancakes behind.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States

ocFRcp6kfApR1TIeiSjtBw.text: This location of Tupelo is not good. The one is Asheville is much better. This location is too big that I think the quality of food is not controlled very well.

uHadITzSxTsUqYMy_G9vQg.text: This place is where you need to be for brunch on the weekends! My friend took us here while we were visiting Charlotte and it did not disappoint! We got there early, so we had a small wait, but it wasn't over 20 minutes. Once seated, we started with some mimosas and also put in apps for the fried green tomatoes and avocado toast. For my entree, I ordered (I forget what it's called so I will describe it lol)- but it was steak, egg whites, mixed greens, and their crispy potatoes all drizzled with their honey hot sauce. It honestly was perfection. All entrees come with a side of biscuits- their speciality I'm guessing- and they were amazing!! The biscuits were warm and flaky and doughy! They came with honey and berry preserves, which were amazing!! Honestly, everything at Tupelo Honey is so good and I am still dreaming about those biscuits. I will definitely be back there the next time I'm in Charlotte! I would also like to note that the overall atmosphere of this place is so cute! It's very quaint and homey.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Green Tomatoes
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ago cado Toast Points
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Carolina Steak &amp; Eggs* **

hXowDKaS5EG9lGYSxrfibA.text: Everything was amazing from the moment we walked in -- seated immediately in a great location on the balcony. The weather was fantastic today too. We were greeted right when we sat down by our fantastic waitress, Lex.  She was so friendly and just someone we enjoyed talking with throughout our meal. Her recommendations were spot on.  For Drinks: Queen Mary -- delicious, spicy and yummy goodies to eat, would order again Cherry Bomb Frose -- very tasty, highly recommend, would order again Wildflower Moscow Mule -- lime tastiness, would order again  For Appetizers: Fried Pickles & Fried Tomatoes -- delicious, would order again Biscuits & Homemade Blueberry Jam -- PHENOMENAL  For Entrees: Chimichurri Roasted Chicken -- really good, would order again Bone-in Fried Chicken Honey Dusted -- really good, would order again Grateful 'Veg' Burger -- one of the best homemade Veg burgers, would order again  Sides: Collards with Bacon, Salt & Pepper Crispy Brussels Sprouts, Black Eyes Peas -- all were very delicious, would order again  Dessert: Heavenly Banana Pudding -- the name says it all it was definitely "heavenly" and would order again  Overall AMAZING as you can see from the service and food. Can't wait to come back.

hZhylF9rTPV1y2ZO0XziCg.text: This was our 2nd visit to Tupelo and I was for the most part pleased again but the hubs not so much.    We made reservations online and was seated right away once we arrived on the outside porch.  And while I know the restaurant has no control over this the party behind us had a unsavory fondness for every cuss word and (some I didn't even know) in the world.  It made us weary.  Why cuss why?  Use your words people.   Back to my review - we started with the fried green tomatoes and enjoyed them thoroughly.  The hubster had an IPA (not sure which) and I had a OK pour -I've had more generous pours elsewhere - of a great red blend called Federalist.    Hubster ordered the Sweet Tea Roasted Chicken and found it tooooooo sweet and the brussel sprouts and mashed potatoes for his sides.   The potatoes were silky and flavorful - the brussel sprouts void of any flavor and mushy!  :(  I ordered the Shoo Mercy Pancakes with all sorts of accessories LOL - pancakes were fluffy sort of dense but good; my over medium eggs were cooked perfectly; the fried chicken breast was moist and well seasoned but the bacon was in bits and pieces and cooked so hard I could barely chew it.  I had a grilled pear with pickled blueberries (not sure about that since they tasted just like a regular blueberry) but still good.    Our waiter was a little spread thin it seemed and went missing often throughout the evening.  :(   When our appetizer was delivered the waitress (not our waiter) said we are out of knives they are in the dishwasher.  OK - we get our food a while later and ask for knives and explained what the waitress said about them and our waiter says "HUH, Really that seems like a big Lie but oh well - I'll get you some!"  Restaurant owners listen up - IT IS NOT GOOD TO WITNESS YOUR STAFF TALKING NEGATIVELY ABOUT THE OTHER!  Overall the jury is still out for Tupelo - I like it but not at the same time.  It's ok to have trendy farm to table themes and whatnot but at the end of the day the food should be good period for everybody!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tupelo Menu

uocBgTn4LV1j-LL4V7epiQ.text: We visited for the first time today. My husband ordered blueberry French toast with biscuits and honey. I ordered the house made black bean burger with brussel sprouts. Our appetizer was the macaroni and cheese bites with gravy, creole style.  When the server set the app in front of us we were underwhelmed. Three small fried macaroni balls with a small side of gravy. I was excited for a spicy explosion in my mouth thinking, quality not quantity. Nothing. Each Mac ball = $3. I could have cooked up a Kraft box of Mac and cheese and fried them into three balls for 1/8 the price and sprinkled some spice on them. Our entrees came out next. My husband's looked so so. My dish included an overwhelming amount of BURNED brussel sprouts and the house made black bean burger. I ate a couple of bites of the brussel sprouts but couldn't  stomach any more because they were so burned. And it was difficult to find any black beans in my house made black bean burger. It was sub par for the price. We each had two alcoholic beverages: a wheat beer, rose drink, mimosa, and white wine. All were ok, but overpriced. We won't be back. Such high hopes after reading through the menu before we visited. Maybe it was just an off day in the kitchen. On the plus side, service at the bar was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Veggie Burger - black bean with brussel sprouts
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mountain Blueberry French toast

aeI0z3no8vkgw4yHzBjx0Q.text: *delicious food* First of all it's SO cute inside it has the southern charm/ homey feel you just love. Lovely decorations and colors!  My friend and i both got the sweet potato pancakes and wow! The flavor was soooo delicious! The pancakes Had different spices like cardamom and cinnamon ugh so good  Came with a baked apple ( eh..) and fried chicken YUM!  We also ordered mimosas but I will say for a breakfast/ brunch place the coffee menu was sub par(4 ). Everything else was amazing! Love love love

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States

3Y6Aii4d5n2HURDOEMPp7w.text: I was excited to come here and try their shrimp and grits but I was very disappointed. The dish was bland and looking back on other people's photos it seems that the reason why is that they didn't add the sauce on top. I don't know how something like this was allowed out of the kitchen. I came in between lunch and dinner so it was not very busy so it was completely overlooked for no reason. Sadly will not be returning

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tupelo Shrimp &amp; Grits

6FcbVuRcRIijtYjM6vmVzg.text: I've been to Tupelo Honey in Raleigh and loved it, however this was not the best experience in Charlotte. The service was poor, the waitress seemed to have too many tables and seemed very stressed not stopping by very often and we were left with empty glasses of water almost the whole time. Also honey was left off of multiple dishes. The avocado toast was fairly over priced for what it was. Definitely not the same quality as the rest of the food on the menu, very bland and soggy.

64T2OXzGWx8zJJHYarWXng.text: Tupelo is a classic spot to try. The food is great! Their chicken and biscuits as well as the fried green tomatoes are the best!!  Make a reservation as they're very busy!

vb0kcD9yqJ71kTWqkBRn7Q.text: I was at Tupelo Honey this past weekend for a (large) surprise birthday party. It's not the ideal setting for a party, as the tables are fairly close together. It made mingling mildly difficult. The atmosphere is beautiful though, and the service staff was exceptional.  The food definitely left a bit to be desired. The fact that my boyfriend ordered fish & chips (for $19, mind you) and received what looked like a kid's order of chicken fingers. It was a pathetically small pile of average-looking fries and a few TINY strips of fried fish. I almost laughed when it was brought to the table. For a restaurant that prides itself on presentation, the fish & chips are a complete joke.   I had better luck with the sweet tea brined chicken meal. The chicken was far from being the best I'd ever had - it was pretty dry, but the sweet tea flavor definitely came through and it was very tasty overall. The star of the meal was the brussel sprouts - absolutely incredible. They were charred and crispy and perfectly seasoned, and our whole table was eyeing them on my plate. I also had the mashed potatoes, which were good but nothing special.  A few of our party's guests got the shrimp and grits and said that it was excellent. Their beer and wine selection, as well as their cocktails, all received rave reviews.   I still want to visit Tupelo for brunch, but I won't return for dinner. Drinks and side dishes are the stars here. 5 stars for the excellent service - the staff were friendly, patient, and even provided us an extra table for the birthday boy's gifts. As with all large groups, there were a few members of our party that were difficult, and the staff handled it very gracefully.

tdymv7pSnpkQEkBvGeN3Tg.text: Delicious food and friendly service all set in unique architecture! We are looking out of the 10' windows onto the green trees- just beautiful!  We had the Shakshuka which is gluten free and filled with great flavors and textures- our friends had blueberry pancakes and French toast - which was just the best!!! We'll be back next time we are in Charlotte for sure!!!

2dPIMWg1Do5gyp8b0yfl1A.text: I absolutely love the food here! It's super southern and delicious. I love the location and decor. However, every time I've come here it is not a quick in and out. The service is extremely slow.  If they'd speed that up a bit I'd made this a regular spot.  But I don't always have 2 hours to eat brunch....

1Mp47WV3z4KJTa2iET9z4w.text: Tupelo honey was highly recommended in Charlotte after googling top breakfast restaurants. After our flight, my husband and I came straight here for breakfast. We ordered the chicken and biscuit and schoo merry pancakes. The sweet potato pancakes were delicious along with their fried chicken. The fried chicken is not overly salty, but seasoned just right. Customer service was on point, the waitress checked on us frequently to make sure we were enjoying our food. Your meal comes with biscuit, jelly and honey. Overall, a good find for southern breakfast. Ample amount of parking too!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shoo merry pancakes
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and biscuits

F0zSBad4IaEwfY4xCW-qxw.text: Great service. Diverse menu filled with homey southern favorites. An eclectic cocktail list and a few craft beers to keep things interesting. I tried the chicken and biscuit. Well prepared, generous portion rich flavors that played well off of the chicken's breading.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Don&#39;t sleep in their seasonal pancakes! #TupeloHoney #NC
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Diverse menu of southern goodness
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yummy mimosa - tasty OJ to complement the bubbly!

XWPA1h5paSA5j0VuGc6siA.text: Sapphira was an amazing server! The food was delicious and I'm looking forward to visiting again on my next trip to Charlotte (or the other locations she and I chatted about!)

O3sVeRfeTQ2B8jIqwIkiCg.text: Tupelo Honey was delicious! Even though we came on a Monday Brunch/Lunch, we made a reservation for 12:15 pm for the outside patio and THANK GOD we did, because there were so many people here at that time. Whether corporate lunches or personal, there were just so many people that wanted to sit outside.  We ordered with our stomachs and not our eyes and realized we were so so stuffed by the end of our appetizers. For appetizers: we ordered Crispy Brussels (without Bacon) and Fried Okra. Both were mouthwatering delicious. I also ordered a Rosemary Peach Lemonade which was tasty! 100% recommend!  For our entree, I did the Lunch Combo - 1/2 spicy avocado & egg sandwich, 1/2 mixed greens salad, and french fries. The spicy avocado & egg sandwich comes with a organic nut bread, but I'm allergic so I requested a different bread. They ran out of sourdough so I opted for Pumpernickel. Everything was super delicious, but I was so full from apps I ate everything inside my sandwich and left the bread. I couldn't even finish my fries (!!!).   All in all, a beautiful & delicious lunch spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rosemary peach lemonade- delish!
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crispy Brussels (without bacon) - left   Fried Okra - right

0cWx4URA7tntTkNM1dZfwA.text: I've been to Tupelo quite a few times. The most recent was for lunch on a Thursday.   My coworker and I were promptly seated outside, as it was a beautiful 80 degree day. Good shade though from the sun on their deck.   Our server came over pretty quickly. I can't remember her name, but she was super friendly and funny. We ordered a bunch of small bites, fried green tomatoes, cauliflower bites, fried okra, Brussel sprouts, avocado toast and Mac and cheese. Our server brought us our jam and biscuits. Their blueberry jam is delicious. Everything came out pretty fast and everything was delicious. My favorite was the avocado toast & fried okra.   My coworker bought a jar of the blueberry jam, and the server gave me a jar of honey for free. Overall, service and food was good. Definitely a good lunch spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Green Tomato&#39;s

N16vLaUL0Pq0hgutqj5z_w.text: Excellent service and delicious fried chicken. If I lived in town this would be in my weekly rotation.

sJT4V5fJoDhz6vg130Nw8g.text: Remember the name Sydina...  When you think of creative cuisine and craft cocktails, your mind should go straight to Tupelo Honey. When you think of Southern hospitality, your mind should go straight to Tupelo Honey.  When you think of the 'ol fashioned term "The Hostess with the Mostest," my mind went straight to my TH visit. Upon arriving, I was graced with the presence of the glowing hostess, Sydina. Ahh, there's that name. Sydina, yes, Sydina. Such an unforgettable name on such an unforgettable visit. Handling her duties with such poise and such grace throughout all the noise she constantly looked me in the face. Sydina should be recognized for her pure podium professionalism.  Another great thing about TH, besides Sydina, is that the company responsibly sources their food from exceptional farmers. It's almost like they infuse Southern spirit into every bite. Nothing says gracious and delicious Southern food like Tupelo Honey, honey. Bless y'alls heart.

r0ybXP5I8DIVAYogjiDd_w.text: It's honestly been an unusual journey at this high rated restaurant.  This is our 3rd visit here and it always seems like something odd happens.  A year ago the heat wasn't working and everyone was walking around in winter clothing. But the amazing shakshuka and goat cheese grits lured us back.  This time the ticketing system was down, kitchen orders were crazy backed up, orders came out in unusual patterns (one person got their breakfast 15 minutes before everyone else) and one breakfast was cold to the touch (and not made to order).  We didn't ask for a manager, but the server said they would bring a manager over anyway, likely just to smooth things over.  But a manager never came.  4 of the 5 breakfasts were delicious.  They also didn't charge us for our drinks and single cold breakfast, which was kind. But it's just not a consistent experience here.

y3dycV3jwna7QAOwf5YVbg.text: It's been a long while since being here... but I remember loving the drinks, food & atmosphere.  A nice relaxing spot- not too big of a place, possibly crowded easily... not back when I went...

RceMuFzfygtTa8HoRVTUHg.text: If your not dining at THC, you are sleepin'!  Pic features blue moon, Frose, and chenin Blanc!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States

zH9MPodk_1QZqyqEu_beGg.text: Very disappointed. For opener, found a hair in the au gratin potatoes. My wife ordered a small dinner salad that I would be embarrassed to serve. It was like bagged super market greens with one slice of watermelon radish. And the only dressing that comes with it was bad. I asked the waitress if the fish and chips were any good. She lied to me because they were pretty bad. (Side note, the fish and chips at Red Robin is pretty good.) The manager seemed put off and showed little to no concern about our complaints. But did not charge us for two of the four entrees. Very big of him.

Lqn_o0A7B4GerdhmIBAJNQ.text: This was a pretty interesting place! I live in Charleston and Charlotte isn't very far so we went for a day of shopping and for some food. We looked up Tupelo Honey before we left and decided we'd try dinner there. Heads up! Make a reservation. We made a reservation ahead of time using OpenTable and there was only a 5-6 minute wait versus a couple who walked in after and was told 40-45 minutes. Now that that's out of the way, get started. They start you off with housemade biscuits accompanied by honey and blueberry jam. They were really good. Crunchy tops but the inside was soft and fluffy. For an appetizer we got the crispy brussel sprouts. Very delicious and seasoned well. Lived up to the name, crispy. Definitely crisp, not burnt. We were going to try their dip with the collard greens but the manager informed us that the entire batch of it was ruined and there was none available for the day. Smh  The egg rolls were good but normally if the filling is savory, I prefer a sweet sauce. There's was a mustardy looking Sauce but wasn't sweet. Dipped it in honey instead, way better!  I ordered the fried chicken with two sides. It was cool. Smaller cuts of chicken but seasoned well. The Mac and cheese was pretty decent and the collards could use some more salt. Other than that this place is very lively and the atmosphere is great. Had the rosemary peach lemonade. You can definitely taste the rosemary and combined with the peach was a very different but tasty flavor combination. Will definitely be back next time we're in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States

Qqe8Ms4vNhsXOP8JvRW5cA.text: This is the only place I wanted go on Friday.  We walk in and are seated immediately; which was awesome...no wait.  Our hostess seats us in a quaint corner and we wait, and wait, and wait.  While watching other tables get served before us, odd but True.  I go back to the hostess and inform that we are still waiting for our server, but other people sat after us were being served.   She was shocked. Truth is, by the time she came to our table we were packing up to leave.  Then she says, I've ordered your table an appetizer, I am so sorry, your server will be here soon.  Ok, it's like 9 pm and we would have to go somewhere else so we stayed.  Then, one of the managers come over with like 4 appetizers, water, apologies, and our server shows up, apologized.  We get it, it's late and he's overwhelmed with tables.    We order, he brings our biscuits; which by the way is the reason I came because the blueberry compote and honey is AMAZING!!  The other manager comes over, apologizes and wants to make sure we are ok.  More importantly, our dinner date has made a turn and we are now enjoying ourselves and not having to drag our 4 year old somewhere else to eat.    Honestly, when the food came we couldn't even eat it because we were stuffed on ALL the appetizers they brought to us.  So, most of our food we took home!! Anyway, we had a better time than what I thought because we were headed out the door.   Ok, to boot, I took my last biscuit and wanted the compote, but I left it on the table.  As we were leaving out our hostess comes through the door and stopped us to give us a jar of compote!!! In my head I'm like YES!  Won't he do it!!! Listen, my 4 stars are for the wait, but they made it up to us with the end result of our service. I can tell they pride hem selves on customer service.  Love that!

wetoS1_POhy7-c2yJg7G6Q.text: Always impressed by Tupelo. And they may have the best fried chicken I've ever had.  I really like it honey dusted. Oh and the Mac and Cheese is very good as well.

t16lhFJ4awxHNnN64reXjQ.text: Went to Tupelo Honey when I had a few friends in town. Very cute, casual, comfortable atmosphere. The host was very friendly and we were seated right away.  We all ordered drinks to start. Honeysuckle lavender flip, pretty drink with a cute name that basically tasted like vodka lemonade. Not a bad thing just nothing special. Sangria was tasty but had so much pulp and fruit pieces, it was too much. Margarita, I wouldn't suggest.  As for food, we started with the fried green tomatoes. This is not my favorite appetizer regardless of the restaurant but, TH does them pretty well. Thick tomato slices with a good crunch served with grits. For entrees we had shrimp and grits, fried chicken, sweet potato pancakes, salmon, and sides of mac n cheese and Brussels. Everything came with very large portions and everything was good but nothing was great. Out of all the dishes I think the shrimp and grits had the best flavors going. We also ordered the s'mores cake for dessert. Don't bother, dessert was a let down.   Service was very friendly all around but also very slow. I'd go back, just wouldn't be my first choice.

93dZMWf3GzWXwi3cevsswQ.text: Quick and polite service. Country style atmosphere and foods. The biscuits are Amazing!! They just fall apart and melt in your mouth :)   Best tip about this place: parking can be a challenge - especially getting in and out of the lot.

Our servers were both very attentive, food was amazing, atmosphere and ambiance was very cool and chill, and the drinks were yummy! I will definately be back!

K4sygtNr4ANaEFVaqvIpUA.text: One of the best southern comfort food restaurant I've been to!  First time in Charlotte and my friend recommends this place after hearing great reviews, so we decide to give it a try.  To start off, they give you some free biscuits to munch on.  (Tip: ask for honey to dip it in, it will change your experience eating them!).  We got the Buttermilk Fried Chicken (Tip: get a side of the crispy Brussels sprouts and dip it with their homemade ranch dressing--it's amazing), Shrimp and Grits and the baked Mac n Cheese.  Everything was delicious!  Service was good--came here during lunch on a Friday, it wasn't too packed so we got a table right away.  (There is a small patio for tables outside for those who like outdoor seating.)  Not sure when I'll have a chance to come back and visit Charlotte, but I would definitely come back here for their food!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Chicken, Shrimp and Grits, and a Mac n Cheese side

0twOju4Lddv57pD7SvmnQw.text: Saturday morning brunch in Charlotte. This place is a nice southern style farm to table type restaurant. Their brunch reminds me of this place called noble crust in St. Petersburg, FL.   We were seated immediately. It is spacious with an open kitchen , so you can see the food cooking. I got the pre fix menu and they offered two choices between appetizers and an entree. I went with the pear salad and the crab Benedict with bottomless coffee.  They started us out with biscuits with homemade blueberry jam. The jam looked extremely fresh with the berries still intact. The pear salad was pretty but kind of hard to eat with the big Bibb lettuce. It was a nice light start to get some good greens in. If your trying to keep a more trim meal I would go with this vs the avocado toast.   The crab Benedict was ok. The best part was the biscuit but it was kind of lukewarm. It wasn't something that I would rave about. I swapped out the potato cracklin with the Brussel Sprouts. I loved those. Very crispy and flavorful. It was only an extra dollar to do so. The other items on the menu looked amazing and it was kind of hard to pick what I wanted. This is somewhere I would definitely come back to when I am in Charlotte again.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab benedict with Brussel Sprouts instead of potato cracklin
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pear salad off the pre fix brunch

ilxW5FFmKF3v_5kbt8qpyg.text: I really wanted to enjoy this restaurant based off the reviews and the way the menu looked at first glimpse. Unfortunately I was very underwhelmed from the service to the food in general. The flatbread sandwich I ordered was so greasy it was hard to stomach. The collard greens, which are a staple in the south, were nothing more than bitter boiled greens with no flavor. The best thing about this place were the complimentary biscuits. The service was incredibly slow, in fact we almost missed our flight because of it. This is not a place I will return to. Maybe it was a bad day for service or I ordered the wrong items but the rest of my party stated their food was very lackluster as well.

EbAPE0bLHnBM0aLAVfZs5A.text: Great food and outdoor seating! Very affordable as well! The old skool breakfast bowl was so tasty and filling!

H68JLdWIGqCn0o0xWEewFA.text: I went with a party of 3 for breakfast and the staff was really friendly and food was good.   The waiter seemed very knowledgeable on the menu.   What made me give the restaurant a 3 is because their recipes have to be followed verbatim and they don't do a lot of substituting or change to how you want something cooked.  One of the people I was with ordered from the small plate wanting the little breakfast sandwich but had sunny side eggs and wanted it cooked well done, but was told that could not happened.  I ordered the steak and eggs which was delish and the other person ordered the sweet potato pancakes. The food for breakfast was kind of pricey. If your gonna pay the amount I think things should be made how u want them.

hZ8TtVGiu724945tyjiWRw.text: Great flavors. Good service. Two stars is because my food was off temp. Pork steak was not hot, mashed sweet potatoes were not hot, collards were hot. The better half's buttermilk fried chicken meal was warm enough. Her sides were barely warm.   Just poor kitchen management.   This might explain the mixed reviews.   Easy enough to fix. Most places have mastered the concept, I'm sure the owners can find someone to get the place back on a consistent track.

nrjFxB32d5XIgZMmY2h5Cw.text: We had a party of 20-something for brunch on a Sunday which I was like oh geez the service is going to suck but man was I wrong! We had very helpful and attentive servers. I ended up going with the $23 prixe fixe brunch menu which you get your choice of unlimited coffee or tea, small plate, and a larger plate. I ended up going for the fried green tomatoes and the Sockeye Salmon. I hastily made my decision because I didn't want to be THAT person the server waits on. I looked back at the menu and looked at what I had ordered and both plates had goat cheese incorporated into the grits. EW I hate goat cheese. Oh when I received my plates I took a bite of the grits and oh wow I was pleasantly surprised at how good it was.   Also everyone needs to get over the menu change. Everyone in our party LOVED the food.

9TttdLSEMK9OHehAcjksxw.text: The food and drinks were delicious. Everything from the cocktails to the steak and eggs; to the sweet potatoe pancakes dish. Yummy. Loved the porch action too!!  Great service. Excellent

YhoiUZtEs4Y3X5Jj9qorcw.text: Went during the week was surprised to find out they have weekday brunch! Server was realllly awesome he did an amazing job. And the drinks were made well. They offer soysage which is cool since I'm vegetarian.

E96x3TS6TMYeY0eTCIkKkQ.text: Alec was the best waiter. He was very attentive and told hilarious stories. Incredible service! Cannot wait to go back to Tupelo Honey :)

aYpLSXWIu3lDWQhLMXH5UQ.text: I took my wife to Tupelo Honey for Mother's Day, and the whole family enjoyed one of the best meals we've had in a long time. From the delicious crabcake appetizer to the fabulous Shrimp & Grits and mouthwatering Buttermilk Fried Chicken, everything was perfect. The atmosphere is trendy, yet family-friendly, and the drink menu and beer selection as good as you'll find anywhere.  Oh, and the BISCUITS! Simply unbelievable.  We've never been able to get into the original Tupelo in Asheville, so this South End location is a much-appreciated addition to the Queen City's dining scene!

KHHLl6OfIgmE104q31o5Dg.text: This edition of Excited about Eating takes us to the South End neighborhood of Charlotte to Tupelo Honey Cafe which is located on the second floor in a renovated historic building near Charlotte's light rail. The interior is a mix of industrial and rustic with lots of wood, exposed brick walls, and high ceilings.  Dora here. Don't you just love the interior? This is my kinda place. Parking around noon on Saturday was non-existent in the lot behind the restaurant, but no worries. There's free on-street parking on the other side of the light rail. Also, the 35-minute wait only ended up being 15 minutes. Another score!  Rather than table bread, Tupelo serves scratch-made biscuits with blueberry jam. These biscuits were great, crispy and buttery and warm, and the blueberry jam was the perfect pairing. We would have preferred to eat ours prior to the meal, but with a packed dining room, they came out with our meal. Dora here. I don't care what time they got to the table. I could've stuffed myself with these biscuits! The food did seem to take awhile, but service was very attentive and gracious.  I chose the Tupelo Farm Fresh Burger with cheddar cheese, lettuce, house-made pickles and a secret sauce along with fried okra and tomatoes. The burger was outstanding, grilled perfectly, tasty, and the secret sauce brought it all together. The okra and tomatoes were fresh, lightly battered with just the right amount of crunch.   Dora here. So many choices! But I finally decided on the Charleston Chicken Sandwich, a marinated grilled chicken breast with lettuce, Havarti cheese on sourdough wheat bread with a side of mac-n-cheese. Doesn't that sound great? The chicken was oh-so-tender and juicy, and I really liked the cranberry flavored mayo. First time eating sourdough wheat bread, and I liked it. The mac-n-cheese was creamy with just the right amount of firmness and kick.   I would rate this restaurant 5 forks out of 5 for a family friendly restaurant serving outstanding food. Definitely worth a return visit! Ernie & Dora Hiers, Fiction Faith & Foodies Blog
