eSYi6wgNJDHa4uMc5oWTTA.text: Went to brunch with my guy on a Saturday and was not disappointed at all. We did have to wait about 20 mins or so but that was explained once we walked in. Nevertheless, once we got our table our waiter (William) acknowledged us and told us he will be with us in a moment being the fact he was waiting on another table. Once he got to us which was no time at all. He offered his suggestions to us and I went with once of his suggestions which was the pancakes with the chicken and my guy ordered an omelet. While we waited he talked us into getting a drink which I got a margarita which was so good and my guy order the 9 oz mimosa and was able to substitute the orange juice for the pineapple juice which I thought was very helpful. With all that being said, the food and the drinks were so good!!! Everything was A1 from the customer service to the food. It was well worth the wait and we will return again!!

t4uSzRlM_kNR5bJtriH1Pg.text: We were seated pretty quickly. Atmosphere was very cozy. Dinner was good. We started with the Johnny cake and then i had the herb steak and my hubby had the shrimp and grits. Very good, lots of food! Dessert was honey buttermilk cheesecake and the chocolate molten cake with raspberry...yum! Service was great, Bailey was our server and she was very attentive and sweet. The manger Mary Ellen is super nice and professional, we really appreciated her service as well. We will be coming back for sure! Great job.

TJaC3HTsQ61-p-mGLtfiMQ.text: Went here and it was amazing. My boyfriend got the shoo maker pancake and he loved it. He's a picky fried chicken eater and that was the first thing that was gone. Southern belle grilled cheese was great. Def coming back!!!!! Most of all Jonathan our server was amazing

vvi5sjbyEtvw_p3mO5l2xQ.text: Great food, huge portions!!! Try the goat cheese appetizer and the fig covered pork chops - very nice!

fWBBoI64B6nGZAtg-XaQ0Q.text: New brunch menu is so amazing. Mimosas definitely didn't disappoint and the drink list was awesome. Our waiter, William, was so personable, fun, and helpful! Such great service. We will definitely be back!

XP0qmnj6X3VTmj-SBy2Bow.text: Delicious chicken salads! I didn't expect the variety of chicken salads.  I had the Italian--a pesto and dried tomato chicken salad. DELICIOUS! Try out this place.  It's homey and nice.   BTW, I, for the first time in my life, left my purse at the restaurant.  I called 10 minutes later, and they had my purse and even though they were closed, they waited for me to come back to get it.  When I offered them some money, they refused, and this sweet woman said she is just so glad they were able to return it to me and no harm be done.

mu_NsNTkyWy7ElSluezHUg.text: We moved to Charlotte, North Carolina from Southern California this past June and this was by far the BEST meal we've had since we've been here. Probably one of the best meals at a restaurant ever. My husband and I are snobs about food, quality and taste, Tupelo Honey hit it out of the park! We started with the grit poppers, hubby had the tenderloin, and I had the lamb....it was all incredibly fantastic!

dL4NJAh-_yMfMNpCQDVQ5w.text: My girlfriends and I were recommended to check out Tupelo Honey Cafe for Sunday Brunch. We are all new residents from NY and didn't know of a place to go, so we gave it a shot. I was very impressed and loved it! All i can say is that our server Jonathan made our experience the best! I am a bartender / waitress myself, so i set higher standards for those serving me, and he went above and beyond. He was very knowledgeable about the menu and even let us northerner's taste grits for the first time! We got a Debutante omlet, Eggs Betty, and the Southern Poutine Scramble and plenty of mega mimosas which were delicious! I loved the environment inside, and it seemed like everyone was having a great time. I will definitely be returning and spreading the word!!

qz6esKJ2pcLkGJp5FKOnEQ.text: Well, I must say this place was perfect for someone looking for some local Southern type of food with an organic and green feel.   The shrimp and grits did not disappoint.  I love the goat cheese notes with the red peppers and shrimp.  It was perfect and I wish I had something left to take home.  I have to find out how to get more restaurants in LA to serve grits and polenta. IJS.   The biscuits and warm honey was a great start. Fried green tomatoes come on a bed of grits.  They were a tad salty for my taste but I am wondering if I am really a fan of the appetizer since I haven't found the FGT of my dreams or if I am holding on to my fondness of the movie (Towanda!).  I am a fan of both the pickled and fried okra. Again, may be looking in LA for a jar of pickled okra sometime soon.  Smh.   The service was great and the ambiance was very upbeat and friendly. Matthew was kind, knowledgeable, patient and attentive.

NoTxmowaGTz35YHJOltuBA.text: Tupelo Honey Cafe is great I had the honey Chipotle wings and  they were fabulous ... I had the greatest waitress named Karlee she did not miss a Beat so if you like great food ask for Karlee and go to Tupelo Honey Cafe....

3t6RnkGO76aZ-DbRGvqQ0w.text: Great Mother's Day lunch, Captain William made sure we had plenty of food and beer! Awesome experience!

mneeaZSKgfORh87T4khDTg.text: Good looking dining area and friendly, knowledgeable staff. I don't understand why they put the effort to label their side dishes as vegan on the menu, but not their entrees. The black bean burger is a good option, but needed a little hot sauce to please my taste buds. The Tupelo tofu wings are almost vegan, i believe just depending on your honey stance and are a favorite for the wife.   Their craft beer list is respectable. A few from Asheville (Greenman, Highland), couple from Charlotte, with a few other nice national options. The bar area looked nice, separated from the main dining area. Overall, they seem to be a really good fit for SouthEnd.

NVmRUU88yPHMd29ZqJHrUQ.text: I went here in March 2016 and it was excellent.  I returned in April 2017 and it wasn't very good.  The menu had changed and they were boasting a new chef, but I wasn't impressed.  Also, even though we went at 2PM on a Saturday, we could only order from the brunch menu which I found odd.  They apparently don't start serving from their full menu until dinner on the weekends, and I just don't want eggs in the afternoon.  The service was OK, but I had to keep asking for my tea to get refilled even though she was refilling everyone else's drinks at my table, so that was kind of weird.

dBeOPK5beI1K1eYkw74bGg.text: The fact I even gave it one star is because they force you to rate it. I would give it 0 to be honest! Worst breakfast place ever. We had poor service, bad food, and the staff was unfriendly. Our coffee tasted old and had grounds floating all in our cups, and the coffee was barely Luke-warm. The waitress never refilled our drinks or coffee (it wasn't good coffee anyway) and only came back to our table 1 time.  My poached eggs were the size of a quarter and tasted like vinegar- yuck, turned my stomach how gross they were! My toast was cold and bendable, very unappetizing! My husband had eggs Benedict and said the eggs were small, overlooked and very lackluster and boring! We ate at Tupelo Honey in Asheville and that place was awesome! Way cooler atmosphere and perfect service, food and service- not in Charlotte- that place sucked! Go to Toast if you want a great breakfast...I would even say Cracker Barrel or Bob Evans is wayyyy better as well!  Don't eat here! Yuck!  Oh, the steps to get up and down into the restaurant are steep and small, a total lawsuit waiting to happen! Don't take any old people there...they have an elevator but it is so slow and not worth the wait!  Like I said, don't waste your money here! 2 thumbs down!

ZnpK4__m40NZHCM6hmdBcw.text: Great food, horrible service:  I grew up in Asheville and frequented the Tupelo Honey Cafe there, so when one opened in Charlotte, I had to check it out.   First, I will say that the food was on-point, the atmosphere was exceptional, and the fact that we didn't have to wait for a table was awesome. But the server we had (and I hope this is not reflective of the entire serve staff) made me not want to go back. Our six water glasses remained empty for the majority of the evening (only being refilled once, when we put all six empty water glasses on the edge of the table), it took 25 minutes for her to return with our second round of beers (after we had to remind her, for which she did not apologize), she took our appetizers away before we were finished with them (and we couldn't ask for them back because she smashed one of the plates on top of the unfinished plate), and she made no apology or excuse for her behavior.   The worst part was when we had gone out of our way to order a surprise piece of pie to be the birthday dessert of a member of our group -- we were there for a birthday dinner -- she said she would try to find a candle, and not only did she not find a candle (which is fine), but when she brought the pie over, she didn't give us a chance to sing or do anything because she just plopped it down in front of the birthday girl and walked away.

d3b60ZfAwqcmf9qcMqUfmQ.text: Good southern food.  They try to give it a bit of a twist.  Location is fun.  But would I be back? Ehhhh probably not.  Food was good but not great.  Solid.  Nothing on the menu jumped out at me and the taste was good but not exceptional.

lH7OMiDlDxYDRPr4AESZ7g.text: Hah!  Like Giannabrie, I too kinda drink the THC Kool Aid and have been salivating for the restaurant to open since the Charlotte location annoucement was made a few months ago.  Let's just say if you're a fan of the Asheville location, this location IS different, but won't disappoint.    The food is very similar, and I believe consistent to what you find at the original.  (Pillowy biscuits and blueberry jam packed with whole fruit...those famous sweet potato pancakes the size of your head with crunchy pecans...oh yeah!)   What won me over were the servers and bar staff who knew exactly what each menu item included and weren't afraid to make recommendations. The staff is very friendly and even with a packed house on two occasions, we still felt attended to, and our needs met.  (Once, I was on a time crunch of an hour, and despite a completely full bar area, our server made sure our food came out quickly, and our bill taken care off within that 60 minute window.)   Note:  No reservations taken under I believe it is 6 or 8 people.  Their first week they also didn't accept phone carry-out orders...you had to go in and order in person, and wait at the restaurant.  That was a bit irritating.  Note 2: Parking can be tricky during peak hours, (Liberty is in the same plaza, along with other businesses) so plan accordingly.   Bottom Line:  If you're a fan of the other locations...and enjoy their style of Southern cuisine, put this on your list.  It's a great go-to for Breakfast, lunch or dinner. I also think it's a good place to take out-of-town guests for a real taste of the Carolinas.

f5CvigccXSF-_37hNe4wEg.text: Ummm... so this place is my jam! I first encountered Tupelo at their original spot in downtown Asheville. I could tell you what all is good with detail, but honestly everything I have ever had here is flippin' fantastic. I'm talking waddling out the door with a food baby good. I've taken a couple groups of folks here and they have all thoroughly enjoyed it as well. This could be a great place to introduce out-of-towners to southern cuisine being that it has some classics along with some modern interpretations. Tupelo is a local spot and honors seasonal foods which means the menu is always changing and the food is always fresh.  In Essence: + Amazing food! (local, fresh, seasonal) + Fun cozy atmosphere + Friendly Staff + Great pricing + Group friendly/Good for visitors -Parking challenges at times, but at least it's free.

gyVUdvwIviW-M1S2Zwo1iw.text: By far one of the best meals I have had since moving to Charlotte.  Our server Sam offered us several options of for drinks. We opted for a Manhattan and a speciality cocktail made with lavender. Both were delicious! We tried the deep fried avacado which was creamy and tasted so fresh. We also got the Ham Wonton which reminded us of summer.... My husband tried the Shoo Mercy shrimp and grits with chrizo sausage.  Creamy and savory with a bit of spice! I enjoyed the Sweet potato pecan pancake with chicken. It was sweet and light. The chicken was cooked to perfection!  During our entire meal Sam offered suggestions of meals, was attentive and courteous. This is a man who truly enjoys his job. He was knowledgeable about food and cocktails. This is an employee whom I would hire to work for me.  He was by far one of the best people I have ever had the pleasure to wait on me in any business transaction. My husband and I recently moved to Charlotte and when we have visitors come to our home -we will be bringing them there!!!

VFMYCUaHWDss248EZi7wUw.text: Try the Shrimp grits , a bit oily due to the added chorizo but it's great, a heavy dish

xgtAE-stmV6FOk2BtwmE5g.text: Simply not as good as the Asheville location. Food doesn't seem to be made with the same kind of love. I've been to this location several times and on more than one occasion they've gotten our food wrong. Service isn't as warm, either.

DyZh6R_RSMy_4E0mPBBA2A.text: We hosted a Beer Babes Brunch Sunday, March 22nd and it was not only a blast but well executed. Kevin was such a pleasure to work with and made sure to accommodate our every need. The Chef also did a fantastic job making sure that all the food specifications and allergies were accounted for. He even prepared a few individual dishes for those with specific needs. The ladies enjoyed everything about the brunch from the beer cocktails and food, to the man named Kevin! Lol Such a fun event that we would LOVE to host again!

lMdnbuE5UtQ_6-YfogAwcg.text: Always consistent. Great for brunch, and a great place to bring out of town guests. Big fan of the BLET sandwich. Always great service, and who doesn't love the biscuits?!

tLd7TsMde25m0LYJUHApHA.text: The decor is sunny and cute. The service is attentive and prices are moderate. The complimentary biscuits are delicious and remind of my late Granny's.  Mmmm to the homemade jam.  A little disappointed in the omelet,for the yummy description did not match the basic presentation. Sweet potato pancake is plate-sized and yummy--we did not need any syrup. Also would like to see some turkey bacon/sausage or chicken sausage ( NC has local farmers who produce) added to the menu since they are big on local ingredients. Heard the coffee is good and will try on a future visit.

X5aUThaiEefq9EafcSS18g.text: We throughly enjoyed our experience at Tupelo Honey. This has only been open for a few weeks, but there were no signs of that at our meal. The service was excellent, taking care of our needs but not overwhelming us with constant attention. The food was wonderful. My wife throughly enjoyed her Charleston chicken sandwich. I had the steak au poivre and loved every bite. The quality of the steak was outstanding and it was cooked to perfection. And the mac & cheese was, in a word, incredible. I would marry this mac & cheese. I wanted to go to other tables and ask if they had any leftover mac & cheese I could finish off. We will definitely be back for more!

lHtfCyoyrL6-C-RWoo0DFA.text: I've been here a few times. Solid brunch and lunch. I've gotten the grit bowls and a variety of salads at lunch time. Moderately priced. Get a reservation if you want to go for Saturday or Sunday brunch!

6sjZ1ACTyeLsjg_x_B_sIg.text: Lovely southern brunch spot. They have a beautiful terrace during the summertime. And omgosh the biscuits it's are so die for, it will be difficult to stop eating! As others have said, there's always a wait so come prepared to grab some OJ and wait to be called. Authentic southern food so if you're in the mood for that, come here!

t7IQZr-Na3xkkDwdNVS9Uw.text: We are in town from Omaha for the day.....looked on Yelp.....review looked interesting......never heard of this place.  YOU ARE CRAZY IF YOU DON'T GO HERE!  Cedric and his staff did a great job...I'M TELLING YOU.......CRAZY!  Jim and Holly Omaha, NE

sG2mjVYiTLEGC6VQjMOc2w.text: The food was good and very eclectic southern.  I ordered 2 drinks, Cosmo and Mint Mojito on the menu and they did not have the ingredients to make them. Biscuits are great!!  Service was good.  However, in NC they have health rating system for restaurants and they only had a 90.8, 95+ is about the lowest you want to see.  Looks like they might have some kitchen issues.

0f6OdqjYLC6eJX85z6xDjA.text: Best Honey Chicken wings hands down. Love their take on lemonade. Cute and warm atmosphere. The Pewter Rose was one of my favorite spots in Charlotte and they have done a great job of turning over that place. I will return.

ilwdRhszpaaZpFTC4U2AtA.text: Wonderful,  causal food with excellent waite staff!  I briefly watched the kitchen staff (the restaurant has an open view kitchen) and it was well run, smooth operation. They produced excellent fresh and delicious food,  quickly.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. The WONDERFUL chicken BLT!

UP2K7o7i3wY2ARcDQYdOZA.text: One of my favorite places to eat in Charlotte. If you can, sit at the bar when Mel is there. Makes fantastic drinks, very attentive, and very personable. My favorite dish has to be the Shoo Grilled Cheese with the tomato soup. The Appalachian Egg Rolls are by far one of my favorite apps in the city. Been to the Asheville downtown location, but the service and location here in the Queen City takes the cake...or the pecan pie...whatever you're into!

BtM9cmwAK2bsfXEmaKfyjQ.text: What a great breakfast spot! We got there early on a Sunday morning to beat the wait and it was worth it. I had the breakfast bowl - the goat cheese grits are rich but delicious. My boyfriend had the fried green tomato BLT - also delicious.   Love the decor and all of servers and hostesses were courteous and attentive. I would definitely recommend Tupelo Honey for a yummy weekend brunch but get there early or else you'll most like face a wait.

H7E9P5TlUXZ-UzxhzvgB0w.text: You see that yellow heavily garnished drink in the pictures? That's the queen Mary (Bloody Mary) sounds great on the menu, looks great in the pic, but unfortunately I recommend staying away from it. The food and service are still awesome... Fried egg BLT rocks!

5huIjJS8sCGcwfQPy_Gz1A.text: Absolute favorite for Eggs Benedict in Charlotte!  Bloody Mary is yummy and biscuits are to die for!  However, for me the table situation brought it down 1 star because getting a table can be painful.  The bar area is 1st come/1st serve which can get ugly and annoying to those that are seated and being stalked by the hungry.  But, food is so good!

5pHe4fIt1VxbHuMNogLFYA.text: Love that we don't have to drive to Asheville anymore to get some of the best Southern food around. Unique flavors, excellent sides, top notch sweet tea, and great service. My only wish was that they allowed reservations for parties smaller than 8

1tNyyXSIq3CTDV40d0I4SQ.text: Not a fan of the new lunch/dinner menu, removed breakfast items for lunch. Less gluten-free options. Bring back the breakfast bowls and I'll come back.

tbzfdT4F8S-B4OJ-qTyYFw.text: Hands down the best food around! I had the Nutty Chicken with Sweet potatoes & asparagus and it was amazing! I have also had the tomato soup and grilled sandwich and it was delicious!!! Great atmosphere and friendly staff. Highly recommend!

fmE8Lu4ZxirNeCZ-hQqJcA.text: I really like this place. My girlfriend and I went for dinner a couple months ago. This place has some of the best crab cakes I have ever tasted in my life! They come with big. Hunks of meat in them which is a massive plus and a sweet spicy saracha type sauce. Highly recommended! I had the pork dish - another recommended dish. Southern modern food at a reasonable price and we'll worth a visit by anyone in the south end area

HyEfOmYnYH_rUOtpcalTag.text: fantastic! Authentic southern food with incredible ambiance. Their jam is amazing!

GDz3zlLGMmWTa83oqYA7pA.text: I took my Team Members of the year to your Charlotte location on 5/9/19 for a celebratory dinner. We were a group of 13. It was an embarrassing experience. The service was extremely slow to begin with. After taking 30 minutes to get waters and our drinks ordered I found the manager to let her know. She either didn't do anything or didn't have the resources to do so. From then on the experience got worse. Many of the items people ordered weren't available, particularly the vegetables which makes vegetarian dining difficult. The service continued to be slow and felt inhospitable. We made this reservation well in advance. Your team should have been proactive about staffing for a large group and making sure we were well taken care of. In reality you let one server struggle to take care of our table while also tending the bar and serving other tables. We noticed a number of tables that were dirty when we arrived and dirty when we left. For a place that is charging $20+ a dish it felt like we were eating in a school cafeteria.

Z4fCZsy1zjbuPAkdUD-rYA.text: One of the best breakfasts in Charlotte and ever. The biscuits are great with both the honey and jam. Cocktails are great especially the insane large blood Mary. Do yourself a favor and order either the Shoo Mercy omelette or chicken and waffles - the best two breakfast items I've ever had (I'm Lukewarm on the red flannel hash). Probably the first stop I'd recommend in Charlotte for breakfast.

Z2GSYoQEqfODaT8jhbzMYA.text: This restaurant kept it together especially our waitress Logan!!! We were a crowd of 60 that arrived at 6 on a Sunday with a 3 waiter staff to assist us. Yes, we made reservations and it didn't take long for us to be seated. The food was great and my Southern roots were well satisfied. If there's anyone looking for Southern food with a twist this is the place to go. Upon reading the cookbook about the chef, I was happy to know about how much our childhood had in common. I cook often at home and would not eat Southern food outside of my home, but this has changed. I will pay top dollar to eat here again. I had the fried green tomatoes sandwich but I sampled my families FRIED CHICKEN, and CATFISH. It was delicious. You must try the MACARONI AND CHESSE!!!!!! It will make your grandma cry! Y'all....you've got to try it!

OOIBjj-djXGH0widPna6MQ.text: I give Tupelo's Brunch specifically 5 stars as I argue it's one of the best in town. Great food choices, I've had the shrimp and grits, chicken and waffles and challah French toast, all amazing. Great coffee, great cocktails.   Be warned, make a reservation in advance for this place as it gets crazy on the weekends

-eGHxqQwsiGpIhMMbxOPVQ.text: Mmmmm... Home style cooking at its best. The menu is large. Some items I don't "love" but all items are pretty damn good. Tupelo Honey's food flourishes with ideas of what it would be like to have your parents or grandparents cook for big families at home. Well. Assuming they cooked southern food.   Some of my favorite items are the grilled okra with ranch, fried green tomatoes, open faced honey fried chicken sandwich, anything fried chicken related, their gravy, and their Rosemary peach iced tea!  Still plenty more to try at the restaurant. I've had the steak and eggs, but found the steak to be too seasoned/marinated for my taste. (I liked a simply seasoned steak) But it was good and my boyfriend loves it.   Definitely one of our go to restaurants with great service. It's loud inside and coooold. But we love sitting in their outside area and listening to the rain.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wicked chicken. Delicious

6UyAxbZhqr8sTEcUt8oyDQ.text: I was in town for work last week and cannot wait to come back. Everything from the fried green tomatoes to the shrimp and grits was incredible! I'm looking forward to coming back to Charlotte just so I can eat here!!

ES07l8IVUGJhViaZMLxDfQ.text: I have been here a few times but yet each time the food quality changes. Sadly, when I went for breakfast this morning my pancakes were burnt and the chicken and eggs were cold. The server was semi-attentive. The milk given to use for coffee and tea also appeared spoiled. Hopefully, this place can get it together as a few of my friends have also had similar experiences.

Eih6x-qE8vWoNOQfiBauLw.text: Oh, THC, How I (used to) love thee.  Don't trip out, I still love THC.  But the restaurant needs work.  If you've ever visited the (What I believe to be) original location in Asheville, you know why this place deserved the hype and long lines when first adding a location in the QC.  A new restaurant with a big following/fan-base, is bound to have issues with service, wait times, and some food items not coming out right.  However this place has had years to fix their issues and they just seem complacent in providing 2 star service and 3 star food at 5 star prices.  I live to eat, not eat to live, so I'm cool with dropping a pretty-penny on brunch, lunch, pretty much any unch.  But none of our most recent trips here have been enjoyable/worth the spend.  I hope they fix their issues with service and food being delivered in a timely fashion whilst accurately portraying what was depicted in the menu.  I'd like this place to survive but service is king, especially in the queen city - there are better places to leave my 30%.

MsOtBNFaiLyvxVFah9QzqA.text: Topeka honey is the best it has great service and great food I love the food  My favorite is the biscuits and gravy they are so so so good  it is my favorite breakfast place in the world

ri_Edxt-YFbiIRRqrgtKyA.text: I had high expectations for Tupelo Honey:/ Perhaps, the Brunch crowd and fast pace compromised the food quality. I ordered the steak /eggs also ordered a small dish of mac n cheese..solely based on the reviews. The steak was well cooked but it arrived like warm. There's a bourbon bacon sauce paired with the steak-phenomenal.  I'd say the mac n cheese has awesome texture and richness. Honestly, this was a good meal but I expected much better. Lastly the server was pleasant and knowledgeable. Love the decor and pet friendly atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheat day#Red meat
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rich and dreamy banana pudding
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Heavenly banana pudding..light &amp; fluffy topping

tgiA82sJg0eP1iCnC-y_3g.text: Breakfast was on point!! You can tell everything was fresh. Staff was very nice, specially considering how busy they are on a Saturday morning! Would go again!!!

mq76QXhpH314BuPFv-_ydQ.text: My fiance and I met up with my brother and sister-in-law for my birthday brunch. I started off with the Moonswine Mary, a 16 oz. jalapeno-infused moonshine Bloody Mary with bacon garnish. Just the right amount of spice from the pepper, and you can never go wrong with bacon.   For eats, I decided on the Super Southern Breakfast Bowl. Layered black-eyed peas, grits, eggs, bacon, cheese, and salsa. I'm not a big fan of peas (it's a texture thing) but everything was delicious. The grits were just thick enough, the eggs were great, and the two thick slices of bacon was a perfect addition.   My fiance got the fried chicken with a side of fried okra, which both were out of this world. The okra was fried just enough to still retain it's crispy crunch and the chicken breast melted in your mouth the the creamy milk gravy.   My brother got the Southern Fried Chicken BLT, which was HUGE! Mostly had to deconstruct and reconstruct it to be able to eat, but he had no complaints. He also opted for the fried okra side.  Sister-in-law got the Shoo Mercy Pancake. It came with candied pecans on top, which were not listed on the menu, so she removed those, but everything else was great with hers.   Would definitely recommend, and will definitely be back for more at some point. Only reason it is not five stars is it took a while for our food to come out and to get our checks. We were seated right beside the waiters' computer, so it's not like we were tucked away in a corner, so that was somewhat frustrating, but I'm sure not a common thing for this restaurant.

khbm8ubHN_aSdqf_iEfLaQ.text: The staff here are super nice. I came here for brunch (mainly the mimosas) but I still wanted food the waitress help me put an order together that wasn't too much food for me. I appreciate the fact That she offered to ask the cook for my special request!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tupelo Honey Mimosa

leaXkgKW_-XPbRNNM275Ww.text: It wasn't bad. Service was a tad bit slow, but it was expected seeing my group went on Saturday around 12. The portion sizes were abysmal given the prices. I ordered the fried chicken and biscuits with a "mega mimosa". The food was very good, but it was literally in what I felt was a cereal bowl ($16). Nothing about my mimosa said "mega", but the price ($11). I ended up spending $35 on what I felt would lead me the Chick Fil A down the street next. I'm not saying I wouldn't be back, but I know when I make my next appearance, I won't be as caught off guard by spending almost $40 on brunch.

G6dO8BBMxod_N9CTlW6_6Q.text: Portions are terrible, and the price reeks of pretentiousness.   4 people with no booze can't get out of there for less than 100 bucks with tip. I've never been so underwhelmed in my life. I've been to the one in Asheville and, for some reason, this one pales in comparison.   I will not be returning.

bVjAtlULw_dwvFkJ7QkIaw.text: I went with my family (party of 6) for Saturday brunch.  We had reservations and were seated right away.  The restaurant was not very crowded, so we expected that we would have quick service.  That was not the case.  The server was friendly enough, but everything took way too long, even for a southern restaurant.  Nothing was exceptional.  The drinks were very slow in making their way to the table and refills were even slower.  Our fried green tomato appetizer did not arrive until after our meals were served; however, the waiter did take them off of the bill.  Everyone's meals were OK.  Nothing special, though the portions were very large.  I had ordered poached eggs, but they came out hard boiled.  The server did offer to send out new ones, but by this time, most of the party had already finished their meal.  I have been there before and the food was much better as was the service - not this day and I will probably not return.

OijT8wT8u9hf3pFelU9TZA.text: So disappointed. We originally went to the Myrtle Beach location and we loved it. The food and atmosphere were both great. We stopped on our way through Charolette and I felt like we were at a Cracker Barrel. The food was not fresh and neither of our dishes had much flavor. It's amazing the difference in locations.

KdsQ5y0RZ7gCYA_8uuWRwQ.text: So sadly disappointed by this place. I've frequented this place more than a dozen of times and the last THREE times have been less than fair. I went it during my lunch break all to wait for 45 minutes for my grilled cheese and salad for the Chef to come out and tell me the kitchen burned it.. while I respect the Chefs approach, this could've been disclosed to us when it happened, not 45 minutes later into waiting, only after me asking for a manager because no one had approached the table. When I finally did get my food, 54 minutes later, it was barely luke warm and my "grilled cheese" had ONE piece of cheese and overly dry/toasted bread. I came in with only one other person and so excited for a good lunch and break from work and left with an empty stomach and bad taste of dry bread.  From the sound of the tables around me today, they weren't very pleased either.   For the biscuits sake, please get better on the rest of your menu! The biscuits were the only thing I'd ever pay for here.

6mCywQ-WexInCVbQ_WMahA.text: It was a busy Sunday lunch but it didn't take us too long to get a seat.  Our server was excellent, and she brought us biscuits right away to appease our 3 year old.  The biscuits and blueberry jam are excellent.  But then the LONG wait for our food started.  It took about 45 minutes to get our food, which is way too long.  When our food came out, everything tasted bland.  My fried chicken blt was great when I put salt & hot sauce on it.  The chicken was perfectly fried.  My hubby's shrimp and grits was bland as well, and didn't merit the $18 price tag... with just a small amount of thin sauce with roasted red peppers.  Luckily they do have an awesome hot sauce here.   I really wanted to love this place, but unfortunately that did not happen.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried chicken sandwich, wish it had more flavor
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits, a bit bland

rryQqiGBc2F_a5sJ2XU4ZA.text: Had dinner here tonight to celebrate my anniversary. Service was excellent, server Carissa was extremely helpful with menu suggestions and even noticed us exchanging cards and asked if we were celebrating. She brought us dessert on the house and the manager, Chris, brought us champagne. Dinner was great, chocolate cake was delicious and service was outstanding. Will definitely visit them again!!

UCiVwL3-t2cWvv4oGf5s2w.text: Awesome tasty menu that has good quality fresh ingredients and awesome atmosphere! I had the good country breakfast . Cool decor.

koZ2bP5Cm7Hq6Ewg7kjq8Q.text: The concept and atmosphere was nice but they totally missed the mark on culinary execution. I ordered the strawberry shortcake dessert which was basically a biscuit with strawberries and plain yogurt. the brussel sprouts were ok, but i've had way better. The flavors of the sweet potato pancake were a bit overpowering and the piece of chicken that came with it was on the small side. The lavender limeaide was good though hardly lavender, and the bacon was good. Def disappointed.

9suIH3dvs0VCK15mNih-dA.text: I went to tupelo Honey Cafe last night and the food was so fresh and the flavors were just so different the small plate chicken wings were so good, i had fried shrimp with the kale slaw so amazingly good i also had quinoa with feta and arugula it was good but a lot i really with they had one in long island New York ooooooh baby id be there a lot!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried shrimp slices of cherry and it had a honey something sauce the kale slaw and the quinoa with feta arugula and blueberries.

S-NoHWGkxxRCLZeiFKnfrg.text: Service was good food was a little above average. Would have given another star however there dinner menu in week nights is very small. I've heard nothing but good things about their brunch so Id suggest trying that unless you really in a tight spot and everywhere else was busy with long waits. I went on a Thursday evening and it wasn't busy at all.

n01Firbe9KlocxvzPthZEQ.text: I've had great service here and I've had poor service here.  The food is pretty good, the shrimp and grits are very spicy, the veggie melt is heavenly, and the biscuits with berry jam is so special I could eat them daily.  That being said, the hit or miss service will probably keep me away for awhile.......hopefully when I decide to return they will have the service issues corrected.

vECmI63neoTBUktjcnOrYA.text: We didn't make the Asheville location so was eagerly awaiting the South End location to open.  This is one of the few places the menu challenges me.  all of the dishes have a slant where it is like almost seems appealing but you know it would be too hard to remove.  There is not a standard type waffle or sandwich that really catches my eye.  The Shrimp & Grits - where's the shrimp?  There were only a few.  The goat cheese made the dish heavy but it didn't seem to add what I was hoping in terms of flavor.

8FNsk9Jw-bXhpOtbU6JGhw.text: Having been to the original location in Asheville, this location fails to reach their success in the kitchen.    Service was simply meh and unresponsive (slower than it should be and not organized).  Onto the food.  I had the carnivore breakfast pie with a side of breakfast potatoes, that was so bad I couldn't eat it.   The meat appeared to be one slice of thin low grade ham lunch meet diced up and spread through a scrambled egg baked in a pie crust.  The eggs were over cooked to a rubber texture, and the pie crust was too thick and dry to be served in a 4" tart shape.  I tried adding ketchup, then mayonnaise, then syrup.  Nothing seemed to work, so I only ate the potatoes, which were simply ok.   The only reason I give them 2 stars, is because the biscuits they bring to the table may be in the top 5 in the city.  However, if you are going for breakfast, just get the sweet potato pancake as it was the only good thing served at our table.

5oxBYRQke7kLO7L3X-A3Ag.text: Disappointing at best. Service was really slow, and the value for the money was just not there. The food did have good flavor, but the value made it very disappointing.

Fvcy9ihuPFN0qyj9nqfSAw.text: This WAS one of our favorite places to eat.  We just left without ordering after looking at the new menu.  All of our favorite foods were dropped off their menu.  We ended up paying for our 2 teas. $6.50 for 2 small teas is ridiculous.

7GUNr4BA1JHhtMcoGI-1tA.text: Brunch is always incredible at Tupelo. Starts with the biscuit with honey and continues to the Mega Mosa's. Add fried chicken with biscuits smothered in ham gravy (and of course hot sauce) and you have yourself the start to a successful weekend! When you get severed by William you will be laughing and receive your delicious plate in no time. Truly a pleasure every time we come here. The staff, food, and overall atmosphere is what keeps us coming back!

F4CYWr3QwbDaymUiJI3TKw.text: Tupelo honey is the best brunch spot! Love to go here for the chicken and biscuits! Add the fried egg! William is the best server! Attentive and fun!

cqgEhiW32mSYDolyKoesVg.text: Definitely the best meal I've had in months! I had the Wicked Chicken "knife and fork" biscuit with a side of mac-n-cheese, and it was incredible. I was there with a party of 6, and everyone felt the same about their meals -- even my very picky son who devoured the grilled cheese.... Crust and all!   The service was fantastic. We had a reservation, and it was ready for us when we arrived, despite how busy they were. And our meals came out very quickly also.  It felt like almost no waiting... But maybe that was the sample plate of pancakes they brought to the table, or the fried green tomatoes appetizer.  When we were leaving, we saw some gift items we wanted, and the staff was incredibly helpful and nice. They even showed us how to sign up for the mailing list to get a free item.  Definitely worth going, and going again!

7w8CV9Ike6-L4SMDO_WdWA.text: So yummy! We brought our 7 month out for brunch and the staff was so friendly and helpful even with a baby!  Our server, Dutch, was patient and kind with us. A favorite brunch spot for sure!

CRdJRRM_pV2ptPFBFxU56g.text: I feel like this is a place to go for breakfast or brunch but not for dinner. Even for lunch not a lot on the menu for sandwiches or salads. Good atmosphere and service.

S9hFq9jp1ltdmo7mCpaReg.text: I've wanted to visit the Asheville location for years, but never have. Having read a few mixed reviews of the Charlotte location, I wasn't sure what to expect. Overall, I thought this restaurant was great!!!  We were a party of 6 on a Saturday night, and although it was crowded, we were seated within 20 minutes. All of our drinks were great; we had wine, margaritas and other mixed drinks. The drinks were strong enough for the price and well sized.  Everything you read about the biscuits is True: they are AMAZING. Best biscuit I've had in a long time; possibly in forever :)  For entrees we tried the Chicken Piccata w/shrimp, Shrimp and Grits, Grilled Cheese and soup, the Veggie Bowl and the Veggie platter. Portion sizes were great and the food was excellent!! We laughed because there was literally not a single crumb left on any of the six plates. Other than licking them clean, we each ate every last bite!!  For dessert we ordered the banana pudding: it's EXCEPTIONAL!!!! Seriously, between the biscuits, entree and dessert, we left very full!  Best part was the bill; $76 for 2 people including 4 drinks, 2 entrees, dessert and tax. To me, that's a great value in Charlotte!  Thanks for the wonderful night out: we will be back (next time for breakfast) :)

nWQALr5N7PNHhRs1lB-4Lw.text: Yummy! Everything we ordered was great! Watermelon salad was delicious. Server Jonathan was very attentive.

bXZUZEGzyqm_-w4ivXP6mw.text: Big fat YUM! Great drinks, delicious food! TPC has an atmosphere that is bright and airy for dining. The bar has fun lights over each table that harken of yesteryear.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Buttermilk Shrimp &amp; elegant, tasty Violet Beauregard

rpUKVHXHLfazogBHp52Zaw.text: i continue to be surprised about how good the food is here. every dish i have ordered has been delicious and unique. and the biscuits......divine!

LUBRvIDZpfo_GWU3O99I6Q.text: This place is amazing!!! Dylan in the bar was spectacular, super attentive, personable, and helpful. The food is outstanding and super fresh and unique: We will absolutely be back! Love this place!

R3mM7bOCQiTfyQuBgazv9Q.text: I know people love this place, but it's truly overrated. My breakfast bowl was greasy and unpleasant, the mediocre coffee costs $3.50 (really?), and the pancakes are just plain heavy.  The service is good, and the spot is pretty, but if you're hoping to eat good food, there are a lot of better options out there.

WaFq_1zdomsEIxVAINFvjg.text: We heard about Tupelo honey from friends of ours that were religious patrons of their Asheville location.  At their insistence, we had dinner there one night a few weeks after they opened.  The only way I can describe Tupelo is this: have you ever eaten at a restaurant where the menu SOUNDS better than the food actually TASTES? That's basically it in a nutshell. I wasn't overly impressed (or really impressed at all) by anything that our table ordered. Just poor execution.  Hopefully they work out whatever kinks are keeping this from being a great foodie destination!

_S0lUaHCS-OerPuUP3i57g.text: Early afternoon on a Friday, we ate at Tupelo's. We enjoy sitting at the tables in the bar and the food is always good, especially the biscuits. However, service is a different story. On this Friday afternoon Tupelo was not crowded. We ordered and it seemed to have taken an unusually long time for our food to arrive. We ate and then sat and sat and sat as we waited and watched our server chatting with someone else, checking her cell phone and disappear behind the swinging doors. I asked another server for a to go box. I asked one of the managers if we could get our check. We paid, left and will think twice about going back. Customers should not put up with lack of service.

RZny7rodJxyti31loXoJzQ.text: This quaint and homey restaurant, while boasting an appealing menu, lacks in a variety of areas. But I'll start with the positives. While others boast poor service, we had quite the opposite. Our server was attentive, checking on us at just the right intervals. Waters never ran empty, and he was kind in his approach. We started with a pimento cheese appetizer. Honestly, this didn't taste like any pimento I've ever had and not in a good way. The flavor was lacking, and there was a heavy granular texture. The pickled jalapeno went well with it, but I would have liked that taste to be incorporated into the cheese instead of on the side. The chips were overly salted, which also muted my taste buds to any flavor the cheese might have had. Served alongside the appetizer was a corn meal biscuit with warm honey and blueberry jam. While the biscuit was a bit dry, the honey compensated for this. The blueberry lacked in sweetness, but this was actually a plus side. It also paired well. I had the Charleston Chicken sandwich, which was decent. The bread was a little over-buttered, but other than that the chicken was moist and the Havarti cheese was a perfect choice. On the side was the lemon quinoa, which was overpowered by the extremely ripe blueberries. If I had a bite without a blueberry, it was perfect. An odd note, but if the blueberries hadn't been so ripe they would have worked nicely. My partner had the Fried Chicken BLT. Honestly, it needed a bit more of the honey dijon as the flavor in the chicken was muted by the bread and tomato. The chicken alone (out of the sandwich) was extremely tasty. The breading was on point and the chicken was moist. However, his side item (the Southern Style Greens) should have been labeled 'Chinese beef and broccoli.' Of course there was no beef, but the greens were so thoroughly swamped in sauce (a soy base I took it) that any flavor that the greens had themselves was lost long ago.   All in all, I might go back every few months. I definitely wouldn't get the same thing, as their dinner entrees looked more appealing after all was said and done. Not a favorite spot of mine, but not terrible by any stretch. Seems like a nice place in good weather to sit outside, have a Happy Hour drink, and enjoy a small app or split an entree.

fRtwYf-bKOzzZG2E0G98hg.text: After sampling just about everything on the menu, I can say this place is worth a visit. I had the fried chicken with the fried green tomato appetizer, and it was wonderful. Don't skip the brussels sprouts either! We had a huge group come in for a work dinner, and William C. took amazing care of us! I don't think I've had faster, more quality service than how he single-handedly helped just under 20 of us. The food was amazing, but service like that keeps us coming back.

KbbPFQyat7ouBywGahG4bw.text: Was really excited to eat here after reading the menu but the comfort food didn't materialize. Had the meatloaf and it was unfortunately dry. Mac n Cheese was very run of the mill and didn't appear to be baked. The pulled pork egg roll app was good though. $50 for two drinks, app, entree and tip. Wish it was better than it was. Place could be great!

IINIGBwB_CHi36NzlmgHSA.text: After a long wait, our host brought us to the table and made a snarky remark when we pointed out the syrup all over the table. They ran out of orange juice at 10:45am on a Sunday. The food was just ok. Should've went somewhere else.

HebZkeJ2geag28aiUJVjYw.text: Can't remember what I was going to say. The Pimento cheese and chips was that good!!!

YnFZLiI3MoVrZptdKTVCTw.text: Cold food, raw bacon, watery omelet (southern), chicken biscuits and gravy (bland).  I've given this place 4 tries...done now.  Will give them huge credit for biscuits, those are great.

UvKVdO7tmpY5c3h3AS3Sog.text: Overrated and nothing great on the menu...need more healthy options. No local or seasonal items on menu either or doesn't leave you with a unique experience like most cafes do.   Sorry Charlotte...Tupelo is not what you deserve. Owners please revive your business.

lQ-ta40IVhkeWCmWan-8RQ.text: Good service at a decent price point. However, it was super unhealthy. I got the crab scramble, which sounded healthy. However, it was swimming in grease. Prob won't come back on my own.

IoVdsr4bPTioi-JH4GuWhg.text: Had a group of six people, were told an hour and a half wait. That turned into a 3hour plus wait. We were seated and it took 10 minutes to get waters and even longer to get food orders in to the waitress whom it was clear had no desire or training for this job. The food came out wrong and took excessive time to get and then was mediocre at best. Just an overall terrible experience and I will never go there again. To any of the locations. It's just not up to the hype. Or price.   If I could give less stars I would.

NXKPpIHRuEZwXWUKikFT6w.text: There are places all over the South, where venerable old recipes have been handed down through the generations until absolute perfection is achieved. Tupelo Honey has become the quintessential example of slow, Southern culinary charm...delivered at a blistering 21st Century pace.  Absolutely charming menu, choices galore...and everything possible is locally sourced for quality and freshness. Our server Jonathan, presented with a sincere and cheerful greeting, immediately suggesting the top of the brunch items...while immediately taking our beverage order. While we've been to the Asheville, NC locations, I decided to let Jonathan "sell" me on the menu...and actually, he led me with enthusiasm, knowledge, and personal experience....to order a completely different dish than I originally planned.  We all know, poor service can wreck a great kitchen. Conversely, a great server can deliver a memorable dining experience.  Jonathan is simply great with people; sincere, patient, and very knowledgeable. (*full disclosure - not related in any way to Jonathan or Tupelo Honey)  MUST try the fried chicken breast on a pancake with spiced pecans, apple cider bacon...called Shoo Mercy Pancake....unreal!  The original Asheville location is still my favorite - but happy to see the restaurant move mainstream while keeping to it's roots - creative menu, incredible quality, and great service!  Go often!

FmUTtk6qbDPDXnFa9OciJQ.text: I was midly disappointed when I learned brunch was served all day with the exception of any poached eggs including the eggs benedict!! Overall, there is a lot of variety to pick from and the portions are huge (or maybe I've lived in NY too long and they are normal?).  Good value, although nothing really blew my mind in terms of taste.  Service is a little slow but very friendly.  Would like to come back to try the full breakfast offerings!

3RyVoppN0l-_DplLm8YTjw.text: Delicious biscuits with jalapeno jelly, bacon, and whipped cream. Seriously, so gooood. Staff was curious and helpful. I visited for a Yelp event and was pleasantly surprised at the new brunch foods that we sampled. I will be returning for a full brunch.

ANXdOBdJiJH4hV-o4rsrww.text: Jonathan was awesome!  Best staff in town.  Thanks for the soy sausage in my omelette.

Ek-9aND3nBdjFWgN6GV2SA.text: Ok so first time visit today, it was very empty...probably due to the Panther playoff game.  We had no wait for a table.    Service: Average at best.  I had to remind my waitress twice to bring me lemon for my tea.  And while we are on it, the sweet tea, was fab..however the waitress kept topping me off with WARM sweet tea.  Yeah, by the end of our meal I had tepid sweet tea, but i did eventually get my lemons.  Food: Here's where I'm torn.  I will probably revise this rating when I go back.  The biscuits, yum, scrum-dil-ioucious.  The Appalachian egg-rolls...well,they were very mushy inside.  The first bite was not very good, but when I got going they were tolerable, to pleasant...but the texture inside was mush, that is quite offputting.  My friend got the sweet potato pancake.  It is HUGE!  And she said it was good.  The mashed sweet potato side looked ordinary.  Now onto the reason why I'm so torn...I got the garlic chicken.  It is served with mac and cheese and a swish chard/asparagus side.  My entire plate was covered with grease.  Unsure where it was coming from.  Everything tasted good, but the grease was really off putting.  The chicken was very very garlicky.  I liked that, but in addition to being very garlicky, the topping was also incredibly salty.  Like almost inedible for the regular person.  I could do it b/c I like things on the salty side.  So at the end of the day I'm rating this place 3 stars.  I will most definitely be back.  So stay tuned.  Based on the hype I'm expecting my revised rating to be higher than my first visit.  We shall see.

TBc5u6GfnA640pJyzrpTuQ.text: Stopped in recently and had a great time, mostly thanks to our waitress Karlee - she's so much fun.  She helped us choose some truly excellent food. Believe me the steak is worth it.   Will be back soon.

QDvQgKbZ5Dz3esQHGB68ww.text: Food was really good and the biscuits and honey is a nice touch. Service was fantastic.  We had a table of 10 and our server handled it without missing a beat.  I ordered the shrimp and grits and it was delicious. Everyone in our group also said that their  food was great.

qA4AK69V1VbgAF92JLcDIQ.text: One of my favorite places for breakfast! Wish they were open earlier during the week.

ybBWIzD9WT7LLHmmoPxU8g.text: Good food but pricey for the type of food on the menu. Good southern fare with a creative punch. However, if you're craving southern food, go to Dish, it's a far better value.

ByCLJFXR8wD0V7UZMW0szw.text: I head such great things about this place. Maybe I built it up too much in my head but I wasn't overly impressed. The food was good but in my opinion, there are other places in charlotte that are better.   I would happily go back it's just not my personal favorite

N104RGtn2M5OXqMzpJ_OlQ.text: We got food to go which I am generally skeptical about. I got the pork grilled cheese sandwich. It was the perfect balance between sweet and savory- mostly savory with a slight hint of sweet. The bread could have been crispier but that could also be due to the fact that we got it to go. The potatoes au gratin were just okay. More creamy than cheesy in my opinion. My grandmother got the shrimp and grits and said it was okay. (She had a French restaurant once rated in the top 3 restaurants in NC so she is quite critical). She gave it 3 and I gave it a 4. I think if we had eaten there it would have earned a 4. I'll definitely be going back!  I went back with my parents and was very impressed. We came for brunch around 11:30 and there was a wait for over an hour. We ended up eating at the bar and I was very impressed. My past experiences eating at a bar have required fighting for the attention of the bar tender. Lauren was incredible, she regularly checked in on us regularly and even had a nice conversation or two with us.   The food was amazing. To start, they give you biscuits (free)which were very tasty. I topically find biscuits to be dry and bland but these were slightly salty, and moist. I got the sweet potato pancakes for my main course which were really good. The fried chicken was nothing special though but I love some good sweet potato pancakes.   My mom got the mountain harvest bowl. She said it was a perfect combination of flavors. She said she would definitely get it again.  My dad got the pulled pork grilled cheese sandwich which is my favorite dish. The French fried he got with it were slightly soft which is exactly how I like them. But about half of them were in that perfect medium between soft and crunchy. He thought the sandwich was a creative combination on pumpernickel bread that was very good.  I recommend making a reservation if you plan to eat here.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu (back)
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu (front)
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pulled pork grilled cheese with fries

VCUqCQtoOJzQ-83p7fpcnQ.text: I think a part of Tupelo Honey's draw is the decor. It's a really well arranged and decorated place. It also is recommended by many as a go-to brunch place around town.  I visited TH with a friend during one of Charlotte's latest rainy weekends, it was busy but not packed. We made a reservation, arrived at 12:30 ish and waited no more than 10 minutes.  The service was kind and friendly from the host stand to the those who came to the table. We ordered mimosas (seemed over priced to me). Biscuits come on the table (they weren't particularly warm).  We ordered an appetizer, the fried green tomatoes. They were a little cold, grits needed salt (there was salt on the table) and the red sauce was really delicious. The kitchen was very slow that day. When our main courses came out they were hot and I really enjoyed the fried pickled eggs benedict, but I wish it had had more fried pickles. I don't think my friend and I walked away wow'd like we'd hoped but it was A-OK.

Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried green tomatoes app
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Pickles Benny

l9tQg3Po_RWHPMqveQUjcQ.text: My husband and I went around 530 on a Saturday and was seated immediately. We started with the fried green tomatoes YUMM!! I had the southern Cobb and it was delicious. I finished with the small banana pudding which was divine and the perfect amount to top off the meal!

90uFvdiPoh9FGPAqFv1M7w.text: Hadn't been here in about two years. Wasn't as good as I remembered, though in fairness, the other people in my party seemed to feel a lot better about their meals than I did.  I ordered the honey-dusted fried chicken. It was really dry and nothing special at all. Grits were a watery puddle. Green beans were OK. I should say I had very high expectations from previous visits and though I still love the concept and the decor, it kinda felt like the whole place could use a good scrubbing, starting with the grime around the door entrance handles. Floor felt sticky. There was trash around the downstairs elevator entrance (my mom uses a wheelchair). Somebody had spilled something or thrown up at the bottom of the stairs leading to the parking lot. Sure hope I just hit them on a bad night. The blueberry mojito was quite good.

Fr1w-oYYIBtxpYYYBBRsEQ.text: Bad experience and mediocre food. Being relatively new to Charlotte, Tupelo Honey was on my list of restaurants to try... despite hearing negative reviews from locals.   I had made reservations with my boyfriend and family, from out of town, for my birthday brunch. In the reservation I had noted that I would like outdoor seating because we were going to bring our dog. I had also called the day of to confirm that dogs were allowed on the patio.  Upon arrival, we were seated at a table that was in a puddle of water... our dog had no place to sit and my boyfriends shoes were soaked. (There were tables available without a puddle of water...) I attempted to use a squeegee that was laying out to clean up some of the water. I ended up taking our dog back to our place nearby because there was no where for him to lay... while my family enjoyed appetizers.   The food was very average. I'm glad that I got a mimosa at least..  Why would the hostess sit us at a table in a puddle of water, especially when she saw we had a dog. Also, why wouldn't the management attempt to clean up the water before guests arrive.

7Ix5tdh1PX3Mh6qSn3a02g.text: Although i specifically asked for well cooked eggs and emphasized scrambled hard non runny eggs, that isn't what i received!!!! The bacon, French toast and mimosa were yummy  tho :)   I did not eat my eggs, and my waiter Frank  never asked about them or the satisfaction of my meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. French toast eggs and bacon

X0dCgtDx0if4chO7tAepMA.text: Food was great. The Brussel sprouts rocked. Trout was cooked perfectly.  Cole, our waiter, was very attentive but at the right times.  We will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brussel sprouts. pimento cheese burger
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States

Lt_QVRdwxwolg_uk3SgFPw.text: Favorite spot for breakfast after a run on the Rail Trail. Food is great quality and the service is always exceptional. Try the pancakes, you won't regret it. :)

UORMqTGrEuwhBxvjqi06lQ.text: Celebrated my stepsons birthday here. Good choice. Allie's service was great and she offered help with the menu. Our party of 9 was well taken care of. Easily seated on a Friday evening. Outdoor seating is available. Varied menu so something for everyone. Biscuits served in lieu of bread with honey and jelly, yummy. I had the trout. It wasn't bad but I wouldn't get it again. Favorites at the table were the wings (nice kick), fried chicken, crispy Brussels sprouts. Definitely worth checking them out.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ chicken egg rolls

077IYxo1ZdLIIjJkw-B8SA.text: Food and service is amazing. Only piece of advice is to make reservations because this place gets packed especially for brunch hours.

qb17dS1Taj_O6_3S2JIqqw.text: I had lunch at Tupelo Honey on a Saturday with my in-laws and husband. This was my second time stopping in, after a poor experience on my first visit. However, this place is walking distance from my home so we gave it another shot. We won't go back.   We waited 20 minutes for a table despite that fact that there were countless open tables. When we inquired about the many open tables, they told us it was a kitchen/service issue rather than a space issue.   We were seated indoors by the bar. It was freezing, and we immediately inquired as to why it was so cold. The server told us they had to keep the temp super low to avoid a humidity issue in the bar area. Umm what?   We had a server in training and a tenured server assisting. This was annoying as the individual in training would ask if we wants apps of cocktails and we'd say no all while the tenured server observed from behind. Then the tenured server would coach the newbie in front of us "did you ask about apps, what about offering a mimosa." We felt this should not have been handled in front of us.  When the AC issue became unbearable we asked to move. They finally found a spot for us in the main dining area and we were shocked to find it colder so we moved back to the bar area. My father-in-law was ready to leave (food hadn't even arrived yet), and then the tenured server informed us the kitchen was very backed up.   Our food finally came and it was good. We expected an apology for the extreme AC issues, but received none. And we weren't the only ones who found it could - we saw numerous people go to their cars for blankets or coats and others asked to be moved outside. The restaurant needs to fix the AC problem ASAP.   Overall, I've had 2 poor experiences here for 2 totally different reasons. The food is good, but I believe this restaurant is poorly managed and I will not be dining here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dirty outdoor couches.

KPkn0Bv0ZBRl1zfx1-PP3A.text: Really, really loved this place (especially when we've been for brunch).  Biscuits are great, food is really tasty.  Service has always been kind of "OK."  Every time we've been we've had to ask for biscuits and every time we get the same answer: "Oh yeah they are just coming out of the oven."  This last time...the service was just terrible.  Out of the cocktail special, out of the red wine special.  When we did get the cocktail we ordered, it took 15 minutes to get to the table (and the place was empty).  When we got the bill at the end of the night, we saw that our waitress took it upon herself to order us the most expensive glass of wine - we checked the menu and there were several happy hour glasses of red wine (again she said they were "out" when we ordered).  When we said something, we basically got the equivalent of a "whoops".    Not sure if there is a manager here...but we certainly didn't see one.    This place MIGHT be worth it for brunch (despite the service), but definitely not for dinner.

KrJL5MEaZv9TG4yelh0e4g.text: Man. Two trips to this joint and they killed it. Chicken and Waffles on the first go, and their Dust Fried Chicken on the follow up. Yes sir...absolutely delicious. I'd have to say that fried Brussels Sprouts were my favorite. But I also need to mention that the breading on their fried chicken is perfection, you can taste the honey in every bite and it has the tiniest kick with this genius dry seasoning. Washed down by the Tupelo Honey RJ Something or other, and it didn't disappoint. 5 stars Tupelo Honey and thanks for a great birthday meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Collards with Pork Belly were awesome
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crispy Brussels - Jiggy!!!!!

4hs0ARCPqpBZWNQQGJZDIg.text: (3.5 stars) Pretty solid food with an extensive menu and plenty of seating, though it can take a while to get your food. The biscuits are a nice starter: crisp exteriors but slightly undercooked centers and served lukewarm like they've been sitting for a bit.   Taking a trip down south, I felt like the buttermilk fried chicken was a must. Plus the lunch order comes with two sides. The chicken itself I really enjoyed: crisp and tender, not that hot but the gravy complements it nicely. The sides though were disappointing: the Brussels sprouts were relatively bland and mostly char, while the mac and cheese would've been better served with a different cheese and less breadcrumbs.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Buttermilk Fried Chicken

bIFzu0iJK10XQhWOfiiGmg.text: This restaurant is True southern fine cooking, authentic, and our waiter Matt was excellent and treated us well. I highly recommend Tupelo, we will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Outdoor seating!

k_Yq-rx3ExhN34jY-_obig.text: We visited Tupelo Honey in Charlotte for Sunday brunch today and were sadly let down. I have been to their location in Knoxville and was hoping for the same great food I had received there--We did not.   My boyfriend got the chicken biscuit, and I got a combo. We both split the fried okra. To start off with we didn't have silverware when we sat down. Once we put in our order for the okra within two min (I'm not kidding) it came out. Normally I would be impressed however the dish was room temp and old tasting (like it had just been sitting on a plate waiting for a table to take it). After that we didn't receive biscuits until AFTER our entrees arrived, which seemed weird because my boyfriend's dish had three biscuits in it (?). Anyways, my four sides were just fine, but his serving was very very small, and the chicken was just average, not crispy or fresh. Not at all what we were expecting for the price they charge.  Overall, the food was OK but not $50 for brunch OK. We were quite disappointed. I will say that our server was very nice despite being slammed with tables. We will not return to this location. There are far too many places you can get a better, bigger meal for much cheaper.

KVRBrghNUnZY--Vr244-mQ.text: It was great to be able to sit on the patio with our dogs, but we didn't think the food was anything special. We had the BBQ Egg Rolls, which were the favorite thing we had, the Shashuka, and the Biscuits and Gravy. The Shashuka was lacking enough of the signature sauce for me and the eggs were over-cooked and rubbery and over-hard rather than the appropriate over-easy. The Biscuits and Gravy was pretty mediocre too. The best part was the fried chicken. We also paid extra to add on an egg, which was again over cooked.

At3g4r3II83Xa6Y9MJzPQg.text: Great service! Friendly! Great waitress, Saphira! And amazing food! Shrimp And grits 10/10 the food came out in a timely manner and I enjoyed it thoroughly!

a6ZN1XCpo9GCnbHj2cPNyw.text: Today my fellow Marines and I dined in at Tupelo Honey and our visit was nothing short of amazing. Josh was an attentive, friendly server and the entire staff showed us good old fashioned southern hospitality. If you visit be sure to get the fried green tomatoes they are "world famous" .

UXlwEmLsEupcuhBuCse4lA.text: One of the best meals I've had! The atmosphere is great (day at the bar) and the service was outstanding. Can't wait to get to Charlotte to go back!

1lRmZ_Admltvrn0ANyf5AA.text: I went to the event they had on 8/17/17  The Food:  The Frose which was GREAT!!!! I also had a grits smoke salmon cake which was also GREAT! And the pimento cheese was GREAT!! NEXT TIME: I want to try there fried green tomatoes(I heard they are great)   THE RESTAURANT: Walking to the restaurant from the parking lot was a little confusing. It's located on the the 2nd floor. they have to outdoor area, where you can sit down and eat (with sofas and tables). Inside its a hippie like restaurant (too me). The restaurant theme is honey and bees (which makes sense due to the name). It's not a lot of room to wait up. Staff really nice and down to earth.
