7ZKovJLWKD6ALIX2t5tWiw.text: Awesome 4th of July brunch.  Mimosa specials with the Shoo Mercy pancakes and omelette.   Great food, atmosphere, and service from Jonathan.   You won't go wrong here.

HlY-z_LCWSg4wfeyhr9gTA.text: Our server William was GREAT!!!! Super cool and very attentive! Food was great as well, highly recommend!

bUCWWtlhdlTSaMJI4dDgEQ.text: Rolled up on a Tuesday night since I had to kill about 1.5 hours while waiting for someone to arrive at the airport.  Old Pewter Rose location (RIP).  Place was pretty busy and since I didn't have time to wait they offered us the counter right at the kitchen which was open.  Kind of like a Chef's table but they called it something different.  The experience was doubly awesome since we got to watch them prepare all of the yummy dishes.  We were right there facing the line cooks and chefs.  Both me and my co diner ordered the nutty fried chicken on the recommendation of the server.  It was served with sweet potato mash and asparagus.  The entire plate was quickly devoured and I must say it was very tasty.  Oh, and they started us off with one of the most wonderful, fluffy rolls that I have ever eaten.  Since I was right there I noticed a sign that said that the rolls, before being served had to be approved by a chef before going out.  Pretty cool, and maybe that contributes to the hot, doughy perfection that I ate.  All in all, it was a great experience at a renovated old favorite restaurant of mine.  I will definitely return so I can try other things on a menu that I really didn't have time to properly peruse but remember there was some pretty great stuff on it.

9CzpgaUIOCSyrDs6zasz9Q.text: Love this place!! William was amazing! He was friendly and had a welcoming and friendly demeanor about him. I will definitely return and when I do, I will ask for William specifically. This is a must place to visit when you're visiting Charlotte because even the locals like myself love it.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States

VpNlhQkSfN9xKfQrqcgfug.text: Service, food, and ambience were all amazing! It was my first time here and William offered great recommendations and provided exceptional service. Definitely returning whenever I'm in the area.

ps0qmtfDWsQ1DvVSYcZgFA.text: As always, food was great. Service was great (thanks William). Love this place for food and drink.

qcffCH2mODZTkz4-TaD8lw.text: I really enjoyed this place!  The ambiance is relaxed country. The food had a lot of flavor and there was plenty of it!  It is on second floor of the building,so that was a little odd.  Just follow the signs.  A thousand doors along the front wall so finding the right one to enter was also a little awkward but worth it when you get in!  Surprised how big it is inside not just a little hole in the wall!  Very clean.  We will be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. A Beautiful Breakfast !  Worth every penny!
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blueberry Pain Perdue!  Delicious!  Doesn&#39;t need syrup!  It&#39;s perfect as is!
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried chicken and biscuits

q5VVVBrWU9ZtqbgCUK2_tg.text: Loved the food! Such a cute atmosphere!! I had the sweet potatoe pancake! It was amazing!! Totally worth any wait!  William was our server and he was great!

vkbDiH1FR1lkmxGRVbnlhw.text: Pleasant unusual Menu items excellent service. Will return soon. Jonathan, our waiter, was on top of his game!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States

O52AeqozR4YLZKM_V5RiXg.text: The first one opened in Asheville, but they brought one here because Charlotte needs cool stuff too! Benn here for brunch and dinner at various times and can honestly say I've had a great time whenever I've been here. The bloody mary's for brunch are simply awesome...spice or not, depending on taste but always with a little okra to add a little southern flavor. The portions have always been good and food good tasting...from the chicken on down to everything else. The biscuits and honey they give you before dinner are also excellent, one of the better Southern touches the restaurant specializes in. I've tried many things and have never had a bad meal. Service is usually awesome, parking can usually be found with a little searching their backlot but it's best to plan for a little wait time at brunch and dinner because sometimes the line can be long. So glad they came here!

Ebtd31vrUnnAvwt30jq7yw.text: My first time here was AMAZING!! I sat at the bar as there is a big rush during lunch hours and had a wonderful experience.  I ordered the Appalachian Bounty Scramble which contains all-natural pasture-raised Hickory Nut Gap Farm sausage, blueberries, arugula, kale and Havarti cheese.  It also comes with a side of toast and carrot and kale slaw. It was delicious! I devoured the entire plate in addition to the biscuit and homemade jam that is served at the beginning of your meal.   I recently brought my parents here, as I was raving about this place. I would be giving this place 4/5 stars, however, the service was sub par.  This time I ordered the Big Honkin' veggie burger with the homemade potato chips and asked for no onion (of course onion came on it). My dad ordered an omelette and my mom ordered the Appalachian Bounty Scramble with the sausage on the side as she does not eat meat, but I was going to eat it. Inside of no sausage it came with DOUBLE sausage, which was incorrectly inputed by our waitress. She haphazardly apologized and took her meal away. Upon bringing her the correct item, she brought her food out piecemeal...one plate with the scramble sans sausage, and then a small plate with a tiny amount of slaw and the grilled toast.  I don't think that the waitress should have taken the item off of the bill but at least offer us free drinks or a dessert. I was extremely disappointed in how she handled the situation.  Hopefully Tupelo will be better next time.

_qnBaa0XppscSkJ_k14s1g.text: I came here with a group to celebrate a friends birthday. There were 5 of us and she was able to make a reservation which is a plus, certainly on Saturday mornings when they are packed. There is a nice outdoor space, but not a lot of parking, so be aware, you may have to circle around a bit to find a space.   At 11am the place was full. We had a booth in the back near the kitchen. Our waiter took a little bit to come over so by the time he did we had decided on our food. 4 of us decided on the Poutine Scramble, and I got a glass of Brut Champagne which was $7. I'm glad I ordered my drink when I did because the next time we saw our waiter was when we got our food. He brought out the complimentary biscuits with our meal. The timing felt a little off and I think I would have enjoyed more of my biscuit if it came before the meal.  The scramble was a lot of flavors. It comes with eggs, potatoes, cheese, white gravy, bacon (I think because it might be bacon bits), etc. It's a lot. I just think I didn't get gravy on eggs. I was hoping it would work, but it didn't.   The waiter did refill our glasses 3x which was great because as my husband so lovingly says, I drink water like a camel. I just feel like he was really overwhelmed.   Based on the reviews of the Asheville location I had high expectations going in, maybe the bar was set a little too high.

TjP-WSlzF9IYq6BWr_Xpcg.text: Delicious food. I ordered Sunday brunch, Southern Breakfast with a mimosa. Delicious! Service was awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sunday brunch, Southern Breakfast with a mimosa!

63ngHsLDXiTwYSp1Rlk6sw.text: Our family visited Charlotte and we ate dinner at Tupelo Honey Cafe for my sister's Law School Graduation. The restaurant is located on the second floor (which you can take the stairs or elevator), and it is also located across the street from the Fire Station which is very odd.  The server was kinda in a pissed off mood (and a I don't care attitude) towards the beginning, but once during he wrote down our orders his mood changed.  I ordered a "Mountain Pulled Pork Sandwich" but oddly enough I got a "Bone-In Porterhouse Pork Chop" instead.. too many pork items on the menu maybe? He said that he would change it for me once I brought him about this issue, but I wasn't that picky so I sticked with it and ate it. The Pork Chop was great and juicy, but I kinda wished I ate the Mountain Pulled Pork Sandwich.  The restaurant overall is great, and when it comes to ownership. I think both the owner and manager roaming the restaurant helping tables are both great and friendly.  Note: Tupelo Honey Cafe gets really cold. So be prepared to bring a sweater or a jacket with you when you enter.

LuIlh5yMA15OU9c0RlmV_w.text: I adore this place when I'm in the mood for comfort food! Get the bloody mary with moonshine and all the extras (okra, olive, bacon...) The biscuits are wonderful, and the Appalachian egg rolls are a must have appetizer! My favorite dinner entree is the "Shoo Mercy" Pancake -  Our famous sweet potato pancake with whipped peach butter, spiced pecans, buttermilk fried chicken, maple peppered bacon and 100% maple syrup.  Seriously, amazing food!

sbO6LXc-r6IXfslMIryFTw.text: Let me first say that Tupelo is one of my favorite places however, this location did not compare to their Asheville store. It's hard when a restaurant expands with various locations. Our server Iris was A-Mazing! Kudos to her!!! She was so friendly and spot on! She knew her products well and had such a chipper attitude. She was from Ohio but struck me as a Georgia Peach! We really enjoyed her company! She brought extra sauces and napkins without us asking. We orders what we normally order at the Asheville store....pimento cheese dip, wings and fried green tomatoes. We wanted to order potato cracklins but they said it would take an hour (since they just opened) so we ordered chips which we're just ok. Right after our food hit the table here comes Iris with an order of cracklins on the house. They were done sooner than they thought and boy were they good. Smashed potatoes deep fried...oh man! So, the wings were good but not as good as we remember from previous visits also the pimento cheese dip taste like it had grain mustard in it which I don't remember. It was a strong taste that we both didn't prefer. The tomatoes were good but needed salt also the grit bed needed more flavor. The ranch had a garlic hint to it and wasn't great but the blue cheese was chunky and on point.  I forgot to mention my Bloody Mary- they make their own mix and it is so good! The pepper rim is to die for. So all in all it was a $48 lunch and felt more like it should have been $20. I feel a bit jipped to be honest. Not what I know Tupelo to be!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bloody Mary- amazing!
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Complimentary biscuits with honey and blueberry compote
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried green tomatoes on goat cheese grit bed- needed more flavor and salt and maybe crumbled goat cheese and more sauce!

vE28jdCz-kVf6C55xSVW7A.text: Great service from Emma and team! Delicious food and great atmosphere on the outdoor patio/balcony.

6n5SbRdduCy-ZNMXM7ms7Q.text: Enjoyed dinner there recently. Had been for breakfast in the past. Everyone's meal (sweet potato pancakes, friend chicken, grilled cheese, pasta) was tasty. Little pricey $80 for family but good location and fun to go to.

Z4CMl5iOATSG1E02FCbHTg.text: Went for Happy Hour. We ordered some drinks, a few small bites, and two entrees. One of the entrees came out wrong, was brought back out with the wrong side (a side that neither of us would ever eat or order at any restaurant,  in fact we loathe it so we were certain we hadn't ordered it), but it was quickly remedied. We weren't mad about this, it happens.  Drinks were delicious but the mule we ordered was charged at full price instead of happy hour price... hence the 3 stars. At this point I had already paid and didn't want to point out any more faults, so we just left. But please, for the sake of offering happy our specials (especially in NC where drink specials legally have to be offered all day), make sure they ring in correctly.

5nipHtJ6nK1EBqqk-vdh_w.text: My sister had told me to give this place a try.  And I am very happy that I did!  Great seating, fantastic vibe and delicious southern food.  You have to try the Brussel Sprouts on the appetizer menu!!!

y2DMX2_UVXNslywa8ua-4Q.text: I was impressed by the simple yet tasteful food. I would recommend this for anyone who likes scratch made everything and just good flavors. I've only been once but def will return.

vaAkeIKWo_7TFJIQq3I8Fw.text: So I decided to came back the other night bc I had such a great experienced the first time. Again The food were delicious! This time I tried this pineapple drink it was so good! Our server was Emma she was amazing and super friendly :) I love everything about this place. I will keep coming back! Thank you Tupelo Honey for amazing food and service :)

7-9-MA4MY_aP07vtmYftAg.text: The food and service are equally as amazing!!! I love this place anytime! From their dinner menu to their Sunday brunch!! Go on in and find out for yourself....you'll be pleasantly surprised!!

0E7aqgcizEQrDZ--A2LN-A.text: Our party of 5 just had brunch here. Thankfully we had a reservation, or we never would have gotten in. The service was meh. Our glasses ran dry, and our server only checked on us once after our food was delivered. Our meals were good but not great. I just don't get the hype for this place. It was not outstanding, the seating is very crowded, parking is a joke, and the prices are crazy.

E2P9Gl9OoH2Fi8pbCQLvhg.text: Just moved to Charlotte, my in laws are coming in town to visit next weekend, so my husband and I wanted to scout a few places out. Despite the rave reviews we were terribly disappointed with the service. In fact the WORST server we have ever encountered in a long time.   10 minutes after seated the server finally came ask for drink orders. A moment later someone else came back with water, then another 5 minutes later she came and asked if we were ready to order, I promptly told her we were still waiting on the coffee. She then said" oh so he didn't bring the coffee out? Alright guess I will get it now." WHAT? Red flag #1.   Coffee came out and tasted like it had been sitting there for two days. Since our server once again disappeared, we told the bus boy who dropped off the food to please get her for us. So we told her coffee tasted bad only for her to come back and said that's what it's suppose to taste like, in a way like we were lying and she's doing me a favor to take it off the bill. It's as if I didn't drink coffee almost everyday for the past 15 years and I know what coffee should taste like and it's definitely not sour. Red flag #2.  Oh and the famous biscuits. Toward the end of the meal she asked if we wanted biscuits. Sure. Although isn't it suppose to be brought out at the beginning? Moment later she said biscuits are being made and if we still want them. Yes sure. After meal is finished she came back AGAIN and said no biscuits. Still baking. At this point we have no words.  Red flag #3.   Hey on a side note, food was good. Big portions. We needed couple boxes for the leftovers. So instead of giving us proper size boxes she grabbed 6 little containers, said they are out of big boxes out in the balcony area (meaning she didn't want to waste her time to walk back inside). It just gets better. She dropped off the check, my husband pulled out the wallet getting ready to pay on the spot as we didn't want to wait another who know how long before she appears again. Then she had the guts to say "yeah it's better you give me the card now, they are transitioning me inside so once I go back in it will be awhile". JUST WOW.   I'm a generous tipper and never go under 20%, my husband tipped $4 on $30 for this horrible experience. I would've tipped her nothing at all.   We will never come back and that waitress needs to be fired.

oGnr5Rtf6k0ZBjCWL1_pLw.text: I love the tupelo honey chain and would come back for the biscuits alone. The Ashville location is my favorite, but this place is great as well. I've gotten the rainbow trout and it was great! It's awesome to see local food from around the area paired with local beer as well.

cdgM7rPuxFyJTJGMAKPUyw.text: I spent my birthday in a lousy environment with poor service and terrible food. I drove from Jacksonville FL to spend my birthday with family and friends in Charlotte/Concord. My best friend went to the honey Tupelo restaurant in Asheville and suggested weeks ago that we should have dinner at this restaurant. Being the foodie I am, I started researching and couldn't wait to dine here.  We arrive at the restaurant on time for our reservation on a Wednesday night @615p. The floor was empty, and The hostess looked lost and started pulling tables together for our party of 10. We sat down and was greeted promptly by our server. We ordered or drinks, and waited a full 45 minutes for our first(and only) mixed drinks and even longer to begin our food order. Totally unacceptable. We were then informed there was a party of 35 and that our food would be delayed. Begrudgingly we all accepted. We ordered our food.   what came next? Cold Food. One person didn't get their tacos till 20 min after our food was delivered. & We were still missing a kids Mac&chz. We were all starving that we inevitably shared and ate our dishes. But mid meal, our children started fussing that the food tasted bad. As parents this is not uncommon to hear. So we tried a spoonful of the buttered pasta.... sure enough it tasted like dirty dish water, one friend felt there was maybe some chemicals mixed in. It was just overall disgusting.  The other kids dish we ordered was macaroni and cheese. Now, the portion of the macaroni in comparison to the buttered pasta was ridiculous. If I'm being generous it was a square 3inx3in piece on a tea plate. With no sides.  The adult plates, chicken fried steak was compared to a rubber boot. The sides of the flat iron steak, were severely bland Brussels sprouts. Almost as if they were boiled in the hospitals cafeteria and served to you for health not enjoyment.   So I finally get the nerve to complain. I really am understanding. If the place was hopping, you have a serious wait. If the server was in the weeds about to wave her white flag. I'd totally get it. But what I encountered was the extreme opposite. An empty floor, with two parties, a 35 top (that was mid way they their meals when we arrived) and my 10 top.   The manager came over, very apologetic. Discounted our check, removed the kids food, replaced the buttered pasta with grilled cheese. Did everything you should do for a disgruntled customer. He redeemed himself when he presented a free (bland, boring) chocolate cake and a Tupelo honey recipe book.   BUT THEN it went down hill again. Took over 30 minutes to get our check after the dessert came. The bill was incredibly wrong. They triple charged us for one appetizer. They couldn't seem to understand that they needed to take 2 appetizers off since we only ordered one! So that added another 15 min. It was just a complete mess. We didn't leave till 830. Over two hours wasted at a poor quality, poor service, poor dining restaurant.   Save your time and go somewhere else. The biscuits aren't even worth it.

37gn42ghMd1U64C6CbnVFg.text: Brunch waiting times can be a nightmare but we opted for immediate open seating near the bar (also has TVs to watch the games, holla).  The bar service was wonderful and the food was pretty good too. Large selection of cocktails :)  Moonswine Bloody Mary is a must if you are into Bloodies. Megamosa is also sure to turn your morning around. Cucumber drink is refreshing, not sweet at all.  Appetizers: Jalapeno Pork Egg Rolls...we LOVED these.  Also had the traditional Eggs Benedict, solid. Goat cheese grits were interesting...only like a two bite thing for me.  I'm sure I will find myself enjoying their boozy brunch cocktails again.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Appalachian Egg Rolls, delicious!
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Go Pirates! Moonshine Mary is delicious

oBjPkJAOfQQAIKJ8cWs3Rg.text: Cole did a amazing job and was on top with his food knowledge. We'll definitely return

6baXCl5QhP9pt9rvraAjSA.text: Very yummy!  I got the fried green tomatoes and grits! It was delicious- our waitress was very kind as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Would definitely eat here again.

MTLesT2P5pkRZPAd11pYRA.text: Fried green tomatoes were some of the best I've had. Wasn't a super fan of the biscuits though, which I heard were really good. Server was a bit odd and sarcastic but fine nonetheless

tFUUZQeAB38ANBFeFcPCIA.text: The brunch here was amazing! I have eaten here twice. Its in a perfect location with LOTS of parking. I had the avocado toast and eggs. It was beautifully presented and DELICIOUS The service was also amazing. I was very pleased and will return again for sure.

p_psNdvNYm9cLyJxsZ8hiQ.text: Service was 10 times better than the food, 3 stars because I feel generous. Burger was over cooked and under seasoned,  fries were soggy.  Not trying to be picky just constructive.

am8iRhatjKwp4jBHrv7ebA.text: Matt was very informative about the menu! He walked us thru the whole thing and helped us made an educated decision based on our selective taste. The food at Tupelo honey was excellently prepared... juicy and fresh. A glaze of siracha honey brought a hint of sweetness and spicy at the same time. The chicken was placed on a mount of gravy and biscuits. The combination of the chicken and gravy alone was to die for. Needless to say we will be returning.

uSmROUhz46gR_C41saOZ1w.text: Make a reservation it gets busy for brunch. Some specials only last til10a. Get there early!

FvD7t99knTmw9TQyLh2APQ.text: Took the parents here for brunch one Sunday. PRO TIP: make a reservation. Not my first time coming here but it was theirs. Ordered coffee, and a bloody Mary to get started. While the bloody Mary was fantastic it was also fun sized which kind of threw me off. Everyone's coffee was cold which was also kind of a bummer. Other than that the food was killer. Sweet potato pancakes are a must. While the menu may seem pricey, dont worry you get what you pay for and that is quality. Will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bloody and Benedict

9veNK2CImuYDxsl4U2cbaw.text: amazing food, beautiful decor and restaurant! great for brunch

D3Gtv0IGV0vbzAr8NSt9mw.text: This place has the best grits that I've ever had! And I'm a southern girl so I know good grits  I ordered the make your own combo which was 3 items for 10 or 4 items for 12. I got grits, eggs, bacon, and sweet potato pancakes. Everything was good!! I also had a Mimosa which was absolutely delicious! I also had a Bloody Mary and it was pretty spicy..... it was my first time having one and it's not for me. I tried it because they had an award for best Bloody Mary but I didn't like it. Not saying it wasn't good it just wasn't for me. They also have homemade biscuits, everyone gets a biscuit with their jam. Overall if you come across this place go have yourself a good breakfast, you won't be disappointed.

Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Make your own combo

QRs9DOswZqxRpwOtNzO0-A.text: Restaurant week. First time there in a while. Food just ok. Place dirty, table sticky, and had to track down a server after sitting 5 mins (this was before evening rush, several waiters chatting by hostess stand). Waiter we got fairly attentive but service still slow (again, before place was full). Can't recommend, won't be back - not worth $90+ for 2 people.

CZZfADJQ5K5Y758CN-p1Lg.text: This is a great restaurant for breakfast and brunch. We went for a Saturday brunch and was greeted by very warm host an excellent staff. Our waiter was very friendly and offered wonderful recommendations off of the menu which helped us choose the most delicious brunch. This looks like a very cute place for brunch with a great drink selection unfortunately I did not get a drink but did enjoy the food! We ordered the beet salad - which was delicious and was dressed perfectly. We also ordered the shoo mercy sweet potato pancakes which were to die for . The hot honey is a must!

oTIA_rripG8k0YzbpJT9og.text: The food here is really good. Creative menu options. A very good Sunday brunch spot but the wait is at least an hour. So you're better off setting a reservation a few days in advance.   The biscuits are .  The staff is pretty efficient and friendly too.

idlzM_iD1JeN5cAPQoNrzw.text: July 5th... The restaurant was understaffed for the lunch rush. Our waitress, Lex, was great...friendly and fun, but when we were approaching 50 minutes from when we ordered our lunch we gave her (the kitchen) just 5 more minutes before we would leave. Our lunch arrived within that window.  Food was okay - not terrible but not great, or even very good.  Just okay.  A $44.00 lunch bill - no value given what we got this day.  There are so many choices in Charlotte now, doubt we'll come back as everything is a little worn... there are so many other places where food and service are still the star. Would not recommend.

q24QFGvdBhusEANEkhlyHg.text: It is a restaurant with nice patio seatings on a 2nd floor. It was a little chilly so we were seated inside though. Ordered Shoo Mercy Sweet Potato Pancakes and fried green tomatoes. The pancakes come with one piece of fried chicken, apple cider bacon, two eggs. It is a pretty big portion for one person. (Maybe that's why it is a bit pricier than other dishes) We shared and ordered one appetizer. The buttermilk chicken was very crispy! The sweet potato pancake is good not not a wow taste to me. Grits that came with fried green tomatoes was good and sauce on the top added great flavor on it. Our server was very nice and the food was good.

K-Tgzoxf3yqUflehbXZbeg.text: I went here when I went to visit back east from moving to AZ recently. Everything was nice from the artsy decor to the staff!! Lauren took great care of me and my pal and gave of many great suggestions to choose from !! This was my first time going to TH and definitely won't be the last !! Tomato basil soup was AH-MAY-ZING nice lil kick to it with the pumpernickels croutons, just sets it off. It also came with a tasty turkey sandwich with apple and cheddar and a fresh salad. Also I had Fried green tomatoes as an appetizer and they were great too. And the biscuits!! Don't get me started with the biscuits and jelly. So simple. Yet so good. I'll be back next time I visit Charlotte (sorry I just noticed it was drafted and not posted I visit late November 2018)

tG8X3IJ1QrR-pOX5KK1Klg.text: Service was pretty bad for a slow day at this "quaint southern" brunch bar. Food was really mediocre, the pancakes were great, biscuits were dry and their "award winning" fried chicken was so uninspired and lacking in flavor, that I didn't bother to take a picture of the food. Overall it was...fine. Not worth the hassle of parking, better restaurants on this end of town at much better prices.

-oIl9BoxREzx5h8YnP9AAA.text: Cole was awesome! We had a delicious meal for our girls night. Thank Cole

3W8YOpMC_Jmc-zZ6Z-kW1w.text: First time visiting this restaurant which was recommended by a friend on a Thursday Afternoon. It was not busy at all and we were able to sit on the patio. Holliday was our server and was great! She gave us both food and drink recommendations. I had the steak salad and my boyfriend had the friend chicken BLT. Both were both delicious. Yelp also had 10% off for check ins! I would recommend this place!

a9BTh1GjOXXu_md23vbvuA.text: This place just missed the mark for me. This was my second time ever going as I had previously gone to the one in Asheville. Honestly, the previous experience was great so I was excited that they had a location around where I lived.   What rubbed me the wrong way was the food. It took a very long time to come out and when it did, it looked like it was sitting under the heating lamp a bit too long. I got the pimento burger (which was probably my mistake) and the flavors were really flat. It just tasted like a greasy hamburger with a side of regular Mac and cheese. I expected more for the price and from my previous experience.   I will say the situation was remedied by an extremely nice and courteous waiter. It was an anniversary dinner and she really tired her best to make the night special. She was always on hand and super nice. If it wasn't for her, the entire experience would have been laughable.   Overall, the ambiance was nice and the service was great. The food was what really put a damper on the night. The waiter was nice enough to not charge for my food and gave me this cute cook book so it wasn't all bad. I would take caution when choosing this place for special occasions.

LH3ftgk-JHzzcQcwOHICxg.text: Last night my husband and I visited Tupelo Honey for my birthday dinner. It was the first time we have eaten at Tupelo Honey. Our server, Emma, was amazing! She answered all of our bizarre questions, was so personable, made on point recommendations, and provided excellent customer service. The food was amazing (sweet potato pancakes, veggie burger, margaritas, and banana pudding) but Emma made the experience perfect. I highly suggest asking for Emma on your next visit! Thanks Emma!

3OOcD16WXB0_-Q6YGUnNlw.text: I came here with my brother for lunch and it was good! I had the fried chicken BLT. I enjoyed it very much.

aYW_UW9Fikjofxr0QiFDdA.text: Biscuits: check! Parking: check! Fun, changing, seasonal menu: CHECK!  Went here for brunch with my friend, and ordered the salted beets. It was alright, a little heavy on the goat cheese (which is a very LOUD cheese, but I love it). I liked it a lot, but I was a way bigger fan of my friend's gigantic, delicious pancake! I definitely recommend checking out all 3 of their menus regularly for updates, and going after whichever item intrigues you. Odds are, you'' be VERY satisfied.  Oh, and DEFINITELY try the lavender lime (or something like that) soda. SO pleasant and refreshing!

Py8QQlMr-fqcUOVDfJIA1Q.text: Talk about delicious! The pairing of goat cheese grits and red pepper and basil flavor the fried green tomatoes to perfection in a way I didn't know possible! Staff was more than friendly and the timing of the food was great too. Definitely recommend this for any time you want something special and different.

h-RD7xZy3HGAwRhJltYg0g.text: First time visiting Charlotte. We are here for my eldest daughters wedding. William Cain was an unexpected surprise and gave us an exceptional southern experience! Food was pretty good too :-)

qmrpEpNySWx8oFuSeHm37g.text: The food was amazing! True southern food with a flavorful twist that took the classics to a whole new level. Our server William was wonderful! He made great suggestions and was very personable.  I'll definitely return for brunch again!

HzVlbWlc0EEEursOKcS5AQ.text: Love this place! Not the healthiest but it has great southern comfort food with a twist. The biscuits that you get with every meal are fabulous! The southern chicken piccata with jumbo shrimp is also good. The staff are really friendly!

PYtyRT1jQ8-3qIGF7avy-g.text: Taking the Lynx to downtown Charlotte, I spotted the yellow sign at the East/West Blvd Station through the trees. While Van Morrison's song title got me in the door for lunch, I didn't expect anything other than standard Southern fried fare. This standard often translates into too much of everything: too much butter, too much grease, heaping portions. For an expat Southerner now living on the West Coast, this oversizing isn't necessarily a good thing.   Surprise! This place got it right.   I was served a bit buttery biscuit as an appetizer that came with blackberry jam and tupelo honey, but I could actually taste the fruit instead of just sugary jelly. I opted for the veggie plate. The black eyed peas had a nice kick and weren't just boiled bland mush, the brussels sprouts were tender, and the highlight--the fried okra was lightly breaded, allowing the full taste to come through. This is how veggies should be prepared and Tupelo Honey Cafe proves not just my Grandma can do it!   They even have a Gluten Free Menu.   Forget Paula's place further down, bring your out-of-town guests here!

WVpXmhs-bf0HGpC3DMyPxg.text: I really want this place to be five stars.  I love the menu, food, concept and decor.  We ate here last Saturday for a late lunch and had great food but mediocre service.  Waitress was really bad about refills and forgot several things we requested on our order.  Very little personality.  The labor market must be terrible in Charlotte for servers or management here does not know how to hire.  Second visit and second time I felt the staff belonged at Denny's.

xptdthPmJwVgAjYhCT1W_A.text: Very disappointing.   Came early Saturday evening, around 5:30, and it was packed.  Wait for a table for 2 was 45 mins. You can't make reservations despite what their (infuriating and confusing) automated answering machine said.  Ok, no problem.  I'm willing to wait for good food and to try a new place.  Luckily, we snagged two seats at the bar within 10 mins.  It was all downhill from here...  Cocktails were awful.  They don't carry Tito's, so I went with a Stoli (up with a twist).  Not good.  The perfect vodka martini should be ice cold with shards of ice crystals and citrus oils.  Mine was cold-ish... and had a thick awkward corkscrew of rind balanced on the rim.  Whatever.  We moved on to the specialty "cockytails."  DIABETES. seriously. we tried the blueberry skinny tea and cool as a cucumber and they both tasted like sugar water.  The one/only good thing was the jalapeno bacon moonshine.  We took shots of that and I would recommend.  Very jalapeno-y and bacon-y and... yah, first time I've had a savory shot and I liked it.  Food was mediocre to awful.  We were about to order the fried okra when the people next to us said it was bad.  My friend tried some of the neighbor's  -- mushy and bland and gross.  Biscuit was undercooked and unimpressive. Appalachian egg rolls were dripping with oil, yet not crispy (I imagine the oil wasn't hot enough), and just meh.  Shrimp and grits were fine... but nothing special.  The fried egg and bacon sandwich with home fries were also fine... but it was no different from what I could have made in 5 mins. on any given weekend morning.  Service was obviously lacking because the place was slammed and we were at the bar.  Let's go with "N/A" here.  We opted to skip dessert.  I just don't get how there's so much hype surrounding this place.    TL;DR -- Wait for table is long; cocktails will give you diabetes; food is mediocre.

Et2e3mAkDOjxmBZGvxA1og.text: I am from Asheville and am very familiar with the original location. I am pleasantly surprised and eager to say the Charlotte location is up to par! Of course, this is a different experience but great nonetheless!   service - excellent! we were attended to right away with frequent service, friendliness and attention to detail.  drinks - delicious! cocktails were tasty all around.   food - biscuits are smaller than in Asheville but had their own buttery flavored goodness. Appetizer of fried okra was awesome and I recommended the Brussels sprouts as a side to any sandwich.   It was crowded and busy which is a good sign in my book! I am craving some breakfast right now.

objIB57xG5mn2ZosBrokmw.text: We just had brunch at tupelo honey cafe and it was incredible. The food was amazing and our server Jonathan was wonderful. Jonathan was extremely helpful and answered all of our questions. He was genuinely friendly and you could tell he enjoyed his job. Can't wait to start bring people here.

GnVD1ggp10aO7wHoRZNMNw.text: The location is a definite 5 stars - Tupelo has a beautiful place painted in just about the most sunny shade of yellow under the sun. Great decor. A little loud, but it just kinda makes you cheerful to be here.  The food is very good, I'd say 8.5 out of 10. Really great biscuits came out courtesy of the restaurant. Many people ordered the goat cheese grits and had high hopes for them that were disappointed - personally I thought they were great, just depends on how phenomenal they were in your mind. I highly recommend the veggie bowl - very filling, great flavors, and absolutely slime-free fried okra. You really pay for what you get though, prices are on the expensive side.   As for service, which seems to have been an issue for some: My own experience with a very large group (over a dozen) was fairly good. The server was a bit severe about not changing seats so that no orders would get mixed up, but everything came out promptly and for the most part to the right people. Several people had sipped on my rosemary peach lemonade (awesome but not recommended for kids as it is not sweet) by the time someone figured out it was mine and had been brought to the wrong person, but no biggie.

GzUeQJysX9qmy-l8GQ_klg.text: Food was awesome and Jonathan our waiter did a great great job!! He was helpful, nice and quick to bring out food. The biscuits were my fav part!

5hOh-CnWvNEgPpJdxcPUVw.text: The food was great but the service was so-so. We had a large party so I expected the staff to be a little frazzled as they should be serving people is not easy. But the attitude, eye rolling, and huffing from the hostess was not necessary. Would go back for the grits and biscuits but because of the attitude it would not be my first choice for brunch.

MJsw6MuiL7ZOYvvVNS9orw.text: Loved this place! The inside was nice. There's outdoor seating. Food was excellent! Service....wonderful and the drinks were good. Love coming here and I know I will be back!

HW2FNq-5AAoUCFuL2UOqfg.text: A little pricy, but we'll worth it! Food is fresh and there is a variety of things to choose from! I've never seen this place empty, so that says it all!

XK8HuN4Z8tXoikvn8iYfqQ.text: Awesome place for a devilish brunch with a hipster vibe. Family-friendly. Our toddler loves their biscuits with jam. Coffee is good and the service is outstanding.

JnxqhFKjnKWz62kbg7ybvA.text: Great spot for brunch! Definitely gets busy, so make a reservation. Also, cheap mimosas!!!

ZxIWmE90tfEepSUW6afKcQ.text: The best brunch in town  by far! The menu has so many excellent options it is hard to choose what to order...so we went back for second time in 3 days! Cynthia and Lynne were so awesome! Friendly and knowledgeable and gave us great advice about menu items & drinks. Looking forward to next visit already!

aWQrDxNfPhvOYnkYdvI3Mg.text: Having been to Tupelo Honey in Asheville, I was excited years ago when they announced opening in Charlotte.   Unfortunately after having been to this location for a few years now everything is just okay, yes, some things are better than others, but consistency for me is the issue.  Their biscuits are great, and I love their popcorn fried okra, but when it comes to entrees I haven't been able to order the same meal twice and enjoy the same experience. I will say most recently I participated in an evening with New Belgium Brewery.  It was a five course meal, paired with a New Belgium beer.  The experience was amazing, and each dish was outstanding.  I would love if they could deliver what I experienced that night every night.  I love stopping in here for brunch and even dinner, but have hopes that consistency will improve, especially after my most recent experience.

Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salad
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Okra

ymV9w7VOXgc2QywlAGPZrw.text: Tupelo Honey owes me nothing but time!  The food was amazing however we sat down at our table at 1p but did not receive our food until 2:05p.  It took forever to receive my drink.  The complimentary table biscuits were amazing!  I barely find shrimp and grits at restaurants, so when I saw it on the menu, I knew I had to have it.  I have to say I made a great choice and I wasn't disappointed.  If you are looking for great food with a southern flare with great food; stop by Tupelo Honey.  But make sure you have time to wait because again it took a while.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States

r8aR5UjZ090cawvfjKVSCw.text: Great place to go to for brunch! I made a reservation here and it's better than the one in Raleigh in my opinion. The waiters and waitresses were nice. The seating and interior was much better and spacious. I got the 'Old Skool' Breakfast Bowl. It was basically grits with beans, pieces of bacon and sausage, and two eggs on top. I asked for no cheese because I'm lactose intolerant. After the meal, I WAS SO SO FULL. It was so good. On top of that, they give you complimentary biscuits with REAL jelly. It was great! I will definitely come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. &#39;Old Skool&#39; Breakfast Bowl

qefG3CgjiWof8KVd4kQAyQ.text: I really wish Yelp has a 0 star option even 1 star for this place is to high.  Slow as molasses both service and food~   Only thing good here is the biscuits.   I got a avocado toast which was drenched in honey sriracha sauce. The sauce took away from everything. The bread was super hard to even remotely cut into. I gave up cutting up my bread and ate the avocado drenched in the nasty sauce. The avocado toast was served with a wilted salad not fresh at all.  Southern hospitality mimosas had a hint of nectar flavor but the mimosas was flat no oomph where did the pinapple flavor go?   My party did not enjoy there meals as well. The omelet had bacon which was not crispy instead it was just fatty and soggy.   The chicken sandwich was mediocre. Apparently the breading ratio was more breading then chicken.  They also did tenderize the chicken which causes to cook unevenly.  I ordered a side of sage sausage. The sausage was not edible. The texture was very mushy and the taste was so horrible I can't describe it baby food taste better then the sage sausage. Right in my napkin it goes.  Please save your money and time go elsewhere. We were fortunate I was a yelp user we got a little bit off. 10% better then nothing.   Our server name Morgan was extremely impersonal and rude. I mean seriously who as a server rolles there eyes at the customers? We got major eye roll when we asked him for a third cup for the free pint giveaway. Our party of three all signed up to receive a free pint glass. Not only did he roll his eyes he slammed the cup onto our table.   The seating was infront of a running food door. Everytime a server needed to run a food for the people on the patio we got a blast of hot air slammed in our faces. I mean blocking a exit sure could be under.  I hope management looks into the seating arrangements. Do better employee training for customer service. Also look into reaching out to cooperate about there menu and there lack of taste.  Happy Fourth of July!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States

Rf3VclZxyP6J8xXBQgIzfQ.text: Some girlfriends and I stopped in for brunch and luckily were quickly seated. The drinks took a while and so did the avocado toast appetizer but both were pretty good overall. The biscuits were a nice touch of hospitality. I ordered the pimento cheese and fried pickle burger. The burger was darn good but totally heavy on the stomach especially pored with fries. The burger had a tough time holding together so out came the silverware.   The service was good but the kitchen was a little slow, especially since it was before they got REALLY busy. The rating of four stars is really based on the gap between hype and reality; the meal was good but I expected more especially at the price point.

skn5nxEAsd4FsXHaH0TX3g.text: Steven makes the best drinks!  We tried the mojito and the Moscow mule this time.  We love coming here for authentic southern food and good drinks!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Moscow mule and mojito!

ypVU8Og_6yd6crftUfSXmA.text: Family and I just moved to Charlotte from Philadelphia, and had high expectations for this place based on the reviews. Sad to say we were very underwhelmed.  We went for lunch on a Sunday, and the place was very busy, which is fine. We had reservations for 12:45, but were seated late, as they were running behind. Our drink orders were taken right away. However, it took about 30 mins for our food orders to be taken. We also had to ask multiple times and from 2 different people for utensils. After we started eating, we noticed we had no napkins, and when we asked the waitress, she said they had run out of napkins, so the manager was looking for more...?? Very strange. The food was also not as good as I expected. The fried pickles were great, but the chicken was unfortunately very dry.  We may give them another shot at some point, but we did not have a good first impression.

Ucu7a9ww6myRQQMDNaemkA.text: Tupelo Honey is one of my favorite breakfast/brunch places to go in Charlotte and I went for dinner for the first time tonight and it was AMAZING! Met all my expectations from past brunch experiences. And our waitress was super nice and attentive. We're going again in two weeks for an event and it can't come soon enougg

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Biscuits and Mountain Blueberry jam
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Classic Mimosa
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. 3 Item Breakfast Combo with short stack topped with Mountain Blueberries, Goat Cheese Grits and Potato Cracklins

kcBUHHyPbyeVL7zXO2ihUw.text: Saw an article on the Thrillist about a top-ranked grilled cheese sandwich and I am a sucker for a GC. Theirs is made with pimento cheese and havardi, a fried green tomato, soft red onion, a ham of sorts and I added on cheddar for $1 because why not?!  Holy hell. Blew me away. I'm usually one to just use good bread and cheese (and lots of butter) but was skeptical of all the toppings. Nonetheless, great taste and flavor. Heavy as expected so don't plan to exercise right after.

aX1wv-O2OcTzcD25tCSnuQ.text: We went to Tupelo Honey near the South End of Charlotte with some out-of-town guests who were very excited/determined to go. We went for brunch on a Saturday, and some of our group ordered the Bloody Marys that were presented with a lovely strip of candied bacon, some olives and pickled okra. I had a sip, and joined the consensus with a thumbs-up on the tasty tomato mix.   Our service was excellent. However, I wasn't as thrilled about the fried chicken as I wanted to be. I try to order something that is a 'signature' for a place. The hot sauce on the chick was too hot and 'one note' for me and I didn't enjoy the boring fried coating. In fact, the chicken didn't have much flavor. Or perhaps my taste buds were already 'lasered numb' by the hot sauce. I surveyed the table with order-envy and regretted that I hadn't gone for the sweet tea flavored fried chick instead.   Overall, our group was happy with their food, and enjoyed the flavorful Brussels sprouts, biscuits and honey that we shared among us.  Part of the charm of Tupelo Honey is the 2nd-floor location (old building, wide porch) that sits among the trees. The company could elevate the brand a bit with some attention to things like their menu design and logo. The logo makes no sense and feels so "off" when they have a cool name and vibe to work with...what's up with not having professional design? Takes it down towards "Lizard's Thicket" to me.  It was odd also that someone came by our table and asked how things were without introducing himself. We wondered...who was that, the manager, or just an obnoxious passer-by?  Overall it was enjoyable. With a little love and attention, Tupelo Honey could warm itself up and get from good to great.

wkCMUf1oNLyPJskssvsNEA.text: It was great spot to start my trip to Charlotte. In my opinion it's a bit hyped up, everyone below the Mason Dixon Line swears by the restaurant. If I would describe it's like the distant cousin of Jacob's Pickle.   The Brunch menu had the prototypical Southern food. I went all in - i had the fried green tomatoes, pimento cheese and the Shoo Mercy breakfast. All the dishes were creative and well executed but I feel it lacked the flavor profile I was expecting. It was really good but I had some heightened expectations. It's also odd that the best part of the meal was the complimentary biscuit with homemade jam.  I will say the restaurant has such a homey environment and our server Matt was awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shoo Mercy Breakfast
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Green Tomatoes
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pimento Cheese

lhK_jgne82P7aXuh84lUdA.text: I wasn't really impressed. I heard so many great things about this place but it didn't live up to it. The shrimp and grits was just okay. Squeeze the lemon for a better taste. There was nothing special about the Brussels sprouts... added honey and even pulled out the lemon pepper from my bag to season it.. still nothing. I ordered an appetizer and never got it, which wasn't a big deal, I told her if they hadn't started it, not to. The entree looked like enough food. I'm not going to hate on the waitress because I've been in her shoes but I do feel like she could have been a little more personable and friendly.   I'm not sure what course is better, but I'm going to say brunch isn't their strong point...? Idk.  Update- after speaking to a manager and her promising to correct the issue and inviting us back with a gift card. I never received the gift card via mail as was promised.

FD7MsRacBl7bNy1gPL7a-w.text: Scratch-made Southern fried food.  Yelp Check in offer - 10% off your bill - yes please!!  It's located on the 2nd floor of a beautiful building located in downtown Charlotte right next to the Blue line.  Park in the back of the building and walk up the stairs to the the 2nd floor.  What a fabulous restaurant!  I love the farm to table decor look about the place.  Wood floors and casual dining tables make this place a very comfortable and cozy place to eat a meal.  We started with Tupelo #brunchsohard Coffee - a signature blend roasted by revelator   What a delicious and smooth cup of coffee, I loved getting free refills on this excellent coffee.  Meals: Old School Breakfast bowl Slow roasted pork grilled cheese  Shoo mercy sweet potato pancakes  My meal was the Shoo mercy sweet potato pancakes - buttermilk fried chicken, apple cider bacon, spiced pecans, 2 fried eggs, grilled seasonal fruit, pickled blueberries.  What an amazing meal!  The chicken was fried perfectly, the meat was tender and juicy.    The sweet potato pancakes, oh my! I've never had anything like it.  They were amazing.  The bacon was delicious, the grilled apple was tasty, but those blueberries were weird.  Thankfully they were not the star of the show. It was like they were soaked in apple cider which made them very tart and tangy.    ** my only negative comment is that my meal didn't come with spiced pecans**  Everything was fantastic!  It was a lot of food but not too much that I couldn't finish it.  The other meals ordered were said to be wonderful as well.  We had an excellent meal and a great time eating here.  I would highly recommend eating here.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shoo mercy sweet potato pancakes - amazing, delicious!

2ax4yeJblU9QPULlXF7wVQ.text: Stopped in for brunch on a weekday ( Friyay). Restaurant had a few people inside but not overcrowded. We were immediately seated with our sever who was the sweetest young woman ( unfortunately can't recall her name). The atmosphere: welcoming and pleasant. I started off with a blueberry punch which was sweet and refreshing. we decided to grab few small bites.  We ordered the macaroni and cheese bites along with the honey chipotle wings . The Mac n cheese bites were perfectly fried into medium sized balls of gooey goodness. They came in a flavorful creole gravy . The wings were crispy on the outside , tender, juicy and fully cooked on the inside. Mmmm that chipotle sauce tho...sweet & savory. My favorites though were the complimentary biscuits, warm n fluffy. Best believe I slathered them with blueberry jelly and drizzled honey. So comforting.    Can definitely say overall I enjoyed myself here, can't wait to return and try other the dishes .

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blueberry punch ( non alcoholic)
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bar area
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Macaroni n cheese bites

CUlIRT4VKukivlROKPjGXA.text: Updated. After this review I was contacted by a manger and given an opportunity to come back to give them another try, and although it took us a while I'm glad we did. Wife had fried chicken and biscuits with gravy (Brunch all day menu) and it was amazing...biscuits are simply amazing but fried chicken is just wow!! I ordered the hanger steak and it was cooked perfectly, for the side the cackling potatoes were better than any fries or potatoes I've had in a very long time! Good beer selection and our server was super friendly and helpful. Well done guys! I guess anyone can have a bad day..5 stars! (Even though salt shakers still suck :)

T562_PtT5zi4-ykEw6QE4w.text: A great experience.   The fried okra was out of this world. You may say, "it's a slimy green veggie, how hard could it be?" Umm, you'd be surprised. They were cooked and seasoned perfectly and came with an amazing dipping sauce.   The pork sandwich in Rye that I had was very tasty. The bread was perfectly toasty, pork was tender and tangy, which made the whole sandwich come together perfectly. Their baked Mac and cheese was flaky on top but creamy in the middle.   Of the four desserts, the banana pudding and peanut butter were by far the very best!   Great food, great service, and great atmosphere.

FuVdDmP6oqh5RST80cIH0g.text: Review Update: I came back in for a brunch and had a better experience. I ordered the shakshuka. It was extremely filling, but good. I couldn't finish the whole thing. I liked the fresh avocado slices, they really made the dish. My mom got the honey dusted fried chicken and although there's really nothing "honey dusted" about it, it was ok. I guess we were expecting something a little different from the menu description.   The server was nice. He did a good job. There was no wait to be seated. The food took a little longer than we hoped to come out, but nothing near like the last visit. I've been to other locations and I would just say that this one is beautiful inside, it's clean, it's nice, but overall it's just not as consistent as the other one I visited.

0WmYilG51ar7fe0RdYYf7A.text: We went here for brunch and oh... my... word. We fell in love! The food! Was great! The ambiance! Was great! The service! Was great! We had such a great experience here and we've been sleeping on Tupelo.. I've been thinking of coming here for a few years now and we just made it by here? This is going down as one of my most memorable and favorite spots! Sunday Brunch was popping?

RSOkAxmk61Dj-FEnRsRbvA.text: This was my first time here and The food and atmosphere was all amazing Giselle and Alex were Great!!!! Can't wait to come back!!!! The Shoo mercy French toast is bangin!

wY2_tPwg3b1T0Joibx-nHQ.text: This was my second time here and both times have been pretty good! Cute restaurant with a nice outside patio. We ordered the old skool breakfast bowl, spicy avocado & chopped egg sandwich, the banana pudding dream French toast, & a lunch combo. The portions were a good size and the food tasted good. None of us had any complaints!
