vnTj0PiG9MfqVoEqUcK0dw.text: Tupelo Honey has great food and a great atmosphere. Jordan and Bailey we're good servers. I would definitely recommend this place to eat brunch.

JRJOdqgYGECwYYqrs84bow.text: This is a cute little cafe to have a light lunch with a Southern twist! We sat on the balcony because it was a lovely day.   The prices are fairly reasonable. I had the sauteed jumbo shrimp with fried okra and it was very tasty. I had a bite of the Charleston chicken sandwich and that was delightful as well.   I highly recommend the banana pudding, it was AMAZING. I'm very particular about banana pudding but it tastes just like grandma's!   This is a great place downtown to have a nice light lunch or date night. Parking in the back is sufficient. I definitely will be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sautéed jumbo shrimp, fried okra and baby kale and arugula salad.

pCNfx2QDa-p0RDSRW0FpMg.text: We eat breakfast here every Saturday, and we love it!  We always sit at the bar, and the servers there make us feel right at home.  The food is delicious, and the atmosphere is beautiful.  Get the goat cheese grits!

Q8yK8QRxWtIPP6Qg3TlKvQ.text: Sweet potato pancake is delish! Also location & atmosphere is on point. Oh and the bread they give you while you wait! Yummmm.

KxhKKzl-ZP6Jg3tic0jONQ.text: Tupelo Honey's frozen rose (frose) is amazing. Must try. Love love love. Hailey, the bar staff and others were fab. Must try the biscuits- totally worth the calories.

e9YJohGBrULUCdJAeeNF1w.text: First off I love the vibes of this place, and their biscuits are TO DIE FOR. But I feel like I had waaay to high of expectations when I came here for brunch. We asked for an outside seating, which was a must because the weather was lovely!! I see a lot of families coming here all dressed up nicely for brunch - love(: I came here wanting to order their French toast or shakshuka which I saw on their menu online, but I was so disappointed to not see it on their menu! (Whyyyy) So I stuck with the kale grilled shrimp salad and the lavender limenade. The lavender limenade was really good! You could taste the lavender and they didn't overly sweeten it so still had the sourness from the lime which is perfect! But the salad, whyyyyy does it taste like I'm eating straight up grass? The yogurt dressing was okay, the pears added a hint of sweetness- great, shrimp was big and banging but the lettuce and radishes tasted like they straight up ripped it up from the ground. My cousins ordered the fried chicken burger, it looked SO bomb but it was legit sitting in a pool of grease. (I'm not even exaggerating) Also, the fries were super duper soggy & tasted like regular frozen fries. Overall the presentation of the foods were awesome! But the taste sadly disappointed me. If I'm ever coming back it would be for sure for the biscuits!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yum!
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ehhh- don&#39;t really recommend.

ISAKSPy7Y7lZ0x_04L37CA.text: We love taking our visitors to Tupelo Honey.  The atmosphere is fun and festive. The food is yummy, a twist on the southern flavour. Our Server, William made our day with his positive and uplifting attitude. Thanks William!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States

LdaIDQ1RfUn2ZPTDdWJANg.text: Really great food, really great drink selection! Good place for the family or with friends to celebrate a special day!

4pfM9dV_NRcD_5_wcV7Veg.text: I've been to several Tupelo Honey's but this one just wasn't up to par with the rest.  Our service was very poor.  Then we weren't even offered dessert because it was obvious they wanted us to leave to make room for a party.  The whole table's drinks were empty at one point.  The food...I had the fried chicken and it was good, but definitely not an $18 chicken. breast.  My husband got the beef spare rib for $20+ and it wasn't more food than a young girl would eat.  But,  the biscuits were excellent and the honey was too.  That's why I am giving atleast 3 stars.

51hPCFqSwiYVMyNUIQPJ3g.text: I dined at Tupelo Honey today with my sister and two friends and our experience was not the best (to say the least) which is disappointing as Tupelo Honey is one of my favorite restaurants.   The problems started when our food was brought to us - we all ordered pancakes, which no syrup was brought to us and our bacon was under cooked; we asked our server for syrup and properly cooked bacon. Overall, we waited about 10 - 12 minutes for these things to come out to us while the rest of our food was getting cold. When the bacon was brought to our table one of the servers sat it down saying "here is your extra, extra, extra crispy bacon" - it wasn't crispy, it was burnt. Surely, there is a medium between undercooked food and over cooked food - and there is, it's properly cooked food. After waiting and then receiving burnt bacon none of the food was appetizing anymore and I was really disappointed.   When our server came back we asked her to speak to the manager, after explaining to the manager what happened she offered to take the bacon off our bill and give us the "family and friends discount." We then waited another 15 - 20 minutes for our checks to be organized and pay.   From now on, I will stick to the Greenville location where my experience has always been great.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Undercooked bacon &amp; extra, extra, extra crispy bacon.

tF6890QRD_KcA_IJzxEqFQ.text: Went for Sunday brunch and was completely disappointed with our food. When they brought our food, one plate was wrong and all they did was dump it on another plate. They also didn't bring out syrup so that added another 5 and my pancakes were cold by then. The bacon wasn't fully cooked...for the whole table. Asked for fully cooked bacon (another 10 mins) and the girl (not our server) brought it to the table and said "here's your extra extra extra crispy bacon" with an attitude. We asked for the manager and she asked what was good about our dining experience. NOTHING. Everything was cold and what we tasted, wasn't great. She then gave us a "family and friends discount" but our checks were still wrong. HOT MESS EXPRESS. We noticed several tables had issues with their food. Save your money! Won't be returning to this location. The Greenville SC location is so much better.  Check out the (extra extra crispy) bacon picture.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States

WV58531089CxTzNADXOiFA.text: Southern charm. Creative food choices. I like it!  I stopped in for lunch and had several appetizers and beers. Before I say anything else, HAVE THE BISCUITS. (They serve warm biscuits with tupelo honey and jam.... soooo good.)   Fried green tomatoes are good. Wasn't too crazy about the fried Brussel Sprouts. Our server Taylor was friendly and knowledgeable. The actual space/location are nice too. I'd recommend this place and would return. The environment is casual and fun. Thumbs up.

OwPtYht7oK2iaUYV_a4FeQ.text: Love this place! I go here a lot! The fried green tomatoes with their signature lemonade is superb!! Great atmosphere, decent prices, welcoming servers!

5O3pf9tWyD3rYdbLk92dTQ.text: Expect a significant wait but quick turnaround between ordering and receiving your food.   We arrived around 10AM on a Sunday and were quoted 45-60 minutes for indoor seating and 15-20 minutes for outdoor seating. Bar seating is available but minimal -  expect for people to gather around the bar as they grab a drink while waiting for their tables. We opted for outdoor seating and the time quote was accurate.  What we ordered:  - Blueberry champagne short stack (free with email signup) - worth an email sign up to try it, but the pancakes are kid-sized haha  - Southern shakshuka - you can't go wrong ordering this! A good balance of grits, egg, tomatoes and avocado - Apple cider pork belly hash - essentially potatoes + 2 eggs. Don't get me wrong, it was delicious and well made, but I don't think it was substantial enough to be considered an entree. It would be a great appetizer though! I'd recommended it as something to share, not something to order for yourself only.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Apple cider pork belly hash (L) and Southern shakshuka (R)

YIc7X9paTyScQ16hCOlnPQ.text: We came here for brunch and the food and service was great!  The breakfast bowl was my favorite thing we tried. The goat cheese grits were really good, so we will definitely be back to try the shrimp and grits!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Avocado Toast Points
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Old Skool Breakfast Bowl
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Huevos rancheros

d_wY0j2DnQ31Ju_QGKtQeQ.text: Good spot for a southern brunch. Perfect place to bring out of town friends or family!

493aodeKj4qCXSG8OvkvLw.text: Listen get my mama on the phone and send her an e-vite because I owe her a slap after eating this food! They have so much variety on the menu here. I had never heard of this place but I've been Yelpin... (watermelon) and trying new stuff. It's a little pricey but worth it. You get a lot of food too.   Their collard greens and mac' n cheese were FIYA. And their servers are as attentive as Mr. Meeseeks when it comes to attending to your needs. I'll definitely be back.   The entrance is a little weird as it's upstairs or you have to take an elevator up one flight to sort of find the lobby. Other than that it's a great spot.  Kaepernick is right to take a knee. Don't be mad at him for the truth!

VY_UTO7Mp2teH7MRqQ-ONg.text: Came here for daughter's graduation celebration. Appetizers were great. We had Mac n cheese bites, fried cauliflower and Brussel sprouts. All delish. The biscuits were to die for!! Not so good: black bean burger. So underwhelming. Shrimp and grits. Shrimp not seasoned and grits were runny. For a large party service was okay. Not great and not bad, just okay.

0cvzTHzHDUEQPoedYawiYA.text: Always a wonderful dinning experience. I used open table to make a reservation so checkin and getting seated was a breeze by the warm and welcoming hostess. There's even the 10% off for checking in here on yelp. I had the shoo mercy sweet potato pancakes, DELICIOUS! And there was also the shoo Mercy shrimp and grits had by my guest. Both divine for a blessed Sunday afternoon brunch! Some chains are worth the hype, Tupelo is one of em! Hopefully you can get Kelsey as your server, she's awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shoo Mercy Shrimp and Grits
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shoo Mercy Sweet Potato Pancakes
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States

cAsd7O8Qt4CwgmHYo0yDXQ.text: I tend to be hesitant about chain restaurants, but Tupelo Honey is fantastic every single place/time I've been to one and Charlotte was no exception! 4 friends and I were visiting the area and wanted delicious food! The complimentary biscuits and jam were the perfect start to a delicious meal. Several of us had the pork grilled cheese, others had the chicken blt. Just thinking about them is making me hungry! Definitely go for the Mac n cheese side! If you are not a spicy lover, put the spicy honey on the side (one friend made the mistake of ordering it on her food and was not as happy as if she'd left it off!).   This location was very cold. During warmer months, I'm sure it's absolutely perfect bit with the temperature dip, definitely wear warmer clothes.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grilled cheese and Mac n cheese.... ALL THE CHEESE, PLEASE
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Small but scrumptious sweet potato side
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken blt with the potatoes side (delicious!)

D_Ad9l_2TfugGU4d4inLGQ.text: Not sure if they had a bad day but the French toasts were absolutely terrible. Some of the ones at the other tables looked nice and thick but ours appeared to made out of regular sandwich bread. 3 stars for the rest of food and the fact they have online reservations.

MlCZRWB5qgF26uxhhspobw.text: I went for lunch with a co-worker. The service was fantastic and the food was amazing. I had the sweet potatoes pancakes with the fried chicken. I really enjoyed it! I wouldn't mind subtracting the eggs from the meal but either way great meal.  Will definitely be making this a favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States

xDSSvsU44pqQeEbinlX3Hw.text: We decided to celebrate our 20+ wedding anniversary by choosing nice-but-casual dining here at Tupelo Honey. Ambience is as expected...very spacious inside, with casual, woodsy decor, and great upstairs/patio dining options.  Menu was also as expected...with a good variety of Southern/Low-Country specialties.  Service was fair...in that our waiter TRIED, but we can tell he was having a hard time.  They seemed to be short-staffed, and this waiter was frantically rushing from way across the room (again, this restaurant is very spacious) to our table to various other tables in between.  Nothing major, but there were delays in getting our drinks and appetizer.  Then the food.  Despite our high expectations, the food just wasn't that good.  The Biscuits were OK, the Fried Cauliflower was OK, and my Shrimp and Grits were on the bad side...with too much pepper in the Grits.  My husband also said his Fried Chicken was just average, though the Collards were really good.  Even the Cheesecake dessert was just So-So.  Also, must add that the Sangria was THE worst I've ever had.  Guess I should have read the ingredients more closely?  It didn't look or taste like Sangria...more like some super-strong mixed alcohol, with such a bitter taste.  Truly horrible...and $10.00 at that!  I almost sent it back, but decided to be nice, and poured a ton of honey and sweetener to make it taste better lol.  To end on a positive note, we were seated very comfortably...in a super-large booth.  Overall, this was quite a disappointing dining experience ...especially considering the fact that it was our anniversary.  I saw that this restaurant had a 4-star rating on Yelp, so I expected 4-star food...but for us, at least on this particular night, it was barely a 3.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sangria &amp; Beer
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Biscuits - Complimentary
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Honey Buttermilk Cheesecake

tlXy7l4LB5f1PKlAgzdSeA.text: Both times I've eaten here my expectations have been exceeded. First time I ordered the shoo mercy shrimp and grits and I fell in love. The chorizo and the fried egg just made a classic southern dish that much more exciting. The second time I got a pulled pork sandwich on rye or pumpernickel and it had some jam or bbq sauce that added the perfect mix of sweet & salty. And the bread was perfectly toasted. This place lives up to the hype.

Y7AsukD3Z1mtCQoKWo5_mg.text: Cole is the best waiter ever! He was on point with bringing the food and drinks out in a timely manner. He also was on top of refilling our drinks! Gave him a raise!

Vdvt60kuyHmg_3QLZJtldg.text: I have been wanting to come here for so long and now I'm mad that it has taken me so long.   I went to Tupelo Honey during lunch last week and was awed by the architecture and atmosphere of the building, particularly the deck and the rustic bricks. We were seated immediately and ordered some appetizers! We got fried green tomatoes and Brussels sprouts. ALSO - I could eat those biscuits with fresh jam and honey FOREVER (best thing about the south). The fried green tomatoes were crispy and flavorful and served on a bed of grits which were so good we were just eating them off the plate when they were leftover. The brussel sprouts were also cooked and seasoned to perfection.   For my lunch, I ordered the fried chicken sandwich which was served stifling hot and fresh. I would recommend asking for more of the Dijon mustard to top off the sandwich. By this point in the meal, I was not super hungry, but I did enjoy this sandwich immensely.   I would definitely come back here and am ready to try one of their infamous brunches!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried chicken sandwich with a house side salad
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brussel Sprouts
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried green tomatoes - A MUST

gfgFt0KlxLLTcYAukv3Gfg.text: With out-of-towners wanting a "southern experience" we decided Tupelo would be the best spot for a Saturday brunch. We had reservations for 11, and they were really cool when we had to call because our uber got lost and we were going to be late. We were seated immediately and drinks were taken promptly. Our friend ordered the massive Bloody Mary and was very impressed by it. The mimosas were standard, with pulpy OJ. The only drink letdown was the margarita, which was 99% sour mix.   As for the food, some of the brunch price points are a little high, but you do get a generous portion of food. Everyone loved their complimentary biscuits and there were no complaints to be had with the food! The flannel hash was my choice, and it certainly kept me full for the whole day. The avacado toast was another clear winner at the table, along with the French toast.    Definitely a place to take guests, or for a special occasion, or for just a decadent brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Avacado toast with poached eggs
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. The queen Bloody Mary
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Flannel hash.

vGOExgTe9c4aCpB5YsFFtw.text: I love the location and the ambiance. The food is always consistent. Southern, local, and flare. My friends and I had a fantastic meal! Our server, Peaches, was outstanding! We got service, not just an order taker, which seems to be the trend in Charlotte now a days.  Food was amazing! Lots of things for me to pick from that were delish! The brussels and okra were tasty. Fried okra is the jam spot, especially with their white sauce. The spicy avocado and egg sandwich was  great! Being a vegetarian and having something with that much flavor and protein was amazing. It is hard to find any form of sanwiches to eat. Let alone, ones that taste that good! Also had the tomato soup with grilled cheese sticks. YUM! The whiskey mule was perfect with everything we ordered. Presentation was on par too. Love to eat with my eyes too.  Long story short, go here. They have easy parking, a ton of variety, and a really friendly staff. They always seem to be busy and on a wait.... in my opinion, that is never a bad thing. The wait is worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Whiskey mule
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy avocado and egg sandwich with tomato soup
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried green tomatoes

K6twJkep3H5dSNNO_1Qv4w.text: Food is good but service is terrible. Took forever for server to acknowledge that we were sat at table and even longer to get drinks we ordered.

neUde8XprMZBH6PrSFBGHw.text: 5 Star all the way. The food and service was phenomenal. I had the fried chicken with pancakes and my friend had the same with french toast. Both were on the money. I do believe the eggs were that carton, laboratory crap and not real shell eggs so that would be my only issue. I forgot to ask for shell eggs because being where im from, NY, you have to make sure you ask for them or else...  Def worth a visit

RbOjzDeHDBdqNaN0gC1I5A.text: We showed up for brunch at 9:30 on a Sunday. We were promptly seated and the waiter was full of personality and great advice on what to order. He was mostly prompt but there was some lag after our food was delivered. I ordered the southern shakshuka and everything but the eggs were phenomenal.  They were grossly undercooked and once broken open both the white and yolk were liquid. I was able to successfully scoop them out of the grits. I flagged down another server who took them and I asked him to please have them cook the white but leave the yolk runny. After nearly all of my food was consumed, our waiter brought back to hard cooked eggs. It was disappointing but he was apologetic and quickly replaced them with properly cooked eggs.   The reasons for my reducing my rating to three stars were the following...  1) The under cooked eggs and the lack of the quick replacement  2) The table in the window were not clean at all and there was a spider web that was disturbing  3) The complimentary biscuits were incredibly salty to the point they were inedible.   I will definitely give this place another chance as I feel the good outweighs the bad.

qXLViyCqea5WJ-tb9UooJg.text: A. Maze. Zing.  Great spot for brunch. Delicious southern cuisine and you can't go wrong with anything no the menu. I definitely recommend this spot brunch, lunch and dinner.

LFM958UvUb8aGSy-FDEq4A.text: The whole area is filled with delights and interests. However we stopped in at this one... I'm soooo glad we did!  Driving down the main road with GOS and we still almost missed it. There is only a small sign off the side of the building coming from the way we came. I barely caught it. Be sure to be watching.  Once we found it and walked around the front we saw a cute elevator to go up in.  It is only on the second level but up we went. When the doors opened they opened up to a wonderful long galley  style deck. It was spacious, stylish and inviting.  We went through the door to the hostess stand only to find the most adorable inside area as well! The Decor was so cool. Free standing windows and doors all over, high ceilings, an open view to the kitchen, lots of space, and just an overall all relaxing and hip vibe! We loved it instantly.  The menu is built with lots of combinations, mixes of flavors, and elevated comfort foods.  I started with the blueberry sparkling punch. This is way way way sweet! Powerful taste but I think I needed a dentist after just a sip. I think a bit of soda water in it to tone it down might have helped. But it had a great blueberry punch for sure.  They brought out homemade biscuits, blueberry preserves and honey for the table. These were decadent... I'm glad they didn't bring out more or I would have gorged myself on just these.  For my main lunch I had the BBQ chicken press: smoked jalapeno bbq sauce, sliced apples, white cheddar cheese, garlic buttermilk ranch on a grilled flatbread... and it was Oooohhh My Goddie Toooooo Hottie delicious!! I even got it with a side of pinto beans that were not too bad...(I don't normally like pinto beans but these are good) trying to branch out.  Our waiter was excellent... very friendly and attentive. We did not want for anything.  This eatery was a True find! I wish we had this in Pflugerville! It would be a huge hit here as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken spice grilled flat bread
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Honey, blueberry and homemade biscuits
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sparkling blueberry punch

l-TUGrLxukWFIvT2-HdVMw.text: On a trip to Charlotte, I was looking for a dinner spot on a Friday night. I checked out the most reviewed restaurants in town on Yelp, and Tupelo Honey was at the top of the list. I stopped by with a friend and we got a table on the patio. Tupelo is located in a trendy shopping center with several other bars, restaurants, and a tattoo parlor. They do have a parking lot but finding a spot can become tricky at peak hours. I found one of the last spots as someone was leaving right when I pulled up.   Tupelo has an awesome craft cocktails menu even though they're pretty pricey. I went with their version of the mojito. From there, they start you off with some delicious biscuits and jam. I always appreciate a complimentary starter!  Appalachian pork with two sides (4.5/5): the pork loin came with a tangy BBQ sauce and your choice of two sides. I went with the cheese grits and tomato basil soup. While the soup was really good, they barely give you any of it. It was served in more of a platter than a bowl which was bizarre. Especially since the serving sizes of their other sides like their grits and fries are generous. The cheese grits were great and complimented my Southern dish well.   Service was also awesome throughout. Tupelo Honey has a great ambiance whether you're outside on the patio, inside, or at the bar.

wHBS_SJYBYBNH2iKhjzTxw.text: Yummy brunch today! The hubby and I got the shrimp and grits and a side of potato cracklins. Both were realllly yummy! Both were also so heavy we couldn't finish either even tho we were sharing. Tho I will blame some of that on the basket of hot pillowy biscuits that preceded the meal that were irresistible.  Also we got two Margs nothing extra ordinary but tasty none the less seeing as how both were polished off.  I can def see why everyone talks about this place. Would be happy to return for brunch anytime!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shoo Mercy Shrimp &amp; Grits
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tupelo Honey - Margarita
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Potato Cracklins

4W2X0_L7H4BTu9uPxem6Vg.text: From a service perspective, my experiences have been pretty mixed -- sometimes I get an attentive waiter, other times I have to flag down other staff members for silverware and drink refills -- but the food has always been consistently good.   The deviled eggs and crispy sprouts have been my go-to starters, and I get one or the other just about every time I've visited. Of the entrees, so far the hanger steak is my favorite--mine have been perfectly cooked, with the most delicious green beans. It's just the right amount of food so that I leave satisfied but not uncomfortably stuffed. I also enjoy the Appalachian pork. The spicy sriracha sauce it comes with isn't that spicy and adds a the honey adds a nice sweetness to the pork. (I recommend getting the sprouts for your side--they pair very well with the sriracha sauce, too.)  From the bar, I recommend the wildflower moscow mule (VERY refreshing, especially on a hot night out on the deck) and the lavender and honeysuckle lemondrop. One of these days, I'll have to stop by for breakfast and a bloody mary from their list.   I enjoy sitting outside, and sometimes wonder if that's why I've had trouble with service -- maybe the servers also have tables indoors they're juggling? Or maybe, since I'm usually a party of one, I'm just overlooked. But if they could get their service issues figured out, I would come here more often.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. LOVE that they use paper straws. Hate that this particular kind dissolves in my mixed drinks.
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Side entrance. Downstairs is SOS, upstairs is Tupelo Honey.
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Deviled eggs. DELISH.

Ldhjn-IqSsvl4WJ9jX7BSg.text: Nice outdoor seating area. Fast service. We ordered  their Shoo mercy griddle and avocado egg Betty. They let us swap white meat for dark meat in the shop mercy griddle,which is nice. The fried chicken is very tasty. Hot and tender inside with crispy and nicely seasoned outer shell. Would come back again just for some more chicken! The rest of the food is good but definitely with the high light of the chicken.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States

bktEP4A99aFfsWV6VcNi-Q.text: Visiting Charlotte for a weekend from NYC and wanted to experience some of the great local restaurants (I Love southern food!)   Found Tupelo Honey and based on the great reviews decided to give it a try. OMG so glad a did!  Its on the second floor and they have outside seating as well. Service was super friendly from beginning to end. Everything on the menu looks delicious, was hard to decide so we ordered a few things to try  Food  -Southern Shakshuka: two baked eggs, scratch-made creole sauce, sliced avocado, served over stone-ground goat cheese grits  -Old Skool' Breakfast Bowl: two sunny-side up eggs*, potato cracklins, black eyed peas, cheddar cheese, bacon & sausage crumbles, goat cheese grits  -Sweet potato pancakes   Only con is that they dont have lattes or cappuccinos and their regular coffee is very weak, not tasty at all. Our waitress mentioned a lot of people have complained about it.  Amazing food! If you can definitely stop by Tupelo and you won't be disappointed. Wish NYC had one
