fyoZU7lMrJeyvdb-VNurCg.text: Breakfast is our favorite. Biscuits are the best. Atmosphere and service is good. The restaurant is lovely and parking is good. The wait time can be a problem, especially on the weekends,  it's doable. Prices are reasonable. Nice time.

R2k2Tri7fneKm-6ze9Jkhg.text: Well, in typical Jessica fashion, I'm gonna make this short, sweet and easy to read.  *4 top/8:45 reservations/not to busy for a Saturday night  1) server Emerson (19), very sweet but slow and not attentive. Young, so he didn't know liquors but that's ok.  2) don't expect to get anything except a craft beer-no Coors or the like.  3) Biscuits came in the middle/end and were not any better than Cracker Barrel 4)Goat Cheese was amazing-highly recommend  5)I would not return-unless invited and this place was their desire.  6) Fried Green tomatoes were great but needed dipping sauce-instead of the grits probably.  7)Lastly, take a jacket, it's freezing in this place.  Xo JDH

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Holy cow-that&#39;s a Sweet Potato Pancake! W/Chicken with a dap of Sweet butta!! Bacon was peppered so not my taste, others liked!
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Green Tomatoes needed a dipping sauce but were very good! That&#39;s grits and a marinara sauce.
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Goat Cheese was amazing! 5 star on this dish!

LuzNEC6EqKvr1tq0B1R_Tw.text: Being from the south I expected so much from this restaurant! I ordered the wicked chicken sandwich and fries. The chicken sandwich was extremely dry with a weird flavored coleslaw. I only ate two bites! Service was horrible as well. The waiter was in such a rush and extremely rude. NEVER AGAIN. I don't see what the hype is about. The complimentary biscuits were the only thing that was decent. UGH $20 Wasted!

cOhv1qqRwssyU4_njaxzxg.text: I like Tupelo just fine but when I think about eating here, I always shrug and think, "meh".  I've been 3 times and the food has been good, but nothing that blows me away.  I've only ever been during the week for lunch or for dinner.  I've never tried brunch because I'm scared of how long the wait would be.  I don't think this is a place I'd return to, however, because 1) there are so many other places just like it 2) I think it's overrated for what is offered 3) I've never really had good service.  Servers have always seemed rushed or over-worked or something and 4) (I'm not an old lady but...) this place is too loud to carry on a conversation.   Don't get me wrong; give it a try if you're in the area, like fusion-y southern cooking or if you like the original in Asheville.  It might spark your fancy more than mine!

r-lurn3_Rat2Y3ktl98tgA.text: When this place first opened I went allllll the time - it was great. But my last few visits have been subpar at best. The service isn't as good, and the food isn't either - not sure if it's menu changes or the actual food, but I've determined that I might as well quit trying and go to some other places around.

hN05qmdWLkZ6-8QpJSonDw.text: We had our office Christmas Party in the bar and then dinner in the dining area.  First of all, the service was great.  Attentive, not hovering.  Fast, not hurried.  The food was great.  We had 20 in our party and ordered from the menu.  We were all served inside 20 minutes.  Everyone raved about how interesting and delicious the food was.  Roasted Brussel Sprouts were my favorite.    The bartenders were tops.  Made many new suggestions to our group, and readily modified content without hesitation.  Decor was perfect for our laid-back group.  We shall return!

6mlnZhb1VcL8z6z5y0RDZA.text: Was in Charlotte to watch NCAA Regional Basketball games.  Got up Sunday morning and rode the new transit train south for a couple of stops.  Stepped off and looked up at this joint.   Decided to check it out.  Great brunch.    Great Bloody Mary.

hkrC76BvrTYna2nx0ckmyw.text: If this reviews was all about the food, it would be 5 stars. For me, food does not encompass my entire experience. I was dining by myself and the restaurant was fairly crowded. I decided to sit in the bar area which I ended up waiting 10 minutes before anyone came to see if I needed anything. The bartender, who was very nice, came over and took my beer order and gave me a menu. It was another 10-15 before he came back to get my food order. As I waited another 30 minutes for my food the bartender came by and look amazed that I hadn't received my food yet and sent someone to check on it. My food came out 5 minutes after that. Someone who I presume to be a manager or possibly an owner came by, apologized and offered me a free dessert. Everyone was sincerely apologetic but my criticism is with staffing on the bar side. Having the bartenders wait tables on a Saturday night seems to be a little misguided.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. So simple yet so good..
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Curried fried chicken thighs with smashed cheesy cauliflower and lemon blueberry quinoa with feta and arugula. Yummy!
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Off the hook...

ImxaCesE3YHCV1FV1PGRIQ.text: The Shoo Mercy pancakes are ridiculously good. I consider myself a food snob and the pancakes at Tupelo were on point for flavor, fluffy, and moist. Tupelo is a delicious spot for any occasion with indoor/outdoor space and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a cute spot for brunch/lunch/dinner. It truly is a Charlotte gem.

zq9-fYQ2Tz5MdseJN8tM1w.text: So I went here once and it was pretty great! Had the sweet potato pancakes and chicken.. BOMB!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sweet potato pancake with chicken

K2qtRkPmVMYIFnVNSFXNvg.text: Trying different Southern comfort food spots in Charlotte can be a hit or miss. Tupelo Honey Cafe is definitely a hit! Absolutely delicious. I'm full and still have food to take home. The portions will not leave you disappointed or hungry.  We came at 7pm on a Saturday and was seated right away by a warm and friendly Hostess. Our waitress was plesant and helpful with making a choice and our water glass was never empty.  The Menu isn't overwhelming with too many options but just the right amount to make a great selection. I had the Shoo Pancake served with bacon, candied pecans, warm maple syrup, and a crisy, absolutely delicious, boneless chicken breast. BTW, the Pancake is HUGE and it's sweet potato. I am sooooo happy right now!   The sweet potato pancake taste like sweet potatoes! Not some food coloring or spice but an actual sweet potato  the only dislike was my bacon. I love my bacon well done, extra crispy, a little Cajun, lol.  Although it wasn't bad I just wish it was crispy. This dish is not overly sweet; it was a great balance of sweet and salty.   My Husband had the Fried Chicken with the brussel sprouts and fried okra. You can choose your own sides and they have yummy selections. It was two pieces of boneless fried chicken breast with yummy gravy over it. The Biscuit that comes out before your meal with the blueberry perseve is delicious. The right amount of crunch on the outside while being moist on the inside.  I will definitely be back to try other dishes. The price is right, the place is warm and the staff is friendly. I'm definitely bringing friends back with me.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shoo Pancake (sweet potatoe pancake, bacon, pecans, warm maple syrup, and crispy chicken breast)
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Green Tomatoes
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yummy goodness! With Blueberry preserves

uD8MIK2eSInsCiov0VXeDA.text: This place is the real deal in terms of amazing brunch and breakfast Southern meals. The fried chicken was perfect and the sweet potato pancake was awesome. Service was top notch, William took good care of my party and made sure our sweet teas were always filled and cold. All in all, great place, awesome food, great selection on the menu and fantastic service.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States

y29RKQ33M6z1dzC2-VTf-w.text: LOVE! Food was absolutely amazing. Fun vibe and service was excellent. Will definitely be back for brunch.

Vyvvzhjf6etYBGh5m01Psg.text: Yes, yes, yes!   First time to visit this restaurant today and it was amazing! Chicken & waffles...whoa...heavenly!  Our server, Jonathan, was one of the best we've had anywhere--made the meal extra special with our friends.  I highly recommend this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Get the chicken and waffles!! (Their version uses sweet potato pancakes) Amazing!

MFxqYIV5jhHHIDpKY5nmOw.text: Looking for an exciting cozy brunch..? Tupelo Honey is a must! Try their coffee, gravy biscuit and their brunch menu! It's flavorful Right from their interiors to the fab food and servers.., you'll go from here with a content palette and happy heart!

No7AN7IwnXtAof8Z5pbNEA.text: This is worth the wait. They had really great biscuits. I also got the Southern Shakshuka that was pretty delicious.

whtn2hteY1Qm5wKgKCnJkg.text: Go to place when having visitors to Charlotte. Anytime I have guests this is one of the places I take them along with midwood. Pancakes are ridiculously expensive but the best thing you've ever had. Fried chicken sandwich is the best. Period

mMCAI3BHxUkQRBnZgue3HQ.text: Delicious southern cooking with a nice flair. High quality food, great atmosphere and friendly wait staff. Make a reservation if you plan on going during rush hour!

lQKMC6I3Pm4M72QroNH8Uw.text: First time here with coworkers on travel...they also have a northern VA location from we are from but never had a chance to try them out. Service was awesome and so was the food. So good that I completely forgot to take pictures! Their complimentary biscuits and blueberry jam was amazing! All the apps sounded delicious but we opted for the fried green tomatoes and fried Brussels sprouts. Absolutely delicious! I got the breakfast platter that consisted of pancakes, eggs, buttermilk fried chicken with pecan topping! My coworkers tried the shrimp and grits with chirizo, honey glazed wings, fried chicken w/mac-n-cheese and collards. I pretty much taste tested all of their food and I must say that EVERYTHING was delicious! I will definitely be going to my VA location back home!

AgcUrtHc-ebH6_BN5Om4Uw.text: My husband and I came here during lunch time. The food was so delicious especially the mac and cheese. We ordered specialty drinks and they were definetely strong enough to only need one each. Haley, the drinks manager was very nice and came over to talk to us. Will come again. We loved the atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States

ZWJ6QnCcEODyAqiXnyCC2A.text: Went for the Happy Hour specials and the tacos were seriously inedible. The fried chicken was dry and the pork was greasy. Very low quality ingredients. The "mason jar" dips were not in mason jars and the presentation was lacking. The black eyed pea hummus needed a garnish (something!) to look appetizing. The pimiento cheese was ho-hum. Have been to the Knoxville  location and enjoyed it so not sure what the issue is. Despite the server's best efforts it was a terrible meal.

uPnuSTI8_2EOsGKUY8C8xA.text: 2 words "Come Hungry"! Dined tonight with my hubby and my mother. The waitress was extremely pleasant and knowledgeable, that none of us looked on the menu, we ordered a special because out waitress made it sound so delicious! Food came out and or eyes bulged out of our heads! Lol... the plate was piled nearly a mile high.  To say it was large portion is an understatement, and on top of that the food was amazingly fresh and delicious. OMG and they got my eggs right (soft scramble, slightly runny), nearly no one ever gets those right for me! Lol... super satisfied and full! Check this place out, you won't be disappointed! They earned and deserve all five of these stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States

rBeJI8zD9eXoKt-mc4zDtg.text: Very solid, if a bit heavy food.  A bit chain-ish feeling but low key and manageable.  Pimento nachos were good, though obviously heavy.  Fried green tomatoes were solid.  Catfish was tasty.

K8GzfrcD0kYghjOEvLuATQ.text: What a hidden gem this place is! From the moment we walked in to the time we walked out, we thoroughly enjoyed our brunch. Our waiter, Greg, was phenomenal! Not only was he knowledgeable about the menu but he also made recommendations which turned out to be amazing. He made us feel right at home and made sure we had everything we needed at all times. We ended up choosing the baked mac-n-cheese, pecan pie french toast, and the chicken and biscuits. You can't go wrong with any of those! We will definitely be back to try more!

EuoWi36_CDbkgIXfUG-BGg.text: Great service by Caleb! The food was ok. I think it's just that I got a burger and fries. The beef tasted of good quality - it just wasn't that great for the price. The fries were dreadful... not hot either. The place has a cool atmosphere inside. The staff was working very hard. Lastly, I wish the prices were posted on the menu online. Some of the menu items seemed way over priced.

GlkIIEv2RoX6lb4BFAPLtg.text: Went here for my daughters after graduation party with family.   Food was not bad, really good location and free parking.   Service was really slow for a mid with low traffic.

wq1KgUm4bntg-nBk7GabAQ.text: Loved the atmosphere and staff. Peaches was our waitress and she was extremely outgoing and helpful.  Buffalo Blue fried chicken was great! Mmm Biscuits

gjfX-Congw-L4QnDYUMDCg.text: Walked right in and seated quickly...on a Saturday night!  Menu had lots of southern comfort foods.  We ordered 4 dishes, my favorite bring the melt in your mouth fried okra(possibly the best I've had!!)  Outside seating on the upstairs balcony was nice too.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States

GHUWAT7d5GVC7nItovxJiw.text: These people know how to do brunch like pros.  The biscuits are divine.   The shrimp and grits had big shrimp, fabulous veggies, and a big serving of love (or perhaps butter?) was inspiring. The vibe? Delightfully chill.  Filled with natural light. Fun location.  Highly recommended.

7fUsPk_GCrt77uyyjncAXw.text: The wife and I took a trip to Charlotte for a weekend getaway and decided to try something different. I was going through Yelp and this place stuck out like a sore thumb. We sat outside and enjoyed the weather with refreshing drinks.   Our server (Jamison) was attentive, nice and on target with our requests. We order the mason jar 4 dip selection. Very tasty and it came out fast. I also had the best biscuit with honey and blueberry compote I have ever tasted. Service was an A+ and the bathrooms were clean.  One thing I would like to mention is that you all should really consider selling your honey at the restaurant. It is absolutely amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Best biscuit and honey ever!
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States

utLqzyGHq4RacR7sQPdt7w.text: Just had a fantastic meal at Tupelo Honey In Charlotte.  Our server Sierra did an awesome job guiding us through the menu all the way from drinks to dessert.  I cannot find one thing to fault with this dining experience from start to finish.  The service was great, the food excellent, the outdoor porch/terrace dinning as the sun was going down made for a great evening.    I would highly recommend the fried green tomatoes as an appetizer, the buttermilk chicken and pancakes with pecans was all delicious while we shared the desserts and both the buttermilk honey cheese and the S'mores desserts were outstanding!    I would recommend Tupelo Honey Cafe Charlotte to anyone who was looking for a good meal while in town.  I know I will certainly be dining there next time I am back.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. The oh so yummy S&#39;mores dessert with fresh raspberries.  So good someone took a bite before I could even take a picture!
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Buttermilk Honey Cheesecake with fresh Blueberries!  This was incredible.
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Buttermilk fried chicken and pancakes.  So good!

5qjXdhoBtoE4yNyv9Jbywg.text: This place has gone downhill. We haven't been in over a year and will deff not be going back the food is way over priced for what you get and not to mention the 3 hairs on my plate. What was supposed to be a great Father's Day brunch we all left disappointed

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States

hl2DTydoNPj2eQC0gx-U9A.text: FIrst of all the service was amazing  - she really tried  -   It was after noon and we wanted breakfast and we noted that they served Brunch till four.    I order two scrambled eggs bacon and potatoes - my partner ordered an omelet with potatoes.  After about 15 minutes the server came to tell us they were out of potatoes and offered grits as a substitute - neither of us  Are grits fans so she offered toast - fine  My plate arrived with scrambled eggs soggy bacon and grits  - the omelet came with just the omelet with the promise of toast.  My toast came the same color and texture it came out if the wrapper  - I politely  asked that it be toasted   - taken away  - arrived again the same - delivered by a floor manager - I asked again if it could please be toasted and could the other order of toast be delivered??   Finally after  we had eaten our breakfast the toast arrived un buttered  -  I asked if it would be possible to have some butter  - the floor manager arrived with a small container of ice cold hard butter.   Really - certain not paying any attention -   For a breakfast of $43.00 i certainly expected more. - never again   A Chicagoan in Charlotte

wOpjhcKbSl1lkuh2RDt0Fg.text: This place makes my heart happy because brunching here is perfect. Expect to wait, but they have plenty of seats on their outside porch so it's hardly a bother.   When you get seated, you get warm southerner biscuits with blueberry jam    The menu has about a thousand and one amazing things you have to try. I had eggs, Brussels, and Mac n cheese. Unfortunately the Brussels were a disappointment. Brussels are my favorite thing in the world but even I can cook them better than that. The mac n cheese though .. That was heavenly. Cooked to perfection. My eggs came out cold which was a bit of a bummer but we're still yummy.   Everything from the burgers to waffles looked amazing as it came out of the kitchen. Definitely want to go back and try some other items on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Veggie bowl with fried okra &amp; grits
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Heaaaaavenly Mac n cheese
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brussels weren&#39;t that yummy :(

FSaX2nQxvwakPYgL3bzrAA.text: My husband and I ate a late lunch here on a Saturday and the place was PACKED so we sat by the kitchen bar since there was no wait and we loved the seats because we got to see how the cooks make the food and how they plate and all that jazz. All I can say is that those boys can make some great food and they go 100 miles per hour!   Our sever was very nice and she was really busy so I appreciate good service when the place is packed.   The food was so good! I ordered a black bean burger and fried okra. We also got biscuits with honey and jam and they were amazing. Next time I go I want to try their breakfast. They do serve breakfast all day which is nice.  There were a lot of tables with kids and families so this place is kid friendly too.

foEmrgFY8oHTc1x9yNQPZQ.text: Great biscuits. Great honey. Service was wonderful. A bit noisy but overall a very good bruch today.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States

FTpAcnX0kp2ge0Kv4comRQ.text: This is one of the best places in the Charlotte area to eat! Everything is homemade and cooked to perfection. The ambience is phenomenal, a place to see and be seen. Highly recommended!

iBNEzDhsZFjHsrsjBgM-YQ.text: Great location, great menu & great food. If you are fortunate enough to have Brenda look after you, you are truly blessed!

o0BHtv6fsJEhwKDDzT_cGA.text: Get. The. Biscuits. Pour honey on your plate. Dip biscuits in honey. Enjoy. You're welcome! Also love the fried chicken - certainly appropriate for 2 to share.

iSk75u-OjqADW8D-rUgBRg.text: Had a great time at Tupelo Honey today! Our server, William, was amazing! Check out the baked eggs.

6tcJyNarS0nFqmZathINLw.text: We came here after a running event and loved it!  It was our first time here and they did not disappoint.  It was a crowded brunch, but we were sat within 15 minutes of arriving.  We enjoyed mimosas and had the fried green tomatoes for an app.  They were de-lish!  Crunchy and crispy on top of cheesy grits.  We also tried the sweet potato pancakes with fried chicken and pecans.  OMG!  They were so good!  Next up was an omelet with pickled jalepenos, pimento cheese, fried green tomato, bacon and ham.  This was the biggest omelet I have ever seen.  Both plates were large enough to share so bring a BIG appetite!  The buttermilk biscuits served with blueberry compote and honey were the cherry on top.  LOVED this place!  Will definitely be back!

iAwAIJh3ukpYydKFMPbvjQ.text: I've only lived in Charlotte for 2 weeks but both Sundays I have had brunch here and loved it. My first time I had reservation  (which I highly recommend) and had no wait at all, the other I had a 35 minute wait. I cannot wait to go back there again. The biscuits are amazing (I am from NY so really most southern biscuits are amazing), and the omlettes have been making me come back for more. I cannot wait to try more of their menu.

uldFEPkpbMUouEKybLC-Ng.text: Just ok. The craft drinks were really good but the food was just ok.

-WzOTZP7_X4Mth7norjxvw.text: Biscuits and mimosas were amazing as always. William took care of everything during a busy brunch-highly recommend!

ojuwOepVmf-tPNODlfx5vg.text: Awesome breakfast! Highly recommend the Queen Mary bloody and our server Jamison was the best :)

FFNXKVaDFYD_oeqSCR4F3Q.text: Great food, southern flare, biscuits & jam will make you want to workout for hours (guilty) all of my food was very tasty. And hot!

dYbhKDcZCXoGgsSQxM3fkQ.text: Great little place hardly seen from the road but well worth trip to inspire the mind.

-_Nb4ZIm1LYoWgTTX-VlcQ.text: For the hype and the tons of reviews this place has I thought it might be a little bit better. Presentation of food was OK.

E_ugo433mu-Uc5UP7lYbYg.text: Just went to my first Moonrise buffet. What a great idea! 9pm on they put out  great little spread Friday and Saturday nights. I'll definitely be doing this the next time I go to the movies. Love this. Love my Tupelo!

qi-YPH1t2A4z3TuxU-n1Eg.text: Unique and delicious food. Ask for Jonathan as you're server, he is GREAT at his job and will take excellent care of you. One of the best servers we've ever had at any restaurant! We will definitely be back!

ZdQQInMFC5W2PzeW3IospQ.text: Had breakfast here before dropping my dad off for the airport. I was unsure if the wait was long at 9:30 am, Sunday brunch and all, but we were seated immediately.  Atmosphere was open and inviting at their patio as well as in the restaurant.  Biscuits were insanely good, and free. Dad had the sweet potato pancakes and they were great, with just the right sweetness for the pancake itself. I ordered the shrimp and grits and it was creamy, cheesy, and with the chorizo, had a good kick!  The service made all the difference for my experience though. Carly (If I spelled your name wrong, I apologize) could've been simply standard. However, she was incredibly friendly,attentive (but not annoyingly attentive) to our table, and gave suggestions. She was a multitasking wizard, getting our waters/coffees refilled while also holding conversations with us and the rest of her table. After telling her we were headed to the airport she asked us if my dad wanted a coffee to go for the trip. Gotta say it again, the service really made my time at Tupelo Honey in Charlotte super awesome!

k1xnWmlOjsvJ1LjjrZvHLA.text: We're fans of the Asheville location and were thrilled when Tupelo Honey came to Charlotte!  It did not disappoint.  The hostesses were great and greeted us with a smile, even though the wait was long (Saturday at lunch took about 40-45 minutes for our table of 4  to be seated.  Which we expected, it just opened!) Lunch was fabulous.  I love their kids' menu--their philosophy is that kids can eat the same offerings as the grown-up menu, and my four year old had fried okra, sweet potato fries, and honey glazed fruit salad.  Maybe not the healthiest, but better than processed nuggets and greasy fries! The rest of us loved it.  The open-faced Mamie's veggie sandwich was good, my husband enjoyed the Shoo grilled cheese, and my oldest girl loved her chicken and biscuits--With a side of Brussels sprouts because you always need something green!  We finished off the meal with a Cheerwine float and banana pudding.  This was a real treat, and I can't wait to go with friends! (They do have an elevator for those that need it, but we just took the stairs.)

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yay!
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Outdoor waiting area
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Outdoor seating area

03_C0VCA6dFssXVGs5IRyg.text: Great food/atmosphere - fried okra is my fave Lunch/Dinner is great, Brunch selection is more limited  Does not take reservations for groups less than 8 people which is annoying Usually has a very long wait & bar is always packed

Cc21ZGH-blfKwcHoLzT1jA.text: Glad this was not our 1st Tupelo experience. This particular restaurant seemed not to care about the cleanness or quality of its food and restaurant. The bar area was dirty. Glasses were piled up and oranges that had been zested sat next to personal binders on countertop. The bar tender never cleared away plates. Another worker who was in restroom with me left her stall with toilet paper on floor. Empty rolls on floor and toilet paper holder was broken. Didn't even bother trying to pick it up.  Food- blueberry jam was cold and dry. The grit croutons were not impressive. My salmon with the glaze was not good. Drenched in glaze (which wasn't good in the first place). My two sides weren't as good as another Tupelo's I've been to in another state.

yeQtqq4FRPz4lqTkkWgOPQ.text: Tupelo is fantastic. My family chose to do an assortment of appetizers on this visit. The pork belly was fantastic and the fried okra was divine. We can't wait to come back!

OgP7ytN7Pl2YzfajY19uOQ.text: Great spot to check out!   -Atmosphere: Excellent! The design and feel of the place is well done.  -The staff: Nice job guys! Staff was friendly, attentive, and entertaining. -The Food: Delicious! It was fresh and noticed the difference in ingredient quality. The biscuits are amazing.  The reason for 4 stars is the price. It's just a little too high and keeps me from being a regular.

G2vwNhnWPQqRLlC3KX_bwQ.text: Food is amazing! Love the fried green tomatoes! Our server William was awesome. Definitely wil be coming back here soon!

yAP3XVxs44s71KfAfv7pDA.text: I'm from Asheville and when I found out this restaurant was here I was so excited!! Unfortunately, our waitress didn't seem to care we were there, or hungry.  The food was very bland and it took 2 of us an hour and a half from the time we set down to the time we got our check. Very disappointed.

E0do4R8U9ZNYW_PlouCzpA.text: Other than the sweet waitress, the experience was less than stellar.  High priced food was quite average.  The waitress acknowledged the chef is new and still being trained (including by her, I should mention).  The manager was kind, asked specifically how my salad was, and comped it when I truthfully told him it was not great.  It was a disappointing experience and I'm not sure I'll ever go back.  Too many other options.

mOsVfOc-6Ok4bzVVf5Aixg.text: 1/11/17 If I could I would give this restaurant 10 stars The Delmonaco Steak sandwich was absolutely fantastic  James our waitress was great  Service was great And the manager AJ stopped by our table to see if everything was OK I had made a complaint about my previous visit and  AJ took care of that matter in a very good and professional way I will gladly go back as well as recommend this restaurant to my friends also!

tJYVLb0SDoCaVh9lBITXEg.text: First: they're coming to Raleigh.   October can't get here fast enough!  The south end of Charlotte has lots of Good Eats (sorry, Alton) and Tupelo Honey which is Great Eats!    Good, well prepared fresh ingredients make food that just makes you want more. My waiter even said, "hey, it's a judgement-free zone". The service was great, love the space and feel of the Cafe.   The Banana pudding was so good I bought the cookbook (first cookbook, the yellow one) to get the recipe.   Had a pork sandwich, sort of like the version served in the Midwest, but with apple slices, havarti and cheddar and a siracha aioli. Complemented with excellent brown-butter Brussel sprouts. It was beyond delicious!  They also serve everything on the menu (breakfast) all day (breakfast4dinner). How can you go wrong?  Did I mention they're coming to Raleigh?  I'll be at the front door on opening day. Can't wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. The pork sandwich and brown butter Brussel sprouts
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. The banana pudding. Mmmmmmmmmm!

lf2RmXxMySZQbhgFBeetBQ.text: My husband and I ate lunch here today and surprisingly, it was our first time here.  So mad that we have waited so long. We both were very impressed with the service, ambience and food. I got the wicked chicken biscuit and our amazingly awesome server, William recommended that I get the potato cluckers or something like that as a side. So glad I did. The wicked chicken sandwich/biscuit was SO good. My entire plate was empty, I didn't leave a crumb. My husband got a breakfast plate and said it was all great but the biscuits and grits were both out of this world. We also both got the house margarita and it was great with a chili sugared salt rim. We were really impressed. Then as I was walking to my car, our server, William ran out to chase me down in the rain to return my cell phone to me that I left on the table. We will be back very soon, like hopefully this weekend!!!

1hmW92yJsBRHxDC09EasTw.text: Atmosphere, food, waite staff, all wonderful. William was our waiter, not easy to take care of 5 very talkative women but he did it very well!! Regular customer.

vL09CBwvGG-Qxea8m1jdKw.text: This place was truly incredible! We were visiting from out of town and from the minute of walking in the front door, the place smelled like some good southern hospitality and home cooking! Our waitress was really friendly and patient; which is actually a big thing for me. Dishes came in huge portions and were timely. The fried chicken breast had no bones, and was perfectly seasoned to a mouth watering crisp. They had a awesome selection of flavors for hot sauce or just sauces in general. In addition to my meal I had a sweet potato pancake (yes!) and my gf enjoyed a blackened catfish meal. Food was on point, and I will certainly be back all the way down from New York!

Hp41xJK83GxcgahZLi8G-w.text: Recommended by a local friend, Tupelo Honey Cafe exceeded our expectations! A few of us went for lunch at the end of March, but since then I have constantly been taking about the food and service with my friends and family. I tried the Queen Mary which was a unique drink and very delicious, followed by the Shoo Mercy pancakes, a meal I have bragged about to all my friends. The sweet potato pancakes were on point, the fried chicken breast was very juicy, and the bacon, pecans, powdered sugar, and maple syrup sent me into brunch heaven.  To top things off, our server Lynn was extremely sweet, very energetic, and made great recommendations for us visiting for the first time.  Coming from the food industry myself, there are those servers who are good at their jobs, then there are servers like Lynn who take the dining experience to the next level. Thank you Lynn and hope you treat yourself with a Queen Mary!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shoo Mercy Pancakes
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Queen Mary (Bloody Mary)

ppDHG-EWr1ssa5uvh9_lTA.text: Wow......Where to start?!!! I was in Asheville for business and was in the mood for breakfast food. I parked a few blocks away and decided to let my nose lead the way. I walked by several coffee shops before I decided on Tupelo Honey Cafe. I looked it up on Yelp and notice the star rating so I said,"What the heck"!!! I didn't read the review until after I ate. I glanced over the menu and stumble across Shoo Mercy Sweet Potato Pancake. It was a sweet potato pancake with bacon on top, a fried chicken breast on top of that, roasted  pecans and maple syrup. I have to say, it was the best pancake combo I've ever had in my life!!! Shrimp and grits was also ordered as well. For $21, I would have expected more that 4 medium size shrimp. But I was told that is was awesome!!! Before the meal arrived, we receive biscuits with honey and preserves which was awesome as well!!! I will be back and that's a promise!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and Grits
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shoo Mercy Pancake

q6ObCKocjlv7m1NK8mDSAA.text: I have never eaten at a THC before today but this was worth the wait.  The biscuit appetizer was incredible, as was both of our meals (Crab benedict and Shoo Mercy Omlette).  Would highly recommend to first timers or repeats customers alike.  Also, William was a attentive and engaging server.  He gets 5 stars as well.  Thanks again!

pkCrC7eXbmuXYzFqW42BrQ.text: First time here with my spouse and Sam was outstanding!  Great recommendations from him and we truly enjoyed our brunch there!  Anything they do with bacon there is one of kind and we loved our bloody Mary's,  with bacon in it!  The bacon jam was probably the best thing I've ever had!

BEo42SS9K5_hL4FWoA-zOg.text: I have been here plenty times and loved my food and service. This Morning my husband and I came for brunch and this will definitely be my last time coming. Our waitress Julie was HORRIBLE! I've never seen someone with a such a rude attitude serving in a restaurant in my life. My husband asked her about our food because it was taking a very long time and she stated she did know know she needed to explain why our food was taking so long to come out and then rolled her eyes... The food was dried and burned and we had to send it back... Will never come back even thought the manager apologized and fixed it! He was the plus!

rEIwmjY274rzmo-x7jQ_aA.text: Went here for brunch. The sweet potato pancake was great, but not worth the wait. I liked that they had biscuits when you sit down.

CZhH_HNTES9oy9-XCKPJBw.text: Worst service ever. Reservation at 11:15a....finally hunted down waitress for her to take our food order...45 min later. Served our food just before 1p. Had to chase down for refills which only actually materialized once...empty cups for our extra long wait. Table next to us left...which may have been why we got our food at all.   Blame hostess - she sat 4 tables back to back. Manager was useless and didn't seem to care.

pnS7nHPG5nqqtBc_zIuIVA.text: Have been to both the Charlotte and Asheville locations. Food is fantastic. Ordered omelets and French toast. Amazing bloody Mary's too. Service is spot on and the restaurant is clean. A little pricey for breakfast, but you get what you pay for.

CL2oxloMPr56IRPusF5jOw.text: Excellence in breakfast was achieved at this restaurant. Great quality in all aspects of food and drink. Good service and a good variety on the menu. I wanted to try everything and will be back to work on that.

CJgvW8SW8yoGZyilYdQdXw.text: I came here with my mother after church on Sunday for brunch, and we had a bit of a wait, but it was well worth it. Our server Jamison was fantastic. My mother left her sweater in the seat and he ran out in the rain to bring it to us. We both had the bowl (minus the black eyed peas - per Jamison's advice) and the grits were fantastic. Would definitely recommend this one.

VCtGwhkCEnk32SJITY-RvQ.text: Went for dinner last night with another couple. We shared an order of fried green tomatoes and crispy brussel sprouts. Each was good, but nothing memorable. For our meals were an order of sweet potato pancakes, it went half uneaten. An order of shrimp and grits, which my friend did not care for their grits. An flake steak, which was quite spicy from the peppers it was topped with. It was cooked well and had a good flavor. And lastly there was an order of ribs that came out burnt with sauce over the top. These were sent back and came back cooked better. Over all the table agreed the food was ok, but not good and not a place we would come back to. (At least not for dinner, maybe breakfast is better?) Also the food was over priced for what we got and how it tasted. The staff/servers were all quite nice and friendly. But over all we were disappointed with our experience here.

jJwJYf7jCiNBw3OkcFHOtA.text: My wife and I went there last night for our 17th anniversary. For $18 I was looking forward to the buttermilk chicken and it was AWFUL  wasn't no flavor and it wasn't crispy at all. For $18 you get a chicken breast and two sides and I was expecting a lot more for that price. I must admit the fries and macaroni and cheese was great and that's about it.  Too much hype for that place.

xB3SIjqYCVij5qnKOwRf2Q.text: Came here for my birthday brunch. It was my 1st visit and I was not disappointed! The Shoo Mercy Pancake dish was amazing! Even better than the food (which again, was excellent) was the service. The staff here is attentive and kind. Our server Jonathan went above and beyond to make us feel welcome. He explained the menu and made suggestions while keeping my friend's allergy in mind. I will definitely be back sooner rather than later.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States

xiY_sLCEge5yaTYyb1C0Uw.text: After trying this place in Asheville, was super delighted to see a location in Charlotte. Always such great food, and not to mention the great cocktails too!

PRnInmUmx8fv1E8bHv6xPQ.text: My boyfriend and I went here late afternoon on a Monday.  We have been wanting to try the pace but the fact that dogs are allowed made the decision easy to make.  Our server,  Dylan, was the best.  He had great recommendations for all aspects of the menu including cocktails. He explained that the establishment is farm to fork including non-hormone or genetically enjeneered foods and that all of the food is made onsite.  Everything we had was outstanding; the bloody mary, the Margarita,  the complimentary biscuits and our entrees.  Yum.  Thanks Dylan for making it a great meal experience! Highly recommended.

GN0h9xk0gYvphjO369aZuQ.text: I would give this location a one but, I don't want to dissuade people from trying other locations-I have had nice experiences at both the Ashville, NC and Greenville, Sc restaurants    It was a very disorganized mob scene and they honored our reservation after a 20 minute wait. As Jerry Seinfeld says" anyone can take reservations, it is the holding that counts".   Sat at our table another full hour without being served our main course. Eggs and grits-not complex! The waiter just kept telling us that Sunday brunch is always slammed. So my advise is don't go on Sunday morning.   My food was so, so-I was beyond hungry by then and my sons eggs were cold-how did they manage delayed service and cold food?  On second floor, steep stair walk up and available elevator near street. Adequate parking lot, casual dress, prices are average, and full bar.

_qyrlxuMle2KFWTi8UVAbA.text: Eggs Betty is always a win win in my book. Carrie took amazing care of me and management was sure to stop by and check in on my experience.

WUbVteVOm3a7z60oP4zWtA.text: We have been here several times for brunch and usually good. We decided to try dinner and it was awful! They sat us in the bar side and it was freezing, even my husband was cold. The waitress was ok but never really seemed to check back and took forever to get our bill. Food was terrible. Fried green tomatoes would have been good but the grits were cold and the tomatoes Luke warm. Biscuits were cold and tasted stale. I got fried chicken and it was soggy not crispy and the Mac and cheese was dry. Husband got the ribs and they were ok not extremely tender. I heard others complain about food not being hot. We should have said something but we wanted to get out of there as it overall was poor. They should have noticed when we had half our plates not touched and didn't want a box...Definitely won't come back for dinner... maybe will try brunch again when it's so busy food has to be hot.

FmN6gBm_OQnO5VkSqERR8A.text: We had SUCH a great experience here this afternoon! Alicia was THE BEST server! She's hilarious! --- Almost as great as the food! Ha! The food was outstanding. The Queen Bloody Mary disappeared from my glass too quickly. ;-)

C7WM639GAZpvxU58f4Xzlw.text: Until today I wasnt sure what brunch was. I went in and sat on the patio with my wife, and the patio is cool. It was pretty hot but still felt nice. Our server was Hollyday and she took good care of us. The building is really neat and when I asked she told us all about its history, and answered all of our questions about honey and tupelo (cool stuff!). We got the breakfast bowl and the harvest bowl which were both good. We also got bloodymarys because of there awards for being the best in charlotte at the front. Service was good Food was good Tupelo honey is great

b9ZMGJfsGXDaWAMyWvnK8w.text: Ordered the Scarlet beet salad with goat cheese and spiced pecans, and added shrimp. It was delicious! Large portion. I brought half of it home with me.  I had not been to Tupelo Honey in awhile and forgot about the warm biscuits served with honey and a side of their jam. Delicious! It was hard to not eat the whole biscuit but I ate half and took the other half home too. I wish I knew how to make those spices pecans at home.

fsTb2TNrsUbBPYF-rYhVVQ.text: I'm giving it 4 stars for now bc our main entrees came out wrong and then when they came back my fried egg blt was mediocre, it was missing the jalapeno aioli and the bacon was semi cooked . I ended up sending my sandwich back and the waitress was super attentive she had the general manager greet us . The General manager was very apologetic stating their quality is not usually rushed and paid for our entire meal asking us to come back to receive a better experience, I would've come back anyway because the Mac and cheese was delicious as well as the free biscuits. It's always a plus when the establishment values their customer's opinions .

Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Make your own omelet
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Biscuit with blueberry jam

hzYvK-85uS541JCZJOWFMQ.text: I have only been here twice, but had amazing experiences both times. Yesterday I took my mother who was visiting from New York for breakfast. Their coffee is very good, I was even able to drink it black which I only do with a select few coffees, and of course the biscuits were as delectable as always! I got the sweet potato pancake and a side of scrambled eggs, which was amazing! I wanted to finish it so badly but I was so full my stomach just couldn't eat any more! I also had a mimosa which was perfect other than I had to wait until noon to drink it, but that's not their fault that we are in the Bible Belt! Will definitely be coming back! My mom was excited to come back and visit....and come back to Tupelo honey, which says a lot about this place! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. A little bit of a wait, but so worth it!

ZKb5ilu3qTBkO6wYLU7KjQ.text: This places has excellent food and service. The fried chicken and biscuits are delicious. I recommend trying this place however for brunch it tends to get crowded so be prepared to wait

QQsA0I1oE57yNJ10MN_U1A.text: Sunday Funday pre-game brunch! Now that the brunch bill had passed, I revel in early mimosa drinking in Sunday's. Came to Tupelo Honey for a pre Panther's game brunch with 2 friends. We actually made a reservation on Open Table becuase we knew it would get packed quickly and it did. Btw if you didn't get the clue, you can make a reservation on Open Table. When we arrived, we were seated immediately. We ordered a round of mimosas and every single time I order a mimosa here, I forget that they use fresh orange juice and it has the pulp. I'm not a fan of pulp but I drank it anyway. They brought us the delicious biscuits and I drizzled honey on mine. I ordered the BLT chicken sandwich with a side of the goat cheese grits. Their grits are so creamy and delicious with the goat cheese. The chicken sandwich is good. I subbed the dijon mustard for the cranberry bbq sauce. The sauce is a bit tart bc of the cranberries but I like it. I love Tupelo Honey and visit often.

c2ynOr-dpmp67n9XgETZQg.text: Where do I start?!?!? Seriously one of the best meals I have had. It all started when we walked in and was greeted by the hostess. She was very kind and quickly brought us to a lovely table. Our server, Julie, was quick to check in on our table and answered our questions about the menu. Julie was amazing with the service she provided from start to finish!  Now for the food...holy moly, it was out of this world. True southern food, everything made from scratch in house, farm to table. Every bite was better than the next!   We had the brussel sprouts to start and the homemade ranch wonderfully complimented the delicious fried gems! I have had buttermilk biscuits before, but nothing compared to the buttermilk biscuit I enjoyed tonight. The accompanying honey and house made blueberry jam were icing on the cake, or biscuit in this case. We washed our delicious meal down with a tasty tropical drink in a pineapple and a craft root beer! Yes a whole pineapple. The fried chicken was on point, the ribs were fall off the bone, and all the sides (potato cracklings, corn souffle, real southern grits, and fresh green beans) were tasty!!  No meal would be complete without desert...no idea how we were able to consume it, but we somehow managed. Per Julie's recommendation we had the banana pudding and the pecan pie....both were out of this world, balanced, and neither overly sweet.   Bottom line...this is a must stop food spot!

Rh76VxzAUrGuWpu3LX7wmA.text: I loved the atmosphere and the upstairs dining. As soon as we walked in we were greeted by two young hostesses. The two young ladies were pleasant. Then Hailey comes, she takes a look at us, and tells one of the hostesses something. The young lady directs us to a table where two people are already seated. They get up and we're told here's your table! I'm like...what?! What just happened here? I asked the hostess why was the other couple leaving, and why are you putting us here? She's a bit clueless and assumes they wanted to sit elsewhere. And my guess is, soooo you keep the plates, fork and knives here, that were here with the previous couple and plop me and my nephew here...cause we look like you can treat us that way hmmm?! I asked the hostess who told you to seat us here...she said Hailey. I gave her the look (some of you may know the look, some may not. It was that look!) and I responded with, "Hailey is Her Name?!" I guess word got back to Hailey, who then came back, and sat me and my nephew someplace else.  Now that that's over, we sat down at another table, our server came by who was very pleasant and on top of her game! Holiday was her name. We started off with non-alcoholic drinks, segued to our delicious appetizers, and then onto our main course! I absolutely enjoyed our food, I cannot say one bad thing about the entire meal! I do want to return. I honestly don't ever want to feel like you can look at me, and judge me as if I'm not used to fine dining! Not a good feel or good look for any establishment! I would've given 5 stars, but Haileys behavior was unacceptable!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States

XCf8cfrzg5i0c0gZHtizgQ.text: Came back to my new favorite brunch spot in Charlotte. Service wasn't as great this time. I think because they were pack. I hardly complain about things, but my coffee was cold, had to ask for a spoon for my coffee, silverware and napkin, and after waiting about 30mins for my food to come out, it was cold and my eggs were runny after requesting med-well. Although I was starving at this point and would've ate it anyway, the waiter insisted on taking the food back to have another one prepared. I still like the place and will come back. Today just wasn't their day.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Steak n eggs
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Relaxing outdoor seating.
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. A great way to start off a Saturday morning.

jYLkZZiwhLhtc3ZjdUISUw.text: Sometimes, it is all about location, location, location which is where this place has got it right! Although it can be very "promising", make sure you aren't in a hurry before coming. However, It is a hotspot during Sunday brunch. When most of us don't care what time it is anyway.  Located in the center of "Southend", Tupelo Honey is where it's at! I have eaten here for years and recommend it to friends and family. It is somewhere I go when I have extra cash and looking to impress. Haven't seen a friend in awhile and have PLENTY of time to catch up? Well, then this is the place to go. Why? Because the service moves very slow. Not sure if they do this because they believe, the longer you're there the more you will spend, but It happens every time I visit. However, this is the only thing I can find wrong with it.  Aside from the slow service, I think the food is to die for! It is healthy and hearty, and the portions are huge. Definitely not a tapas restaurant here! During my latest visit, I had the eggs Benedict with goat cheese grits. I love anything with goat cheese so I went with my gut, and boy was I right!   this restaurant is unique because they bring a fancy twist to Southern style food. Furthermore, the street side view is amazing from the luxurious balcony seating.The perfect spot to enjoy your farm fresh meal on a warm summer day!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. eggs Benedict w/ goat cheese grits

1VyksQIPpJoV-qt7kqqvwA.text: There's one thing you can bring to Brunch at Tupelo Honey Cafe, and that's your appetite.  There are pretty much two items you can find in any of their brunch items:  Grits or Eggs.  As long as you like one of these two ingredients, you'll be happy.  The menu of brunch items isn't huge, but the selection is great.  I had the Jalapeno Fried Egg BLT.  The jalapeno aioli set this sandwich apart from from a regular BLT.  Delicious and not spicy, but flavorful.  The Southern Breakfast Bowl was definitely not what I pictured.  It kind of looked like a bowl of beans, grits and eggs.  It looked interesting, but I think I'll try another one of their southern-inspired items on the menu next time.  But there was one delicious treat that I didn't expect.  Step aside, Red Lobster cheddar biscuit...make room for Tupelo Honey Cafe biscuit and jam!  Flavorful and yummy.  This in itself was a reason to go to this place.  Overall, the coffee was good, the breakfast was tasty, and the service was friendly.  This is a perfect, sit-down place to get brunch with a friend or your family.  I'll definitely be back for that biscuit.

y80_mLXcmSmEv04YDPyaCA.text: Been here four times now and the past three the quality of food and service has been terrible. The food came out cold and soaked in grease. The wait staff didn't care enough to make it again so we just left without eating.

tn3STrjsORyD_pebjVtWvA.text: I love southern comfort food and this place really hit the spot. Ingredients were fresh, menu was classic but elevated and there was a nice charming vibe to the whole place.   We shared the fried okra and green tomatoes and burrata cheese as an appetizer. Then had the shrimp and grits with chorizo as our main dish. It came out with complimentary biscuits with a side of honey and jam. Pretty much devoured everything and didn't have room for dessert.   Service wasn't fussy but really attentive. All around a great experience.

chEXeT8G_688-e1_y9WHmw.text: I wasn't sure what to expect going in; a friend just dragged me in saying "Trust me, you'll love it!"   He was right, I loved it! The mix of foods and flavors was not a typical offering at all, but a mix of some good 'ol southern cooking and some Cajun and/or Creole flavors that were a real treat, and I can't wait to go again. I've come to expect a "plainness", or unexciting mouth-feel and taste from most of today's quick restaurants, but this wasn't the case at all. The food filled my mouth with flavor, hitting on various parts of my tongue, much like a fine, full-bodied wine. Sounds a bit hokie I know, but that's the best way I can think of to describe the experience. The tastes were full and distinctive: savory and salty and sweet, all in the same bite. Definitely a real treat!   My review is based off a single, first time visit, and if I lived just a little closer, I'd have gone back several times already.   I was shocked to learn as I was leaving that it's actually a chain restaurant. I asked. The food and flavors were much more like a local Mom & Pop place, which I tend to seek out. Regardless, "I'll be back!"

N9LmBMZBYJqRBTeS0k8q9w.text: Tupelo Honey isn't what I remember it to be. We arrived for a Saturday brunch mid morning, early afternoon and found  the bar mostly empty. We decided to grab a seat at the bar for convenience. There was one bartender behind the bar, who seemed more than a little irritated that we decided to sit there. She was busy making all of the drinks for the remainder of the restaurant, and wasn't able to provide the best customer service to the customers sitting at the bar (it steadily got busier over the course of our visit).   Tupelo has a decent selection of Mimosas and Bloody Marys, which was by far the bright spot of our visit.  I've eaten here a few times in the past, and always remembered a broad selection of standard breakfast fare, as well as some more interesting plates to choose from. It seems now that the entire menu is trying too hard, for lack of a better phrase. I ordered the Appalachian breakfast, and my other guest ordered the hash. Both of our plates came out with cold eggs.   With so many different places to choose from to eat brunch with consistent service and at least better (hotter) food, I'm going to scratch Tupelo off the list for now.

q0XKLGVjqjHapQkZSUWvLg.text: Very cool and upbeat brunch spot. Get there early because it fills up quickly after 10am

slxVZitZjLIwT9N2DwBM9w.text: Well, have been to other locations so I will start by saying my expectations were . We walked into an empty restaurant and promptly asked if we had reservations rather than receiving a warm greeting. Once we got our food, old school breakfast bowl (poorly presented- looked like a pile of slop) & the avocado toast  (WARNING! ITS NOT ON TOAST BUT AN INEDIBLE INCH AND A HALF THICK AS WELL AS WIDE BLOCK OF STALE HARD BREAD- the chef called it artisan?I'djust like palatable food! ). Disappointment central. I finally asked for some whole grain toast - was told there was none but only sourdough. After a minimum of 10 additional minutes the chef brough out some SAD dry bread (not even toasted see photo) and mentions they had a multi gain bread. Seriously? So we get the bill. I'm charged for the sad white bread. We were charged FOR EACH CUP of coffee, not per person ( no coffee refills?!?!?) We will never be back. This place is a total disgrace to breakfast and brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States

0UIcIDoBe6Iv0M8lO9qXTQ.text: We had a party of 4 and we ordered the fried green tomatoes as our appetizer and they were ok they were very very thick....  Fried Chicken was not very good had a funny taste so my husband sent it back.  He thinks grease needed to be changed.  Hamburgers were pretty good.  Server was ok at best.  Very slow at getting condiments after our burgers were delivered.  Manager came to our table and was very very nice and asked if he could do anything.  Maybe just not our style.

XaU1Jy_IcO7IZMVzjfxAkQ.text: If I could rate this place with no stars I would. I don't know if they were just having an off day but waiting an hour for overpriced and mediocre food to be delivered to our table with lackluster enthusiasm are not traits of an establishment I care to frequent.  I paid $21 for 4 meager strips of steak in my "Steak and Eggs" - I've had more steak in a budget burrito at Taco Bell.  The half of a potato worth of a side was laughable too; laughable by the ownership I'm sure when they realize they are taking in a 150% profit off of screwing people out of an entree. I can't help to feel a little ripped off.  All of our eggs which were to be poached ended up being mostly underdone, my moms "fried green tomato" sandwich had red tomatoes, our drinks went unfilled for long periods of time, and zero f***ks were given by our waitress.   Never. Again.

RECFD6KlQ7tVPeGh1AcaHg.text: Great food great customer service. A little too loud do my liking.  But it's a busy place, so make your reservations.  A manager stopped by to make sure we were happy.  Their menu changes often so if you see something here on yelp you want to try, they might not have it. I learned it happens a lot in Noeth Charlotte. Since they cook seasonally.  Which is awesome for locals but not very cool for visitors.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States

lVC5Sz0QAhkpNgTzBeStmA.text: Not impressed. I've eaten at the original and there is no comparison. The sausage was dry. We never did get the eggs we ordered. I ordered the salted beet salad with goat cheese. The beets...I found six teeny tiny pieces underneath the greens. Then there was the overcooked and scorched Mac and Cheese. I had to clutch my pearls! SCORCHED MAC AND CHEESE!!! What the what??? I will say, however, the biscuits were really, really good. But there was no honey butter. Where was the honey butter? And the peach butter that they used to serve with the sweet potato pancakes? Where was it? Twice I heard, "I'm sorry. We no longer serve that." My waitress was sweet as can be, but slow as sludge.  Go, if you feel you must. As for me and mine...not so much.

PDunalMpr91BmXqUbaJgZw.text: Stopped by here for dinner as it appeared to have more veggie options for my friend. We were immediately seated and offered their complimentary biscuits while we looked over the menu. The biscuits were light and fluffy in taste and came with what appeared to be blackberry jam. It may have had some cracked black pepper on the top as well.   I ordered the Southern fried chicken BLT and fries while she ordered their  black bean burger. I thoroughly enjoyed my sandwich and even tried some of her black bean burger as a meat eater the texture was off for me but it was seasoned extremely well. She also ordered one of their margaritas, I opted for a local brew. The service was superb, we were checked on often throughout the night. The location is great and I can't wait to use the outdoor seating that looked extremely comfy. Also the elevator was a great addition after a night of drinks. great job there. Will definitely be back, two thumbs up over here.

ZX5hcHpU3NrrycoISVDB4Q.text: Recently visited this location while coming through town and can positively say we were very impressed and look forward to our next trip to Charlotte. My girlfriend and I ordered the Fried Green Tomatoes and they were absolutely Devine so much better than I expected them to top it off our server "Allie" was top notch and provided us with outstanding service. When we come back we will ask for her by name as she left a lasting impression with her contagious smile and wonderful service!

HYWT3dz9uT2ShKcmPFp94A.text: I have been wanting to try this place for a long time. Finally the chance came when my friend wanted brunch and I couldn't figure out a good place to go that was open before 11:30. The restaurant is definitely cute in terms of decor and feeling welcoming, but the positives of the vibes probably end there. To be fair, we sat inside - not that the hostess even bothered to ask about a preference, but sitting outside could have a nicer ambiance than what I experienced today.   The hostess politely tried to sit us at a very small table at the back of the restaurant. Upon seeing the size of the table, I felt like the plates would be too crowded with drinks and such and requests a larger table as there were 10-15 empty tables. The hostess cops an attitude and walks about to the front to 'check to see if she could do it'. I sheepishly follow her like a lost puppy dog that just got berated for chewing up a shoe. She then takes my friend and I back to the back of the restaurant by the kitchen/washroom door and seats us. Really? All the empty tables and you put us in the back by the kitchen? Honestly the table she sat us at probably shouldn't even be there as the whole time my dining partner was constantly hit/bumped by servers trying to pass through with food/dishes. At one point a waiter actually asked him to move so he could get by. I'm sorry if there isn't room for a customer to sit at this table without being told to move by waitstaff while sitting normally...then that is a good clue the table shouldn't be in that location. Honestly a very awkward and awful experience and that isn't even including the innumerable amount of times I heard distressing loud noises bellowing from the dishwashing area...not what I expect in terms of ambiance when I am paying ~ $20/entree.   Despite the seating issue and the attitude of the hostess the food was amazing! Biscuits were very well balanced with the salt and pepper standing up to the blueberry jam. Ordered the Omelets with pimento cheese, green tomatoes, bacon, and ham. Seriously one of the best omelets I have ever had.   Worth a visit for the high quality ingredients and great tasting food, just be firm about being seated in an area where you won't be treated as a nuisance by staff.

0ljegbG1dB0qiOexkQ99kw.text: Go to place when having visitors to Charlotte. Anytime I have guests this is one of the places I take them along with midwood. Pancakes are ridiculously expensive but the best thing you've ever had. Fried chicken sandwich is the best.

LFvWwMtIgFJBpac8igIHRg.text: As always the food is fresh and service is off the hook. You can tell when an establishment has passion in good food. It tickles down into the amazing service and food cooked with love.   A  must if you are in Charlotte for foodies beware you need to get here early or make a reservation as there is always a line.  Be sure to ask for Johnathan he will make the dining experience worth it. He describes the food and drinks with such skill pictures will appear in your head.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. The new menu everything on here sounds so good. Looks like I am ordering one of everything.
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and Biscuits with gravy simply amazing.
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. My bloody Mary and it was spicy.

BGZYXVqD2aNRdVgUbUdneA.text: Had a delightful brunch with Allie today.... She was sweet & very knowledgeable of the menu ... I picked the shoo pancakes which were great... I will be back

55HSXCOPfnldC5Xj1FeP3w.text: My experience here was most excellent the spicy cauliflower bites are  great I suggest everyone to try them. I will dine here again on my next trip. Thank you Allie for everything looking forward to seeing you again.

_wqgu8CmIzyZNFaIrw-oZg.text: I've been to Tupelo Honey in Asheville and Raleigh and always had great experiences. Today I had brunch at the Charlotte location and was less than impressed.   We had a party of 6 and our reservation was at 12:30. We waited quite a while past 12:30 to be seated, but we didn't mind that so much because they comped us two appetizers for the inconvenience.   The appetizers were great. We got the fried green tomatoes and avocado toast points. My entree wasn't great. I had the Old Skool breakfast bowl, sub scrambled eggs for over easy. My friend ordered the same bowl and had different modifications. When our meals arrived (after a lengthy wait) my scrambled egg bowl had her modifications, and her bowl had over easy eggs but no modifications. This was pointed out to our server. It wasn't a huge deal but since we didn't get what we ordered, a discount might have been appropriate. The bowl itself was sort of flavorless and the grits were dry.   The service was not what I would expect. Our waitress didn't know anything about the drink I ordered (lavender limeade which was delicious by the way). It took a long time to get our food (not the server's fault) and an absurdly long time to get our checks.   I don't think I would return to this location, but would happily return to Asheville or Raleigh!

rOU_EcyYgnMgnI91j7VXWQ.text: I want to love this chain but honestly it's just okay. The best thing on their menu is the biscuits and jam.

65Tyl0BzOGgcYzHwTnvWDg.text: Everytime I come to NC to visit friends I must come here. Fried chicken with biscuits and gravy..... Over easy eggs...   Food coma right after..  I love it. Expect to wait 30 min.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States

ZMKczuav2nA_p0pFuLCvmw.text: Had an AMAZING time this morning at Tupelo Honey!! Our server Cole was the BEST and treated us like Queens! (Yaaas queen) he gave us everything we ordered and it was amazing we also loved Chef D!!!! will be back ASAP For more great food :)

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sweet &amp; Spicy Chicken

dNOLg2QeczhUpsdVKAtBaw.text: Very disappointing. Our server, Kendra, our was friendly but that did not make up for the bland tasting burger that I ordered. I had the pimento burger with fried pickles and it tasted like a paper sandwich. I did not taste the meat. It was as though the burger was washed in water then grilled. The restaurant was extremely packed so if you plan on going, you should call ahead and make reservations. The food prices were overpriced and my burger was not worth $14. I had better burgers at Burger King. I don't think that I will be going back.  I went back on 4/7/2018 to giveTupelo another chance. We had chipotle wings, sweet potato pancakes with eggs and fried chicken, shrimp and grits and fried chicken with gravy, Mac and cheese and collard greens. Totally different experience. Alec was our server and he was great: friendly, attentive and personable. The food was satisfying and came out fast. We went during non peak hours so there was no wait time to be seated. Great time. The food was excellent and the management, Yohan and April made us feel appreciated.

GvEgYI0tDEsD7s790csh_g.text: Always great service, delicious food and refreshing drinks.  It's also got a  porch so you can dine with your dog!  It's a chain but this is one you don't want to miss!  Also amazing for brunch, which is available all day.

-fMr6bV4gT-SPvp1XcSBcA.text: Great place with good food and atmosphere. Morgan was our waitress and she was awesome and very friendly. We will be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Son of peach!

RZM8KWhNtqkteM328RtfZQ.text: Been here twice on various trips to Charlotte and I will definitely keep going. First of all, the biscuits in place of a bread basket are amazing. The blueberry jam served with the biscuits is great, we ate it all right up. On my most recent trip I had an omelet with pimento cheese, jalapenos, fried green tomatoes, ham, bacon, etc (shoo mercy omelet). It was a strange choice for me since I'm not usually an omelet person but it was really good, I'm glad I got it. I believe I got the shrimp and grits on a previous visit and also enjoyed it. My friends all really enjoyed their food, including the breakfast bowls and eggs Benedict.   It is extremely popular and you need to make reservations in advance. Several days before the weekend, the only brunch time slots available were during the 9 am hour. They have a fairly large parking lot attached, but it was practically full but they time we left around 11.   Took one star away because service wasn't as good as it could be on this most recent trip, even though it wasn't crowded when we got there. Took awhile to get coffee refills, etc. Definitely not bad though. Wish they had somewhere to hang your coat, like hooks on the end of the booths- it was unseasonably cold and we didn't know what to do with our coats and bags while sitting in the crowded booth.

OTp_NzzJ72cSXIa5vX2BYg.text: Very good down home cooking, but be warned the portions are huge. Their freshly made biscuits are the best - not too dry.

9cIypT7KNRxFSKSO8MON1w.text: I had always wanted to come here since moving away from NC and finally got a chance when we came to visit Charlotte.  The outdoor seating was perfect - the lighting was nice, great ambiance and it turned out better b/c the inside had full blast A/C so the outside wasn't so cold.  The food is a little bit more expensive but all of it was good - I personally had the tea marinated roasted chicken, very tasty.  The sides were good too.  Also tried their own honey ale and that was good as well!  Overall, very happy I finally got to try it out.

uNamFAJ8OSBfiyKk09_j7w.text: Came two years ago from NYC and we came again here just to eat! The catfish and salmon are amazing! Melissa was our server and she never missed a beat as well as being the friendliest person we've encountered! Will be coming again on our next road trip

q7n497H1FLsQXDeKgtCqVw.text: Took out of town family here for dinner. Service was very good and server Lex very attentive. As they were from the North, they loved every bite of the meal and the interior and  outdoor balcony seating was impressive and beautiful. To a southerner/foodie like myself I'd grade the food about a C+/B- From reading the previous reviews it seems like this is hit or miss, but my visitors loved it so it's good in my book.

pgEW_1wSuthmRTzxMmq_bw.text: After a great soccer or Football game where the Germans were triumphant; my cohort and I stumbled over to Tupelo Honey for some grub. I got the massive portioned Sweet Potato Pancake meal, it has a name but... The food was as usual delicious and the service was great also. If you remember last review we had a bit of a slow service but they definitely stepped up their game and no complaints her. The Manager, a young Hispanic gentleman, came over to say "Hi" and asked how our food and day was. Turns out huge FC Bayern Munich fan and he too was happy at the game's outcome. If you're a good food fan and/or Football fan give this place a look

DHG4g77HlV6huIzwm5T1Hw.text: Lex was a great waitress.  Food was super quick and so so good.  Also the bloody and mimosas were fantastic.     100% coming back and it is super super pet friendly.

2ZM6uozsD4rnCR39LkMAqQ.text: So disappointed in this restaurant. I'm not sure how it can vary in quality so much, but it can't hold a candle to the original Tupelo Honey in Asheville, NC.

yIVGONgrhN9etouMY52zxg.text: The food was awesome. Our server Jay was very personable and catered to our needs. Although busy for Mother's Day he found time to check on us and made us feel like we were his only table. I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mac &amp; Cheese Bites
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Avocado Eggs Benedict

g31zo7mGVOvja13jD8h9jw.text: Great food.  Awesome selection. Love the "upscale southern food" menu.   The hostesses managing the long wait were a bit rude and unhelpful. Other than that it was an enjoyable experience.

f60hShf1Y-gTAuiE26VL-A.text: This used to be my favorite place to eat- all times of the day for all kinds of occasions. At least the location in South End, has turned into the most unprofessional, apathetic place I've ever gone into.   This time was my last time.  They brought me to the back corner by the host stand, removing a sleeve of to-go boxes so I could THEN sit down. My food came out (ALWAYS delicious, which is why I'm giving the two stars) although this time slightly cold and with a clear lack of effort in presentation (and for $22 shrimp and grits...I think they could try harder). Two servers stood right beside me, less than half a foot away, rear end IN my face, messing with her hair, as I tried to eat. Trying to ignore the gossip and flagging down the server to pay and get the hell out of there was when I decided I was never returning.   Now...this was during All Star Weekend, but I would've thought the effort would be stringer with the increase in crowd.

XoCJaPs67pH_BhZdpXOpIw.text: Had green fried tomatoes, that was served over goat cheese grits and roasted red peppers coulis. The grits made the dish, creamy and tasty.   Then we had farmers cheese , aleppo pepper , red chili honey drizzle , on rustic toasted bread.  The bread and cheese mixture was delicious.   All meals come with buttermilk biscuits. It's served with honey and jam.  The biscuits were warm ; soft on the inside and firm on the outside.  They were fabulous.    My meal was the slow roasted blackberry habanero pull pork stacked atop of a pasture raised beef patty. It came with a side of pork belly collards. The pull pork was good, but had some fat in it.  The collards greens were too salty for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Our meals
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Biscuits and honey
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried green tomatoes and avocado on rustic bread

ZxjxTx71sLHD20CQlYmfTg.text: I'm reviewing as a tourist from NYC (by the way).  Overall the experience was really fun and I recommend going there. The biscuits are well known and people were loving them. Prices were cheap (for a nyc gal like myself) and the brunch options were diverse.  I had the harvest bowl and I was really impressed. And for 11 bucks. So much food. Add an egg and only a dollar more. A lot of people were also drinking cocktails but I didn't partake.   Family oriented restaurant too but overall a casual place. Staff was friendly, a bit slow but nothing to complain too much about.

xSo12TS0dZdrj8TPEYu-8w.text: Atmosphere is really cool. The food is ok for the price. Don't be fooled by the mega Mimosa it is only a little bit more alcohol then the regular save your money.

1dG4_1G9o6RzUEtvr-TWBg.text: What an experience!!! From the location. To the welcoming staff, Tupelo Honey Charlotte will forever be in my "must go" to when traveling or working in NC state.   We came into contact with three staff members who had personalities like a long lost best friend. They made us feel welcomed and part of an experience not just a place to eat and leave. They took the time to know how our day was. Where we are from. Why we are here. And what would make our dinner with Tupelo's memorable.   The manager was out meeting people and made her way to our table. When you are there look for a beautiful dark hair lady named Mary Ellen. Other than the food (which I will leave till last) this is what made the experience for me so memorable. She was funny, lent an ear to my silly stories and lame jokes and was very kind. I'm grateful that she came to say hello.   Now the food... OH MY GOODNESS! If you like fried chicken.... Get the buffalo blue cheese crumbles amazingness... I thinks that's what it's called lol. It's close you'll see it. Oh and finish the night up with pecan pie!

mpOesonw1LlU1c0SAXdSRA.text: Yelp 100 Challenge 2018: 32/100  Stumbled upon this place while trying to look for a good lunch spot before heading to the airport and decided to eat on the west side of Charlotte. This is quite a busy place during a random weekday lunch!   I like that there was plenty of parking options behind the restaurant, since it was also close to a metro station. The restaurant is on the second floor, so you will have to take either flight of the stairs to go up. As soon as you walk up the stairs, you will see a very inviting environment, with string lights and cute outdoor seating for those who want to enjoy a nice day outside.   My party was seated inside by the window, and I immediately nerded-out looking at their ceiling fans. Their ceiling fans are connected together by a pulley system, and powered by a motor! Pretty darn cool.   Not knowing what to order, our server first brought us some corn bread to share with some berry-type jam and honey. Mixing the berry jam and the honey together was the best! We then ordered a Grilled cheese pork sandwich and a pork shoulder dish.   I was actually quite disappointed by the pork shoulder dish. I wish that the meat was a bit more juicy, but most of it was rather dry besides the part that has some fat on top of it. It didn't have much flavoring besides the toppings on top of the pork shoulder and I wish they had a dry rub or marinated it a bit before cooking it. The Brussels sprouts sides and the fries were amazing though! And the Grilled Cheese Pork Sandwich totally made up for it! It was sweet and salty all mixed together. Although it was slightly on the oily side, it tasted amazing and I didn't mind.   Overall, I had a great dining experience here. The ambiance here reminds me of a cute southern town, and I just wish I ordered something else on the menu that they were probably more well known for. Until next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Inside of restaurant
Photo of Tupelo Honey - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork shoulder with Brussels sprouts and fries

n46uadeu4wYCNUEnrXp1Yw.text: I've been to Tupelo Honey now twice and absolutely loved both times. I came first for Brunch and then for dinner. The biscuits served are TO DIE FOR!
